NAME: Sun Java Web Proxy Server Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sun Java Socks Proxy is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted socks requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input filed in the socks request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted socks request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Sun Java Web Proxy Server Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the SOCKS proxy support (sockd) in Sun Java Web Proxy Server before 4.0.5 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted packets during protocol negotiation.

NAME: SunRPC XDR xdrmem_getbytes Overflow
DESCRIPTION: XDR libraries derived from SunRPC is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is present in xdrmem_getbytes function and is due to the lack of proper checks while parsing certain RPC fields in the request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: UNIX NFS Export Directory Attempt
DESCRIPTION: The Network File System (NFS) in UNIX allows a host to export some or all of its filesystems, or parts of them, so that other hosts can access them over the network and mount them as if they were on local disks. NFS is built on top of the Sun Remote Procedure Call (RPC) framework.

NAME: IBM AIX rpc.cmsd Calendar Daemon Remote Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM AIX server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on rpc.cmsd data in the rpc request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted rpc request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: MIT Kerberos kadmind RPC Library RPCSEC_GSS Authentication Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: RPC library in MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.6.2 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain craftedRPC requests. The vulnerability exists in the svcauth_gss_validate function in the library and is due to the lack of boundary checkson the length of certain RPC credential data. Since this user-supplied credential data is copied to finite stack buffers, it couldlead to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: MIT Kerberos kadmind RPC Library Unix Authentication Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: RPC library in MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.6.1 and earlier is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain craftedRPC requests. The vulnerability exists in the gssrpc__svcauth_unix function in svc_auth_unix.c in RPC library and is due to thefailure of boundary checks while copying data to finite stack buffers. The boundary check failure is due to a signed comparison of a length value in RPC UNIX flavor credential data with a finite value. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup Portmapper TADDR2UADDR DoS
DESCRIPTION: Computer Associates) BrightStor ARCserve Backup 11.5 SP2 and earlier is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certan crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is present in the RPC Server service (catirpc.exe) , and is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields passed through a crafted TADDR2UADDR. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request, causing a NULL pointer dereference. A successful exploit could crash the service.

NAME: AIX libtt.a rpc.ttdbserver Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: AIX libtt.a rpc.ttdbserver is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted long XDR-encoded ASCII string requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the long XDR-encoded ASCII string request, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted long XDR-encoded ASCII string request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: UNIX Portmapper Remote Infomation Retrieving Attempt
DESCRIPTION: Most Unix server can be retrieved information through a normal portmapper request.

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup caloggerd Opcode 79 Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Computer Associates BrightStor ARCserve Backupproduct. The vulnerability is due to insufficient bounds checking in the user supplied data containedinside the requests sent to the caloggerd service. A remote unauthenticated attacker may leverage thisvulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code on the target host with System level privileges.

NAME: Sun ONC RPC Multiple fragments in One Packet Evasion
DESCRIPTION: This signature is indicated a Sun ONC RPC fragmentation evasion packet.

NAME: IBM AIX ToolTalk Database Server Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM AIX ToolTalk database server (rpc.ttdbserverd) is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is present in the _tt_internal_realpath function which fails to check certain boundary conditions while copying user-supplied input to limited memory buffers. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Novell NetWare NFS Portmapper and RPC Module Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Novell NetWare NFS Portmapper and RPC module is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing malformed RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the RPC request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Sun Solstice Sadmind adm_build_path Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sun Solstice AdminSuite on Solaris 8 and 9 is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is present in the adm_build_path function and is due to the lack of proper checks on supplied input. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: MIT Kerberos Kadmind Rename Principal Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: MIT Kerberos Administration Server (kadmind) is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to insufficient boundary check while handling requests to rename principals. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted RPC request to the kadmind daemon. Successful exploitation may lead to execution of remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Sun RPC TTDB xdr_array Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SunRPC xdr_array filter primitive is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests.External Date Representation (XDR) primitives are routines that allow for uniform representation of basic or constructed data types, regardless of system architecture, by their translation to and from an external representation. However, the xdr_arrayprimitive which translate variable length arrays is prone to an integer overflow when large number of elements are passed to it.Due to lack of boundary checks, a user-supplied integer value is used for memory allocation into which user data is copied later,leading to a buffer overflow.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: MIT Kerberos kadmind RPC Library Uninitialized Pointer Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: RPC library in MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.6.1 and earlier is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain craftedRPC requests. The vulnerability exists in the gssrpc__svcauth_gssapi function in the library and is due memory free of an invalid pointer when the length of a RPC credential field is zero, leading to an exploitable memory corruption. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: Sun Solaris rpc.ypupdated Command Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sun Solaris rpc.ypupdated service is prone to a command injection vulnerability while handling certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to improper user input validation when processing RPC requests. A remote unauthenticated attacker can leverage this vulnerability by sending crafted RPC message to the target host, potentially injecting and executing arbitrary commands with System level privileges.

NAME: Sun ONC RPC Small Piece fragmentation Evasion
DESCRIPTION: This signature is indicated one Sun ONC rpc fragmented packet has been found

NAME: Sun Solaris SAdmin Client Credentials Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sun Solaris SAdmin daemon is prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerabilityexists due to the weak authentication AUTH_SYS that SAdmin uses while handling RPC requests. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby sending crafted RPC requests allowing root access to the server, and thereby allow command execution with root privileges. Asuccessful exploit could allow complete control of the victim server.

NAME: CA BrightStor ArcServe Media Server Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: CA BrightStor ARCserve Media Server provides certain services through SUNRPC messages. However, the server is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to insufficient checks on parameters passed through certain procedures of an RPC request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request to the service on the specified service port. A successful exploit could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system in the context of the server.

NAME: Sun Solaris sadmind RPC Request Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sun Solaris sadmind service is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields passed in an sadmin data. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request to a vulnerable server. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IBM Informix Dynamic Server librpc.dll Buffer Overflows Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Informix Dynamic Server librpc.dll is vulnerable to an overflow condition while parsing malformed RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the RPC requests. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a malformed RPC request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: SunRPC rpc.ypupdated Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sun Solaris rpc.ypupdated service is prone to a command injection vulnerability while handling certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to improper user input validation when processing RPC requests. A remote unauthenticated attacker can leverage this vulnerability by sending crafted RPC message to the target host, potentially injecting and executing arbitrary commands with System level privileges.

NAME: Sun Solaris ypbind PROC_DOMAIN Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Solaris 5.4 through 8 are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability in the ypbind daemon. The vulnerability is due to the lackof boundary checks on the parameters passed to the service running on RPC service number 100007, leading to an exploitableoverflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: REXD Remote Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Certain versions of rexd daemon on Solaris and AIX 3.2 are prone to remote authentication bypass vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests sent to the service. The vulnerability is due to the usage of weak authentication mechanisms that could allow an attacker to gain unprivileged remote access. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request which could allow complete control of the victim server machine.

NAME: Linux Kernel nfsd CAP_MKNOD Security Bypass
DESCRIPTION: Linux kernel nfsd is prone to a security bypass vulnerability while handling certain crafted NFS requests. The vulnerability is due to an insecure design in Linux kernel when handling the NFS request, MKNOD. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted NFS MKNOD request to the target system, to create a device on the target system.

NAME: FreeBSD nfsd NFS Mount Request Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the FreeBSD NFS daemon. A remote unauthenticated attacker may send a crafted request to the target NFS daemon, resulting in a kernel panic condition. As a result, the target operating system will detect a fault and initiate a reboot.

NAME: EMC Legato NetWorker Remote Exec Service Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in EMC legato NetWorker product. The flaw is due to improper boundary protection when processing RPC requests. A remote unauthenticated attacker can leverage this vulnerability by sending crafted RPC message to the target host, potentially inject and execute arbitrary code with System level privileges.

NAME: Sun Solaris RWall Daemon Syslog Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Solaris RPC wall daemon (rpc.walld) in Solaris 2.5.1 through 8 is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of sanitization of format string characters in the strings passed to the syslog function of the daemon. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Sun RPC CMSD xdr_array Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SunRPC xdr_array filter primitive used by CMS daemon is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. External Date Representation (XDR) primitives are routines that allow for uniform representation of basic or constructed data types, regardless of system architecture, by their translation to and from an external representation. However, the xdr_array primitive which translate variable length arrays is prone to an integer overflow when large number of elements are passed to it. Due to lack of boundary checks, a user-supplied integer value is used for memory allocation into which user data is copied later, leading to a buffer overflow.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: Portmapper remote infomation collection evasive attempt
DESCRIPTION: User can dump out all rpc information by send a request to portmapper. This signature indicated a evasion port dump request.

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup XDR Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup. The vulnerability is due to insufficient boundary checking in the xdr_rwsstring() library function. A remote unauthenticated attacker may exploit this vulnerability by sending a long parameter into a daemon using this function to process strings. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability allows for arbitrary code execution on the vulnerable system in the context of the affected application, commonly System.

NAME: Solaris SnmpXdmid Daemon Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Solaris snmpXdmid SNMP to DMI mapper daemon shipped with Solaris versions 2.6, 7 and 8 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests sent to the daemon. The vulnerability is present in the daemon's code for handling an 'indication' message sent over RPC service 100249, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: Solaris CDE ToolTalk Database Server Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Solaris ToolTalk database server(rpc.ttdbserverd) is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of sanitization of format string characters in the first string in the RPC request.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Sun solaris rpc.yppasswdd Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Solaris rpc.yppasswdd (yppasswd server) in versions 2.6, 7 and 8 of the OS is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerabilitywhile parsing certain crafted RPC requests sent to the service. The vulnerability is present in the service's code for handling apassword update message sent to RPC service number 100009, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby sending a crafted RPC request which could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: Sun Solaris sadmind RPC Request XDR Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sadmind service is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks while allocating heap buffers using values from the supplied input. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request to the vulnerable server. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup Media Server SUN RPC Service Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: CA BrightStor ARCserve Media Server provides certain services through SUNRPC messages. However, the server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to insufficient boundary checking when processing crafted strings supplied in SUN RPC requests. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request to the service on the specified service port. A successful exploit could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system in the context of the server.

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup MediaSVR Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup 11.5 SP2 build 4237 is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while handling certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is present in mediasvr.exe and is due to the lack of proper checks on the xdr_handle_t data in RPC packets, which is used in calculating an address for a function call. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request and control flow of execution. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution wit

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup Media Server SUN RPC Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in CA BrightStor ARCserve Media Server. The vulnerability is due to insufficient boundary checking when processing crafted strings supplied in SUN RPC requests. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to terminate the affected service, causing denial of service condition.

NAME: Linux rpc.statd Remote Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: rpc.statd in the nfs-utils package in several Linux distributions is prone to format string vulnerability while parsingcertain crafted RPC requests sent to the service. The vulnerability is due to the lack of cleansing untrusting format strings,that could allow an attacker to gain unprivileged remote access. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending acrafted RPC request which could allow complete control of the victim server machine.

NAME: Linux kernel NFSv4 ACL Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Linux Kernel is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted NFSV4 requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on ACL number in the NFSV4 request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted NFSV4 request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: MIT Kerberos KAdminD vsyslog Server Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: MIT Kerberos V5 is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted RPC requests. The vulnerability is due to a boundary error in the server's logging function in the Kerberos Administration Server (kadmind). A remote, authenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by supplying a specially crafted string to the kadmind daemon. Successful exploitation would cause a stack based buffer overflow that can lead to compromising the Kerberos key database, or executing arbitrary code with root privileges on the target server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows WINS Service Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows WINS Service is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WINS requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the WINS request, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WINS request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft WINS Server Name Validation Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Internet Naming Service (WINS) server is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests to the server. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of WINS computer names causing arbitrary memory overwrite.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WINS replication request to the server. A successful exploitcould lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows WINS Server Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) is vulnerable to elevation of privileges while parsing malformed WINS requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the WINS request. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows WINS Service Integer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows WINS Service is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WINS requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the WINS request, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WINS request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft WINS Server Replication Request Parsing Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The WINS (Windows Internet Naming Service) service on Microsoft Windows NT Server 4.0, Windows 2000 Server, and Windows Server 2003 isprone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WINS packets. The vulnerability is due an arbitrary memoryoverwrite issue when parsing a modified memory pointer passed in the Association Context field in a WINS replication packet. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WINS replication packet to the server (running on port 42) and write arbitrary memory locations. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution, or lead to a denial of service condition on the server.

NAME: CVS Annotate Command Long Revision String Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in the Concurrent Versions System (CVS). This issue is caused by improper bounds checking of user-supplied input. The vulnerable section of code is only exposed after user authentication. An attacker exploiting the vulnerability can cause a denial-of-service of the affected product.

NAME: CVS Max-dotdot Protocol Command Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: CVS (Concurrent Version Systems) is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain requests. The vulnerabilityis due to the lack of proper checks on the argument passed to a Max-dotdot command, which could lead to an integer overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the CVS server.A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution on the vulnerable server.

NAME: CVS Entry Line Flag Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: CVS (Concurrent Versions System) feature versions 1.12.7 and earlier, and stable versions 1.11.15 and earlier are vulnerable to a heap overflow while parsing certain crafted CVS requests. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of entry lines when applying modified and unchanged flags, leading to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sendingcrafted CVS commands to cause the overflow, and lead to remote code execution.

NAME: CVS Directory Request Double Free Heap Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a double-free vulnerability in CVS 1.11.4 and earlier which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service andpossibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed Directory request.

NAME: CVS File Existence Information Disclosure Weakness
DESCRIPTION: A weakness exists in the Concurrent Versions System (CVS) with the cvs "history" command. An anonymous or low-privileged attacker can exploit this weakness to gain information about files on a CVS server.

NAME: CVS Argumentx Command Double Free Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: CVS (Concurrent Version Systems) is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain requests. The vulnerabilityis due to the improper parsing of a client request that contains an Argumentx command without issuing Argument command first, whichcould lead to a double free vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the CVS server.A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution on the vulnerable server.

NAME: Microsoft LSASS Recursive Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft LDAP server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on search request in the LDAP request, leading to a denial of service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead ldap server to be crashed.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Active Directory LDAP Request Validation Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Windows Active Directory is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in the LDAP request, leading to an exploitable code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Active Directory RDN Parsing Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Active Directory is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on RDNs in the LDAP request, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulerabnlitiy.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Active Directory LDAP Query Handling Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the Microsoft implementations of Active Directory and Active Directory Application Mode. The vulnerability is caused by improper handling of specifically crafted LDAP requests. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to create a denial of service condition on the target system.

NAME: Microsoft LSASS Recursive Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft LDAP server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on search request in the LDAP request, leading to a denial of service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead ldap server to be crashed.

NAME: Novell eDirectory evtFilteredMonitorEventsRequest Function Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A heap buffer overflow exists in the Novell eDirectory product line. The flaw is due to a logic error during the processing of crafted LDAP messages. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit the vulnerability to cause a denial of service condition on the target host or possibly inject and execute arbitrary code. Any code execution will be within the security context of the currently running eDirectory service, normally System.

NAME: PGP KeyServer 7 LDAP Server Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: PGP Keyserver 7.0 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of improper handling of malformed BER encodings. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the LDAP server.

NAME: IBM Tivoli Directory Server Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Tivoli Directory Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the LDAP request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Novell eDirectory evtFilteredMonitorEventsRequest Function Invalid Free Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The evtFilteredMonitorEventsRequest function in the LDAP service inNovell eDirectory before 8.8.1 FTF1 allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code via a crafted request containing a value that is largerthan the number of objects transmitted, which triggers an invalid freeof unallocated memory.

NAME: Sun Directory Server LDAP Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: LDAP service in Sun Java System Directory Server 5.2, running on Linux is prone to overflow vulnerability while parsing certaincrafted LDAP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of sufficient checks on the lengths of certain LDAP requests.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long, crafted LDAP request to the vulnerable server. A successfulexploit could lead to a denial of service condition on the server.

NAME: SIDVault LDAP Server Preauth Remote Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Multiple buffer overflows in the login mechanism in sidvault in Alpha Centauri Software SIDVault LDAP Server before 2.0f allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted LDAP packets, as demonstrated by a long dc entry in an LDAP bind.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino LDAP Server Invalid DN Message Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exist a buffer overflow vulnerability in IBM Lotus Domino LDAP service. The vulnerability is due to a boundary error while handling crafted LDAP requests. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending an LDAP request that contains an overly large DN (Distinguished Name) to the target service. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability may allow arbitrary code injection and execution with the privileges of the server process, which is System on Windows platform.

NAME: LDAP SEARCHREQUEST or MODIFYDN Request Messsage Too Long
DESCRIPTION: It has been observed that a LDAP too long (>10000 bytes) request message SEARCHREQUEST or MODIFYDN on the network which may cause the LDAP server denial of service or lead to remote code exeuction.

NAME: Microsoft Windows LDAP buffer overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows LDAP is prone to a remote buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on baseObject in the SearchRequest Message, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Novell eDirectory Unchecked Length Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Novell eDirectory is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain malformed LDAP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to denial of service of the server.

NAME: Oracle LDAP Remote Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in Oracle Internet Directory component in Oracle Application Server. The flaw is due to a NULL-pointer dereference error in the application. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request to the system. Successful exploitation would cause denial of service against the target LDAP server.

NAME: Wireshark LDAP Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Wireshark is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP protocol packets. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the LDAP protocol packets. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP packet. A successful attack could crash wireshark.

NAME: Microsoft Active Directory LDAP Query Handling Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the Microsoft implementations of Active Directory and Active Directory Application Mode. The vulnerability is caused by improper handling of specifically crafted LDAP requests. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to create a denial of service condition on the target system.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Active Directory is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the LDAP request.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to system been very busy.

NAME: OpenLDAP Server Kerveros 4 Bind Request Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: OpenLDAP 2.4.3 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests. The vulnerability is present present in the krbv4_ldap_auth function in servers/slapd/kerberos.c, when OpenLDAP is compiled with the --enable-kbind (Kerberos KBIND) option. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending an LDAP bind request using the LDAP_AUTH_KRBV41 authentication method and long credential data, leading to remote code execution.

NAME: Novell eDirectory LDAP NULL Search Parameter Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a heap buffer overflow vulnerability in Novell eDirectory. The flaw is due to incorrect calculation when allocating a heap buffer to store search parameters. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted search request to the system. Successful exploitation would allow for arbitrary code injection and execution with the privileges of the server process, normally System for Windows platforms, or root for Unix platforms.

NAME: Microsoft Windows LSASS Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: An authenticated elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows due to the way that the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) improperly handles certain Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) messages. The vulnerability exists in implementations of Active Directory, Active Directory Application Mode (ADAM), and Active Directory Lightweight Directory Service (AD LDS). An attacker must have previously authenticated with the LSASS server prior to exploiting this issue. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code and take complete control of an affected system.

NAME: Microsoft LSASS Recursive Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft LDAP server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on search request in the LDAP request, leading to a denial of service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead ldap server to be crashed.

NAME: Ipswitch IMail LDAP Daemon Request Parsing Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Ipswitch IMail Server 8.03 is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability in the LDAP daemon (iLDAP.exe 3.9.15.10) while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on user supplied LDAP tags. Since this tag is copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request with large tag length. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: OpenLDAP Modrdn RDN NULL String Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: OpenLDAP is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the LDAP request, leading to a denial of service. An attacker can exploit this issue to cause the affected service to stop processing requests, denying service to legitimate users.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino LDAP Server Memory Exception Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Domino LDAP Server is prone to a DOS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on Version field in the LDAP bind request, leading to an DOS. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to server DOS.

NAME: OpenLDAP LDAP Server BIND Request Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: OpenLDAP before 2.3.29 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain craftedLDAP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks sent through LDAP BINDrequests with long authcid names. This triggers an assertion failure and leads to service crash.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP requests, causing server crash.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Crafted LDAP Request Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in Microsoft Windows Active Directory. The flaw is caused by improper handling of LDAP requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted LDAP message to the target host, causing the target server to temporarily stop responding.

NAME: IBM Tivoli Directory Server LDAP Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the IBM Tivoli Directory Server. The vulnerability is caused by a failure to properly verify the length of an object in an LDAP message. An attacker may leverage this issue by sending a crafted LDAP message to terminate a vulnerable Tivoli Directory Server, or to inject arbitrary code which will be executed in the security context of the Tivoli Directory Server process.

NAME: Microsoft Windows 2000 Active Directory Remote Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows 2000 Active Directory is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on filter field in the LDAP SearchRequest message, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request message. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Active Directory LDAP Query Handling Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Active Directory is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LDAP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the LDAP request, leading to a denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted LDAP request. A successful attack could lead to server crashed.

NAME: OpenLDAP ber_get_next BER Decoding Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in OpenLDAP slapd. The flaw is due to a design error when decoding ASN.1 BER network messages. A remote unauthenticated attacker can trigger this vulnerability by sending a crafted ASN.1 BER-encoded message to the target server. Successful attack could allow for raising a denial of service condition to the affected service.

NAME: CommuniGate and IBM Lotus Domino LDAP Server Integer Value Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Domino and CommuniGate Pro LDAP server are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing crafted LDAP requests. The vulnerabilities are caused due to errors in the LDAP component during handling of negative length values in the Basic Encoding Rules (BER) length fields. This can be exploited to cause a DoS and may allow arbitrary code execution via a specially-crafted LDAP request.

NAME: LDAP Authentication Failed  for Binding
DESCRIPTION: A remote user can send a LDAP bind request with authentication data, and attacker can send it as brute-force trying to find out a valid user name and password.

NAME: SAP MaxDB Malformed Handshake Request Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SAP MaxDB is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted unknown protocol requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on handshake message in its own protocol , leading to a remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted handshake request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

DESCRIPTION: Siemens Tecnomatix FactoryLink SCADA VRN Server is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests.
