NAME: GenBroker SCADA CSService Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: GenBroker SCADA CSService is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Multiple Vendor Telnet Client LINEMODE Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A remote buffer-overflow vulnerability affects multiple vendors' Telnet client. This issue is due to the application's failure to properly validate the length of user-supplied strings before copying them into static process buffers.An attacker may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user that activated the vulnerable application. This may facilitate unauthorized access or privilege escalation.

NAME: System V Derived Login Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Implementations of login on System V derived operating systems are prone to buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain craftedtelnet requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while storing certain environment variables in finite arraybuffers. An attacker could overflow these array boundaries by passing a crafted telnet request. A successful attack could lead to remotecode execution with the privileges of the affected server, or could crash the server.

NAME: Sun Solaris Telnet Remote Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Telnet daemon in Solaris 10 and 11 is prone to a argument injection vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to improper interpretation of certain client "-f" sequences, allowing the login program to skip the login process. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server. A successful exploit could allow any user to bypass authentication and execute arbitrary commands on the vulnerable server.

NAME: Microsoft Telnet Client Information Disclosure
DESCRIPTION: There exists an information disclosure vulnerability in the Telnet client shipped with Microsoft Windows. An attacker can persuade a target user to connect to a malicious server with the vulnerable program to trigger the vulnerability. A successful exploitation can allow an attacker to remotely read the environment variables of the user who connects to the malicious server.

NAME: Multiple Vendor Telnet Client env_opt_add Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way the env_opt_add         function of certain telnet clients processes the NEW-ENVIRON         sub-options. A buffer in the vulnerable telnet client can be overflowed         by a telnet server by sending a specially crafted SEND command. An         attacker may exploit this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the target         system with the privileges of the account executing the telnet client.

NAME: Verso NetPerformer Telnet Service Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Verso NetPerformer Telnet Service is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted telnet requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on login username in the telnet request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted telnet request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Telnet Authentication Failed
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a telnet login authentication failed. A multiple failed authentication response means an attack is try to brute-force user name and password.

NAME: Blue Coat Systems WinProxy Telnet Service DoS
DESCRIPTION: Blue Coat Systems Inc.'s winproxy is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted telnet requests. The vulnerability could be triggered by sending a large string of 0xFF characters to the telnet proxy port of the server. Such a request could lead to an exploitable heap corruption in the Winproxy process causing it to crash. A successful attack could lead to a DOS condition on the server.

NAME: TippingPoint IPS Audit Log Telnet Failure Cross-Site Scripting
DESCRIPTION: TippingPoint IPS is prone to a cross-site scriptin vulnerability while parsing certain crafted telnet requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on XSS requests sent through telnet.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted telnet request/response. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to gain certain privileges to further retrieve sensitive information.

NAME: telnet_LD_LIBRARY_PATH
DESCRIPTION: Telnet allows a remote client to specify environment variables including LD_LIBRARY_PATH, allowing an attacker to bypass the normal system libraries and gain root access.

NAME: Asterisk SIP T.38 SDP Parsing Remote Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the process_sdp function inchan_sip.c of the SIP channel T.38 SDP parser in Asterisk before 1.4.3allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long (1)T38FaxRateManagement or (2) T38FaxUdpEC SDP parameter in an SIPmessage.

NAME: Thomson SpeedTouch 2030 Invite Message DoS
DESCRIPTION: Thomson SpeedTouch 2030 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted SIP requests. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of INVITE requests containing a slash ("/") character after the version in the "Via" field. The vulnerability could be exploited by remote attackers to crash an affected device, leading to a denial of service condition.

NAME: SIP Register Request Attempt
DESCRIPTION: A REGISTER request in SIP protocol can add a new binding between an address-of-record and one or more contact addresses.

NAME: SIPfoundry SIPXtapi CSeq Field Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SIPfoundry sipXtapi released before 20060324 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SIP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the CSeq field parsed in a request, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted request with a long CSeq value. A successful exploit could lead toremote code execution, or lead to a denial of service condition on the server.

NAME: SIP Bye Request Attempt
DESCRIPTION: A SIP Bye request message has been detected. Many SIP Bye requests within a short time period can indicate a possible SIP Bye Flood DOS attack.

NAME: eStara Softphone SIP SDP Data Packet Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: eStara Softphone versions below 3.0.1.47 are prone to a remote buffer overflow vulnerability. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing certain user-supplied strings. Since these buffers are later used to copy data to finite structures, it could lead to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a SIPmessage, and cause arbitrary code to be executed on the victim machine.

NAME: SIP Format String in Request URI
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP based products are prone to a format string attack while handling crafted requests containing format strings in the request URI. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request containing format string in request URI. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or expose sensitive information.

NAME: Invalid SDP Session Name Header Field Value
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP products are prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling crafted session description protocol data in a SIP request. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of SDP data containing an invalid session name field such as non-ASCII characters. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request that could crash the server or expose sensitive information.

NAME: Incorrect SDP Connection Network Type Header Field
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP products are prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling crafted session description protocol data in a SIP request. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of SDP data containing an incorrect connection network type value. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request that could crash the server.

NAME: Asterisk RTP Codec Payload Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Asterisk is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SIP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on SIP request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Incorrect SDP Origin-IP Header Field Value
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP products are prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling crafted session description protocol data in a SIP request. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of SDP data containing an invalid origin IP address value such as private IP addresses. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request that could crash the server or expose sensitive information.

NAME: Grandstream GXV-3000 SIP Phone Remote Eavesdropping
DESCRIPTION: The Grandstream SIP Phone GXV-3000 with firmware 1.0.1.7, Loader 1.0.0.6, and Boot 1.0.0.18 allows remote attackers to force silent call completion, eavesdrop on the phone's local environment, and cause a denial of service (blocked call reception) via a certain SIP INVITE message followed by a certain SIP/2.0 183 Session Progress message.

NAME: Asterisk Channel Driver Request Handling Remote DoS
DESCRIPTION: Asterisk Channel Driver is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted SIP requests. The vulnerability is due to improper parsing of SIP requests sent without a URI and SIP-version header. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request and crash the server.

NAME: SDP Protocol Version Header Field Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP products are prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while handling crafted session description protocol data in a SIP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on protocol version header field in an SDP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request that could cause remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: SIP INVITE Request URI Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP based products are prone to a buffer overflow while handling long crafted requests. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long URI in the request. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: SIP Max-Forwards Header Field Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP based products are prone to an integer overflow while handling crafted requests containing invalid values in Max-Forwards header field. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request containing marginal integer values in Max-Forwards header. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: SDP Time-Start Header Field Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP products are prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while handling crafted session description protocol data in a SIP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on time-start field in an SDP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request that could cause remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: SIP Expires Header Field Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP based products are prone to an integer overflow while handling crafted requests containing invalid values in Expires header field. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request containing marginal integer values in Expires header. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: SDP Media Port Header Field Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP products are prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while handling crafted session description protocol data in a SIP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on media port field in an SDP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request that could cause remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: Asterisk INVITE Message DoS
DESCRIPTION: The channel driver in Asterisk before 1.2.17 and 1.4.x before 1.4.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a SIP INVITE message with an SDP containing one valid and one invalid IPaddress. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request and then crash the server.

NAME: SIP CSeq Header Field Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP based products are prone to an integer overflow while handling crafted requests containing invalid sequence numbers in CSeq header field. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request containing margin integer values in CSeq header. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: SDP Empty Time Stop Header Field
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP products are prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling crafted session description protocol data in a SIP request. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of SDP data containing an empty time stop field. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request that could crash the server.

NAME: Microsoft Communicator INVITE Flood Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Communicator is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SIP INVITE requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the SIP INVITE request, leading to a denial of service vulnerability..An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request. A successful attack could lead to crash client.

NAME: SIP Invalid Version Header Field Value
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP based products behave unexpectedly while handling crafted requests containing invalid SIP version values. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request containing invalid SIP version. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: Digium Asterisk SIP Invalid Response Code Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a Null-dereference vulnerability in the way Digium Asterisk handles SIP response messages. The vulnerability is due to errors occurred while handling invalid SIP Response Status-Code in SIP Channel Driver component. Remote authenticated attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted SIP response messages to the target server. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the Denial of Service condition on the target server.

NAME: SIP Invalid Content-Type Header Field Value
DESCRIPTION: Several SIP based products behave unexpectedly while handling crafted requests containing invalid values in Content-Type header field. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request containing invalid content-types in the header. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or crash the server.

NAME: Cisco IP Phone SIP INVITE Message Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a Denial of Service vulnerability in Cisco's IP Phone models 7960 and 7940. The affected firmware cannot handle a specially crafted SIP INVITE message with an invalid IP address, causing the phone to reboot upon receiving the message. As a result, a remote user can cause a denial of service condition to IP phone service.

NAME: WengoPhone Soft Phone Malformed Packet DoS
DESCRIPTION: WengoPhone SIP product is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted SIP requests. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of MESSAGE requests containing no message content. The vulnerability could be exploited by remote attackers to crash an affected device, leading to a denial of service condition.

NAME: Squid Proxy DNS Name Resolver Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Squid Web Proxy is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on FQDN lookup in the DNS response, leading to denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS response. A successful attack could lead to denial of service.It may be triggered by some normal traffic, which has a NULL domain name inside the PTR response.

NAME: Microsoft ISA and Proxy Server DNS Cache Spoofing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the DNS cache functionality of Microsoft Internet Security and Acceleration (ISA) Server and Microsoft Proxy Server. A vulnerable server can be manipulated into caching and using an incorrect IP address for a DNS hostname. This flaw may allow an attacker to present malicious content to users under the guise of a known and trusted web site.

NAME: BIND iquery Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: BIND 4 and 8 are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on query field in the DNS request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Multiple Vendor DNS Message Decompression Remote Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Multiple Vendor DNS Server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on the name decompression in the DNS request, leading to a denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS request. A successful attack could lead to exhaust system resources.

NAME: Symantec Gateway Products DNS Cache Poisoning
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way the DNS proxy component of Symantec Gateway products processes and caches DNS responses. When the vulnerable component is configured to function as a DNS caching server or as a primary DNS server, it is susceptible to DNS cache poisoning under specific conditions. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability to do site spoofing, Man-in-the-Middle, or denial of service attacks by manipulating the DNS cache data on the target system.

NAME: BIND NXT Record Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: BIND 8.2 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of a large number NXT records in a DNS response, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a large number of NXT records in response to a DNS request. A successfulexploit could lead to remote code execution in the context of the victim machine.

NAME: Sun Java Runtime Environment InitialDirContext Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the DNS functionality of the Sun Java Runtime Environment and the Sun Java Development Kit. When a vulnerable application that uses the affected Java class is manipulated into performing many DNS requests, an integer overflow can result. This would lead to a denial of service condition in the DNS client functionality.

NAME: DNS RRSIG Query Type Packet
DESCRIPTION: This alert is triggered when a DNS RRSIG query packet is seen. When Response Policy Zones (RPZ) RRset replacement is enabled, ISC BIND Server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing such packets. A successful attack could crash the service.

NAME: DNS Possible Nymex/Blackworm Activity
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a possible DNS activity of Blackworm/Nyxem worm. The Blackworm is a mass-mailing worm that also tries to spread using remote shares. It also tries to disable security-related and file sharing software as well as destroys files of certain types. The activity might also include DNS lookups for certain websites.

NAME: Microsoft Windows NAT Helper DNS Query Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows NAT Helper Components is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain craft DNS request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the DNS query, leading to a denial of service condition.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS request. A successful attack could lead to denial of service against the target windows box.

NAME: ISC BIND DNS Resolver Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ISC BIND DNS Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on Query field in the DNS response, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: ISC BIND Internal Memory Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: BIND is prone to a memory disclosure vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on inverse query in the DNS request.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS request/response. A successful attack could lead to obtain some information from dns server.

NAME: ISC BIND query_addsoa Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A denial of service vulnerability exists in ISC BIND, the DNS server implementation by Internet Systems Consortium. The vulnerability is due a failure to handle a certain sequence of recursive DNS queries. Remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted sequence of queries and cause a denial of service condition in the DNS server.

NAME: Kerio Personal Firewall Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Kerio Personal Firewall is prone to a denial of service vulnerbility while parsing certain crafted DNS request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in DNS request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS request. A successful attack could lead to denial of service against the target Firewall.

NAME: Squid Proxy DNS Name Resolver Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way Squid Web Proxy processes Domain Name System (DNS) responses. This vulnerability occurs when Squid performs a Fully-Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) lookup and receives a crafted DNS response. The vulnerability can be exploited by a malicious user to cause a denial of service to the Squid proxy.

NAME: libspf2 DNS TXT Record Handling Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in the Sender Policy Framework library (libspf2). The flow is due to boundary error when processing crafted DNS TXT record. An attacker who runs a malicious DNS server can exploit this vulnerability by sending triggering email message to the target system. Successful attack could allow for executing arbitrary code with System or root level privileges.

NAME: Microsoft DNS Any Type Cache Poisoning Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows DNS servers are prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers poison DNS caches.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on response data in the DNS protocol.Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to poison DNS caches, allowing them to redirect network traffic and to launch man-in-the-middle attacks.

NAME: ISC BIND RRSIG Query With RPZ Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ISC BIND Server is vulnerable to denial of service while parsing certain malformed DNS requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on DNS requests. A successful attack could lead to denial of service against the target server.

NAME: DNS Answer Big TXT Record Response Anomaly
DESCRIPTION: This signature indicated that a malicious dns response packet has been detected, it contain a oversize TXT answer record, it maybe trigger a buffer overflow vulnerability in some software.

NAME: Microsoft DNS Server NAPTR Record Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft DNS server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain malformed DNS responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on NAPTR record in the DNS response, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Symantec Norton Firewall NBNS response Remote Heap Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Symantec firewall is prone to a a remote heap corruption vulnerability in SYMDNS.SYS, a driver that validates NetBIOS Name Service responses, which can lead to execution of arbitrary code for various Symantec products. Successful exploitation of this flaw yields remote kernel access to the system.

NAME: Microsoft Windows DNS Server Spoofing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows DNS server with caching enabled is prone to a spoofing vulnerability while handling certain crafted DNS traffic. The vulnerability is due to the predictability of the transaction IDs generated by the server. An attacker could trick a victimclient to send a recursive request to the attacker DNS server. The attacker could then keep track of the transaction IDs generated.Later the attacker could generate a set of spoofed responses sent to the victim client request with the guessed transaction IDs. If one these responses matches the actual ID and arrives before the genuine response from an authoritative DNS server, the victim trafficcould be redirected to the spoofed site. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted DNS responses, thus enablingredirection of a victim's traffic to the spoofed site. A successful exploit could lead to phishing/pharming attacks and could enablean attacker to retrieve sensitive information.

NAME: Niels Provos libevent Remote Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Niels Provos libevent is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the DNS request, leading to a denial of service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS request. A successful attack could lead to denial of service with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft SMTP Service and Exchange Routing Engine Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Exchange is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the DNS response, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: TippingPoint IPS Command Line Interface Reverse DNS Lookup Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: TippingPoint IPS is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses. The vulnerability is present in the command line interface and is due to the lack of proper boundary checks on certain values passed in a DNS response. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the software.

NAME: TippingPoint IPS Command Line Interface ping Reverse DNS Lookup Format String
DESCRIPTION: TippingPoint IPS is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper filtering of format strings in a DNS reponse. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the software.

NAME: Apple Mac OS X mDNSResponder HTTP Request Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Mac OS X is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in mDNSResponder and is due to the lack of proper checks on HTTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft DNS Client Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Buffer overflow in the DNS Client service in Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4, XP SP1 and SP2, and Server 2003 SP1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted record response.  NOTE: while MS06-041 implies that there is a single issue, there are multiple vectors, and likely multiple vulnerabilities, related to (1) a heap-based buffer overflow in a DNS server response to the client, (2) a DNS server response with malformed ATMA records, and (3) a length miscalculation in TXT, HINFO,

NAME: Microsoft Windows DNS Client Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft DNS Client service on various Windows platforms is pronr to a buffer overrun vulnerability while parsingcrafted DNS response records. The vulnerability is a length miscalculation error while parsing TXT, HINFO, X25, and ISDNrecords. Since the length is later used for memory copy operation to heap buffers, it could be exploited to corruptcritical heap structures. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted DNS responses to a victim machine, afterthe victim has pointed the DNS server to be that of the attackers.

NAME: DNS Zone Transfer Attempt
DESCRIPTION: DNS Server allows user to get the all zone domain information by sending an AXFR DNS request.

NAME: Multiple Sniffer Vendor DNS Label Compression Overly Long Name Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Multiple sniffer vendor is vulnerable to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS packet. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in the DNS packet, leading to an DOS condition. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS packet. A successful attack could lead to DOS against the target application.

NAME: TippingPoint Web Interface Reverse DNS Lookup Cross Site Scripting
DESCRIPTION: Tippingpoint Web Interface is prone to a cross-site scripting vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper filtering of XSS strings when handling DNS responses. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS response. A successful attack could provide certain privileges which could allow further retrieval of sensitive information.

NAME: ISC BIND DNSSEC Validation Multiple RRsets Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: A denial of service vulnerability exists in ISC BIND, the DNS server implementation by Internet Systems Consortium. The vulnerability is due to an assertion failure when validating DNS response that contains multiple Resource Record sets. The vulnerability could be exploited by a remote attacker to cause a denial of service condition of the DNS server.

NAME: ISC BIND 9 Dynamic Update Request Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ISC Bind 9(ISC BIND 9.4 before 9.4.3-P3, 9.5 before 9.5.1-P3, and 9.6 before 9.6.1-P1) is vulnerable to a denial of service condition while handling malformed requests. The vulnerability is due to an assertion failure and exit of the server when parsing an ANY record in the prerequisite section of a malformed dynamic update message. A successful attack could lead to a denial of service condition on the server. Note: this may cause false positive results DNS servers from other vendors.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange and Windows SMTP Service Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Exchange and Windows SMTP Service is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the DNS response, leading to a denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS response. A successful attack could lead to a denial of service.

NAME: Symantec Client Firewall Remote DNS Response Denial Of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a denial of service vulnerability within multiple Symantec client security products. An attacker can craft a DNS packet that can cause the Symantec security products to enter an infinite loop, allowing an attacker to disable all access to the host running the vulnerable product.

NAME: Multiple Sniffer Vendor DNS Label Compression Recursion Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Multiple sniffer vendor is vulnerable to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS packet. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in the DNS packet, leading to an DOS condition. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS packet. A successful attack could lead to DOS against the target application.

NAME: ISC BIND 9 Remote UPDATE Message Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ISC BIND 9 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DNS requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on UPDATE data in the DNS request, leading to an exploitable denial of service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DNS request. A successful attack could cause the 'named' process to crash.

NAME: Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Resolution Service Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft SQL Server is prone to a remote heap overflow vulnerability. A SQL request packet with the first byte set to 0x08,and followed by a long string before a colon character would overwrite the heap. A remote attacker could send a crafted packet which wouldcorrupt critical heap structures to exploit the vulnerability. A successful attack may result in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges leading to a full compromise.

NAME: Microsoft SQL Server Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft SQL Server is prone to a remote stack overflow vulnerability. A SQL request packet with the first byte set to 0x08, and followed by a long string would overflow the heap. A successful attack may result in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges leading to a full compromise. Attack attempts may result in denial-of-service conditions as well.

NAME: Microsoft SQL Server Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft SQL Server is prone to a remote stack overflow vulnerability. A SQL request packet with the first byte set to 0x04,and followed by a long string would overflow the stack, as the server attempts to open a registry key with the data. A successful attack may result in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges leading to a full compromise.

NAME: CDE DTLogin XDMCP Parser Remote Double Free Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A double-free vulnerability has been reported within the dtlogin daemon, a component of the Common Desktop Environment (CDE), shipped with many enterprise UNIX platforms including Sun's solaris, Hewlett-Packard's HP-UX and Tru64, IBM's AIX, SCO OpenServer, and others.

NAME: IBM Informix Dynamic Server Authentication Password Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A stack buffer overflow vulnerability exists in IBM Informix Dynamic Server. The vulnerability is due to a boundary error when processing Password of Authentication messages. Remote unauthenticated attackers may exploit the vulnerability to cause denial of service or inject and execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.

NAME: IBM Informix Dynamic Server SET ENVIRONMENT Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Informix Dynamic Server is vulnerable to a buffer overflow condition while parsing certain malformed Informix requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the SET ENVIRONMENT request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IBM Informix Dynamic Server Authentication Password Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A stack buffer overflow vulnerability exists in IBM Informix Dynamic Server. The vulnerability is due to a boundary error when processing Password of Authentication messages. Remote unauthenticated attackers may exploit the vulnerability to cause denial of service or inject and execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.

NAME: IBM Informix Dynamic Server Long Username Authentication Error Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: IBM Informix Dynamic Server is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted informix requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the informix request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted informix request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Database sys.pbsde.init Procedure Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server product is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests to the server.The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the arguments passed to sys.pbsde.init procedure.Since the user-supplied arguments are copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. Anauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server. A successful exploit couldlead to remote code execution with the privileges of the database server process.

NAME: Oracle Database DBMS_JAVA.SET_OUTPUT_TO_JAVA Arbitrary SQL Execution
DESCRIPTION: Oracle is prone to a privilege escalation vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on parameters passed to the DBMS_JAVA.SET_OUTPUT_TO_JAVA procedure. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a arbitrary SQL commands to the procedure which is executed as SYS user. A successful attack could lead to SQL execution with the privileges of the SYS user.

NAME: Oracle Warehouse Builder WB_RT_AUDIT_SHADOW_TABLE SQL Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Warehouse Builder component in Oracle Database Server is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability. The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of parameters passed to certain procedures in the WB_RT_AUDIT_SHADOW_TABLE table. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted Oracle requests. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the database server.

NAME: Oracle Database Server Crafted View Privilege Escalation
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server product is prone to a privilege escalation vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is caused by a design error in the processing of Join Views. An attacker with limited privileges may exploit this vulnerability to gain escalated privileges.

NAME: Oracle Database Server XDB PITRIG_DROPMETADATA Procedure Buffer Overflow Exploit
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server product is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests to the server.The vulnerability is present in the XDB.XDB_PITRIG_PKG package and is due to the lack of boundary checks on the argumentspassed to the PITRIG_DROPMETADATA procedure. Since these user-supplied arguments are copied to finite stack buffers, it couldlead to an exploitable stack overflow. An authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request tothe server. A successful exploit could lead to code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Database Server MD2 package SDO_CODE_SIZE procedure Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server product 10g before 10.1.0.2 Patch 2 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests to the server. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the LAYER parameter passed to MDSYS.MD2.SDO_CODE_SIZE procedure in the MD2 package. Since the user-supplied parameter is copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the database server process.

NAME: Oracle Database Server ROLLBACKWORKSPACE SQL Injection
DESCRIPTION: Oracle database is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted oracle requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper filtering in parameters passed to the SYS.LT.ROLLBACKWORKSPACE procedure. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending SQL injection characters in a request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Warehouse Builder WB_OLAP_AW_REMOVE_SOLVE_ID SQL Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Warehouse Builder component in Oracle Database Server is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability. The vulnerability is due to improper input validation of parameters passed to the OWBREPOS_OWNER.WB_OLAP_AW_REMOVE_SOLVE_ID procedure. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted Oracle requests. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the database server.

NAME: Oracle Create Database Link Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain user-supplied input passed through the create database command, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TNS request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Database Core RDBMS Component Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server is vulnerable to denial of service while parsing certain malformed requests. The vulnerability is due to an error in Core RDBMS Component when handling an invalid TNS data packet. A successful exploit could lead to complete CPU usage on the server, resulting in a denial of service condition.

NAME: Oracle Database Server Long Username Login Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in Oracle Database Server 9i, 8i, 8.1.7, and 8.0.6. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on username lgnth in the TNS login request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle DBMS TNS Listener Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: Oracle database server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to an input validation error in the TNS listener component when handling an invalid TNS data packet. Remote unauthenticated attackers could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted TNS packet to the server. A successful exploit could crash the server and lead to a denial of service condition.

NAME: Oracle JavaVM component OS Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database 10g and 11g are prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted oracle requests. The vulnerability is present in the DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS package, which allows a user with 'create session' privileges to gain Java IO privileges. Once the Java permissions are available, an attacker could create a procedure and execute OS commands from this procedure. A successful attack could allow an attacker to gain access to unauthorized privileges.

NAME: Oracle Database SUBSCRIPTION_NAME Parameter SQL Injection
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server product is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests to the server.The vulnerability is due to the lack of sanitization on the input parameter to the procedures in DBMS_CDC_SUBSCRIBE and DBMS_CDC_ISUBSCRIBE packages. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request by embedding malicious SQL code inthe vulnerable parameter. A successful exploit could lead to SQL command execution with the privileges of the server, therebyenabling the attacker to gain "SYS" privileges.

NAME: Oracle DBMS_METADATA Package SQL Injection
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is present in the DBMS_METADATA package and is due to the lack of proper filtering on user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TNS request. A successful attack could lead to SQL code execution on the vulnerable system.

NAME: Oracle Database DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS Package Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: Oracle database is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted oracle requests. The vulnerability is due to the insecure access to procedures in the DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS package, which can be exploited to modify Java policy table through the IMPORT_JVM_PERMS procedure.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted oracle request to arbitrarily modify java permissions. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the SYS user.

NAME: DBMS_METADATA Package GET_XML Funtion SQL Injection
DESCRIPTION: Oracle database is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted oracle requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper filtering in parameters passed to the GET_XML procedure in the DBMS_METADATA package. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending SQL injection characters in a request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Database VALIDATE_REMOTE_RC SQL Injection
DESCRIPTION: Oracle database is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is present in the function VALIDATE_REMOTE_RC of the package DBMS_REPCAT_RPC and is due to the lack of proper checks on the parameters passed to the function. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request with SQL injection characters sent as parameters to the function. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Database Server DBMS_EXPORT_EXTENSION Package Privilege Escalation
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Database Server is prone to a privilege escalation vulnerability while handling certain requests. The vulnerability is caused due to a design error in the DBMS_EXPORT_EXTENSION package. An  attacker with valid user credentials may use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary SQL statements within the context of the administrative user.

NAME: DBMS_METADATA Package Open Function SQL Injection
DESCRIPTION: Oracle database is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted oracle requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper filtering in parameters passed to the Open procedure in the DBMS_METADATA package. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending SQL injection characters in a request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Database Server DBMS_AQELM Package Buffer Overflow

The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on parameters passed to certain methods of the DBMS_AQELM package. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TNS request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Database Server SDO_CS.TRANSFORM_LAYER Buffer Overflow

Since the user-supplied arguments are copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the database server process.

NAME: Oracle 8i TNS Listener Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

Successful exploitation would result in disclosure of sensitive information, and modification or manipulation of the data in the underlying database.

NAME: Oracle Database Server String Conversion Function Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists an input validation vulnerability with Oracle database server. Oracle database server provides a string conversion function that allows for a stack buffer overflow when certain values are converted to a string representation. An authenticated attacker may exploit this issue to execute an arbitrary code with permission of Oracle database process or cause a denial of service.

NAME: GoldenFTP PASS Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: GoldenFTP is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on PASS field in the FTP request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a malformed FTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Sasser Worm FTP Server Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sasser worm FTP server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of length checks on PORT command parameters. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request to sasser infected machines. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: FTP CWD Command Parameter Too Long
DESCRIPTION: Several FTP servers including Titan FTP server, are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling long CWD commands. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on CWD command parameters. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution on the server, or crash the server.

NAME: Victory FTP Server LIST DoS
DESCRIPTION: Victory FTP Server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is manifested with a crafted LIST command. A successful attack could crash the server and thus cause a denial of service condition.

NAME: Ipswitch WS_FTP Server Rest Comand Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: WS_FTP server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on REST command in the FTP request, leading to DoS.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request. NAME: SlimFTPd FTP Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

The vulnerabilityis due to the lack of boundary checks on the command parameters of certain commands such as LIST, DELE, RNFR, causing anexploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a long crafted FTP command, potentially leadingto remote code execution.

NAME: CesarFTP MKD Command Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in CesarFTP server. The vulnerability is caused due to a boundary error within the handling of the MKD command. This can be exploited to cause a stack-based buffer overflow and may allow arbitrary code execution.

NAME: FTP STOR rhosts request attempt
DESCRIPTION: FTP server is prone to a remote arbitrary code exection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on STOR in the FTP requests, leading to an exploitable remote arbitrary code exection.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP requests. NAME: Freefloat FTP Server Invalid Command Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Freefloat FTP Server is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Wu-Ftpd File Globbing Heap Corruption Vulnerability

The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on CWD argument in the ftp request,leading to an exploitable memory overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ftp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer FTP Client Directory Traversal Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Internet Explorer handles filenames downloaded via the FTP protocol. Insufficient input validation can allow for the creation of a file in an arbitrary location on the client filesystem. Exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to modify the local content of a target system, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the security context of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Serv-U File Renaming Vulnerabilities and STOU Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: Serv-U is prone to a vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on STOU in the FTP request, leading to an exploitable vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: FTP Bounce Attack
DESCRIPTION: FTP bounce attack is an exploit of the FTP protocol whereby an attacker is able to use the PORT command to request access to ports indirectly through the use of the victim machine as a middle man for the request. This technique can be used to scan ports discreetly, and to access specific ports that the attacker cannot access through a direct connection.

NAME: Ipswitch WS_FTP Server ALLO Command Handler Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Ipswitch WS_FTP Server 4.0.2 is vulnerable to a buffer overflow condition while parsing certain large commands. The vulnerability exists in the ALLO handler, which fails to perform boundary checks on the length requested for allocation. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a large ALLO command parameter, which could write to arbitrary memory of the victim server. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution, or cause a denial-of-service on the server.

NAME: FTP Server EPRT Command Parsing Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A heap buffer overflow vulnerability exists in a number of VMware products. The flaw is triggered when the VMware NAT service processes certain malformed FTP commands. A remote attacker may leverage this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code on the VMware host system.

NAME: Ipswitch WS_FTP Server XCRC FTP Command Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in the Ipswitch WS_FTP server. The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation checks in the processing of the FTP XCRC command. An authenticated remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service condition or execute arbitrary code in the context of the vulnerable service, normally System.

NAME: FTP server in Solaris remote authorization bypass and information disclosure vulnerability

A successful attack could lead to remote authorization bypass and information disclosure with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle 9i Database FTP UNLOCK/TEST Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while copying the command parameters to finite buffers, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing crafted UNLOCK/TEST command to a vulnerable FTP server, which could allow remote code execution.

NAME: War FTPD FTP Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

NAME: FTP WarFTP Daemon CWD Command DoS Vulnerability Vulnerability

NAME: Serv-U FTP Server MDTM Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

NAME: Intervations FileCopa LIST Command Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

Upon encountering a file with a specially crafted name during such a scan, the format string vulnerability is triggered. It is possible for an attacker to run arbitrary code in the privilege of root, which is the default user account that run

A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: FTP SITE CHMOD Command Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Serv-U FTP Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ftp requests. The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation checks in the processing of the FTP SITE command. This can be exploited by supplying a specially crafted argument longer than 420 bytes, which causes a buffer overflow.

NAME: HTTPDX FTP Server Tolog Function Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HTTPDX FTP server is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is present in the tolog function and is due to the lack of proper sanitization of format string specifiers in a FTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: ProFTPD Backdoor Unauthorized Access Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ProFTPD is prone to an unauthorized-access vulnerability due to a backdoor in certain versions of the application. Exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary system commands with superuser privileges.

NAME: Sami FTP Server 2.0.1 Remote Stack Based Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sami FTP Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ftp requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user in the ftp request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ftp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Serv-U FTP Server Directory Traversal Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Serv-U FTP Server is prone to a directory traversal vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the FTP request, leading to an exploitable directory traversal. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: ProFTPD Server Username Handling SQL Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in ProFTPD that could be exploited by remote attackers to conduct SQL injection attacks on the server. This flaw is due to improper validation of a user-supplied username string before being used in an SQL query. A remote unauthenticated attacker can trigger this vulnerability by sending a malicious username to the target ProFTPD server and gain the privileges of a legitimate user.

NAME: Microsoft Windows FTP Client Arbitrary File Write Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows FTP client is probe to a arbitrary file write vulnerability. The vulnerability is caused due to an error in the Windows FTP client in validating file name to be downloaded. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted filename to a remote FTP server. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: FreeBSD ftpd and ProFTPD Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: FreeBSD ftpd and ProFTPD is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the FTP request, leading to an exploitable directory traversal. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: BSD-based FTP Servers Glob Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a buffer overflows in BSD-based FTP servers which allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary commands via a long pattern string. The vulnerability is due to a bug in the glob() function.

NAME: Wzdftpd Server SITE Command Arbitrary Command Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Wzdftpd server version 0.5.4 is prone to remote command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP commands. Thevulnerability is due to lack of filtering of shell metacharacters on the SITE command parameters. An attacker could exploit thevulnerability by passing a crafted FTP SITE command, that could lead to arbitrary command execution. A successful exploit could help the attacker read/write files on the server, create accounts on the server, upload/download malicious files to the server.

NAME: WebStar FTP Server Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: 4D WebSTAR 5.3.2 and earlier versions are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP commands.  The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while copying FTP command parameters to finite stack buffers, leading to a stack overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted FTP command to a vulnerable server, which could allow remote code execution.

NAME: XM Easy Personal FTP Server NLST DoS
DESCRIPTION: XM Easy Personal FTP server 5.6.0 and lower is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is manifested with a crafted NLST command. A successful attack could crash the server and thus cause a denial of service condition.

NAME: ProFTPD FTP Server TELNET_IAC Stack Buffer Overflow Vulenrability
DESCRIPTION: ProFTPD FTP Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ftp requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on TELNET_IAC code in the ftp request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ftp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: WFTPD FTP Server Commands Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: WFTPD Pro server version below 3.22 are prone to a stack overflow vulnerability. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on certain FTP command arguments. Since the user-supplied arguments are copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a malformed FTP request, and cause arbitrary code execution on the victim server.

NAME: Titan FTP Server Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: Titan FTP Server 6.26 build 630 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is manifested when the "SITE WHO" command is issued. A successful attack could crash the server and thus cause a denial of service condition.

NAME: Apache mod_include Local Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the Apache web server's Server Side Includes (SSI) functionality. A specially crafted file can trigger a memory buffer overflow. This condition allows a malicious user to stage an attack which may result in arbitrary code execution on the vulnerable system with the privileges of the Apache process.

NAME: Microsoft IIS FTPd NLST Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft IIS FTP Server is prone to a stack buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on NLST command in the FTP request, leading to an exploitable stack overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted NLST request/response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: FTP evasion attack
DESCRIPTION: Attackers can put telnet options in FTP traffic to evade IPS/IDS tools. This signature would be triggered when these evasion techniques are detected.

NAME: FTP String format anomaly
DESCRIPTION: HD Soft Windows FTP Server is prone to a remote format string vulnerability when processing a malicious request from a client. The vulnerability presents itself when the server receives a malicious request containing an embedded format string specifiers from a remote client that supplies an User name during FTP authentication. This could be exploited to crash the server but could also theoretically permit corruption/disclosure of memory contents and execution of arbitrary code.

NAME: Internet Explorer FTP Response Parsing Heap Overwrite Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a heap overwrite vulnerability while parsing malformed FTP responses.The vulnerability exists in the wininet.dll FTP client code, which is used by IE while parsing FTP responses.The vulnerability is due to a heap overwrite which happens when an FTP response of a specific length is sent to IE,which causes a null byte to be written to heap buffer. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by embedding an imagein a webpage, which points to a malicious FTP server, and enticing the user to visit the webpage. When the user visits theFTP URL, the attacker could send malformed FTP responses, and cause code execution on the victim client machine.

NAME: Guild FTPd Heap Corruption DoS
DESCRIPTION: Guild FTPd is prone to a heap corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of certain FTP requests, causing a heap corruption.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request, thus crashing the server. A successful attack could lead to a denial of service condition.

NAME: CesarFTP MKD Command Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in CesarFTP server. The vulnerability is caused due to a boundary error within the handling of the MKD command. This can be exploited to cause a stack-based buffer overflow and may allow arbitrary code execution.

NAME: CA Secure Content Manager FTP Gateway LIST Command Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: CA Secure Content Manager FTP Gateway is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on LIST field in the FTP responses, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP responses. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: NetTerm NetFtpd USER Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: NetFtpd for NetTerm 5.1.1 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing a crafted USER FTPcommand. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the FTP command parameters, leading to buffer overflowon the server. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted USER FTP command, which could exploit the buffer overflowand cause remote code execution.

NAME: 3Com 3CDaemon FTP Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: 3Com 3CDaemon FTP Server is prone to a information disclosure vulnerability while parsing a crafted USER FTP command. The vulnerability is due to one design error of the FTP server, leading to information leak. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted FTP command, which could lead to information leak about the FTP server.

NAME: FTP MKD Command Parameter Too Long
DESCRIPTION: FTP MKD command parameter is too long. It could cause buffer overflow to target FTP server.

NAME: FileCOPA Directory Argument Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: FileCOPA FTP Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ftp request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on LIST in the ftp request, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ftp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Easy FTP Server v1.7.0.11 LIST Command Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Easy FTP Server is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the FTP request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: WU-FTPD File Globbing Request Parsing DoS
DESCRIPTION: wu-ftpd 2.6.1 and 2.6.2 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is present in the wu_fnmatch function and is due to the improper handling of a glob pattern with large number of * characters. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted directory listing request. A successful exploit could crash the server, thus leading to a denial of service condition.

NAME: Google Chrome FTP Malicious PWD Response Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Google Chrome is prone to a DoS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ftp responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on pwd path in the ftp response, leading to an exploitable DoS. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ftp response. A successful attack could lead to Chrome crash.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer FTP Client Directory Traversal Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Internet Explorer handles filenames downloaded via the FTP protocol. Insufficient input validation can allow for the creation of a file in an arbitrary location on the client filesystem. Exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to modify the local content of a target system, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the security context of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Sami FTP Server 2.0.2 Remote Stack Based Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sami FTP Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ftp requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user in the ftp request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ftp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Golden FTP Server APPE Command Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Golden FTP Server version 1.92 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing a long APPE command. NAME: Win FTP Server WFTPSRV.exe LIST FTP Command Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Win FTP Server WFTPSRV.exe. The vulnerability is due to insufficient bounds checking on certain FTP service commands. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted FTP LIST service command to the target server, potentially causing arbitrary code injection and execution with the privileges of the affected process.

NAME: Ipswitch WS_FTP XMD5 Command Parsing Buffer Overflow

Thevulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the parameter value passed to the XMD5 command, leadingto an exploitable buffer overflow. NAME: 3Com 3CDaemon FTP Server Username Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the FTP command parameters, leading to buffer overflowon the server. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted USER FTP command, which could exploit the buffer overflowand cause remote code execution.

NAME: Microsoft Windows 7 IIS FTPSVC Unauthorized Remote DOS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows 7 IIS is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on stub data in FTP requests, leading to a denial of service vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted FTP request. A successful attack could force a server restart, leading to a denial of service condition.

NAME: FTP Netterm LIST Command Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in FTP Netterm server. The vulnerability is caused due to a boundary error within the handling of the LIST command. This can be exploited to cause a stack-based buffer overflow and may allow arbitrary code execution.

NAME: VSFTPD Connection Handling DOS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability in vsftpd exists which allows a remote attacker to cause a race condition on the target server. Upon exploitation, the target will stop accepting new FTP connections, which leads to a denial of service condition.

NAME: Serv-U LIST parameter Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Serv-U FTP server, a popular Windows FTP server, is vulnerable to a buffer overrun. Serv-U FTP server versions 5.0.0.4 and below do not correctly validate input when an FTP LIST or NLST command is run with long malformed parameters. An attack using this vulnerability can crash the remote FTP service on the remote target.

NAME: Wu-Ftpd Remote Format String Stack Overwrite Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The lreply function in wu-ftpd 2.6.0 and earlier does not properly cleanse an untrusted format string, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via the SITE EXEC command.

NAME: FreeFTPd Server USER Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

NAME: ProFTPD _xlate_ascii_write Off-By-Two Buffer Overrun Vulnerability

DESCRIPTION: FreeFTPd version 1.0.9 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing a crafted USER FTPcommand. NAME: Novell Netware FTP Server DELE Command Stack Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Novell Netware FTP Server is prone to a stack buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FTP request. NAME: CesarFTP MKD Command Parameter Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: CesarFTP 0.99g and earlier versions of the FTP server are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability. NAME: Microsoft IIS FTP Connection Status Request Denial of Service Vulnerability

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Object Security Bypass Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability within Microsoft Outlook 2003 that can be triggered remotely through a maliciously crafted email message. This message could bypass Outlook 2003's "Restricted Zone" security setting and gain access to remote resources.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Attachment Name Verify Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while verifying certain crafted attachments.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on attachment extension name in the outlook, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending an attachment with a crafted link. NAME: Eureka Mail Client ERR Response Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

NAME: Axigen POP3 Service Remote Format String Vulnerability

NAME: NakedSoft Gaucho POP3 Email Header Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: NakedSoft Gaucho is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted email message body. NAME: Pop Peeper Response Date Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Pop Peeper version 3.4 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted POP3 responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on values passed in a date field in POP3 response, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted POP3 response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Novell eDirectory iMonitor HTTPSTK Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The Novell eDirectory server iMonitor is prone to a stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform sufficient bounds checking on client-supplied data before copying it to a buffer.An attacker could leverage this issue to have arbitrary code execute with administrative privileges. A successful exploit could result in the complete compromise of the affected system.

NAME: SLMail POP3 Server PASS Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

Asuccessful exploit could lead to remote code execution, or cause denial of service on the POP3 server.

NAME: POP3 overlong USER Commands anomaly
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a overly long username is passing to a POP3 server. Alt-N MDaemon POP3 Server is susceptible to multiple remote buffer-overflow vulnerabilities. This may facilitate the compromise o

NAME: POP3 overlong PASS Commands anomaly

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes Speed Reader exploit

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Express and Windows Mail Integer Overflow Vulnerability

NAME: Email Protocol Attachment Evasive Encoding Found
DESCRIPTION: Attacker can encode the file attachment with quoted-printable or uuencode to bypass certain IPS product. This signature indicate an evasive encoding attempt found in network.

NAME: Cerulean Studios Trillian Image Filename XML Tag Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a stack buffer overflow vulnerability in Trillian instant messenger client application. Successful exploitation can lead to arbitrary code execution within the security context of the currently logged on user.

NAME: Gaim AIM-ICQ Protocol Handling Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A heap buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the Gaim instant messaging client. The vulnerability is created by the improper handling of Away messages in the AIM and ICQ protocols. The exploitation of this vulnerability may allow malicious users to inject and execute arbitrary code on a target host with the privileges of the current logged in user.

NAME: Trillian AIM XML Tag Handling Heap Overflow

The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of malformed XML tags. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ICQ response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IBM DB2 Universal Database XML Query Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM DB2 Universal Database application is probe to a stack buffer overflow vulnerability.
