NAME: IBM Database Server Invalid Data Stream Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: IBM DB2 database server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DB2 requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper validation checks while processing certain malformed data streams. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DB2 request. A successful attack could crash the server and thus lead to a denial of service condition.

NAME: DB2 Database Login Failed
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a DB2 database login authentication failed. A multiple failed authentication response means an attack is try to brute-force user name and password.

NAME: IBM DB2 Universal Database Connection Handshake Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the IBM DB2 Universal Database product. The vulnerability is due to a failure in handlingexceptional conditions when setting up Distributed Relational Database Architecture (DRDA) protocol sessions. An optional RDBNAM parametersupplied during the handshake procedure may result in the server becoming unstable resulting in its eventual shutdown.

NAME: IBM DB2 Universal Database receiveDASMessage Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM DB2 Universal Database is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DB2 request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in theDB2 request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DB2 request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Express And Windows Mail NNTP Protocol Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook Express and Windows Mail are prone to a remote heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. The vulnerabilityis due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing certain long malformed NNTP responses. Since the user-supplied datais copied to finite heap buffers, it could lead to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the user to visit a web site that host user-provided content or advertisements, or open a link to the attacker's NNTP server. A successful exploit could leadto remote code execution or a denial-of-service condition on the victim machine.

NAME: InterNetNews Control Message Handling Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in InterNetNews (INN), which can be exploited by malicious people to compromise a vulnerable system. The vulnerability is caused due to a boundary error in the "ARTpost()" function during the handling of control messages. This can result in a buffer overflow when filing these into per-type newsgroups.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Express NNTP List Handler Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook Express is prone to a remote stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability. The vulnerabilityis due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing certain long malformed NNTP responses to a LIST command. Since the user-supplied datais copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the user to visit a web site that host user-provided content or advertisements, or open a link to the attacker's NNTP server. A successful exploit could leadto remote code execution or a denial-of-service condition on the victim machine.

NAME: Microsoft Windows NNTP Server XPAT Command Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows NNTP server prone to a remote buffer overflow vulnerability. The vulnerabilityis due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing a long malformed XPAT command. Since the user-supplied datais copied to finite heap buffers, it could lead to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted XPAT command to the NNTP component of IIS server on avulnerable windows machine. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: InterNetNews NULL Path Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability occurs in the innd daemon, which handles NNTP connections. The innd daemon can be forced to terminate by causing an access violation (raising a SIGSEGV). This vulnerability can be exploited for Denial of Service.

NAME: Apple QuickTime PICT Unspecified Tag Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Quikctime is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PICT images.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on unspecified tag data in the PICT files, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PICT image. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Macromedia Flash Player Improper Memory Access
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way that Macromedia Flash Player processes SWF files. The vulnerable product does not properly validate the usersupplied data. A remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the target by enticing the targeted user to open acrafted SWF file.

NAME: UltraVNC VNCLog Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the UltraVNC server. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on a long HTTP GET request to TCP port 5800, which triggers an overflow in VNCLog::ReallyPrint. A successful attack can result in the termination of the UltraVNC service.

NAME: phpScheduleit 1.2.10 Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: phpScheduleit 1.2.10 is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable SQL injection.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle BEA Weblogic Server console-help.portal Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a cross-site scripting vulnerability in BEA Weblogic Server. The vulnerability is due to an input validation error in certain console-help.portal pages that allow attackers to inject arbitrary HTML and JavaScript code that would be executed in a user's web browser. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary HTML or script code on the client system.

NAME: Nullsoft WinAmp Ultravox ultravox-max-msg Header Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the Nullsoft Winamp multimedia player. The flaw manifests itself during the processing of crafted Ultravox protocol responses. Exploitation of this vulnerability may allow an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code on the target host.

NAME: Mambo Gallery Manager help.mgm.php mosConfig_absolute_path Parameter PHP File Include Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mambo Gallery Manager help.mgm.php mosConfig_absolute_path Parameter is prone to a PHP file include vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP requests, leading to an exploitable file include vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IrfanView FlashPix Parsing Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: FlashPix plugin for IrfanView 4.10 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted fpx files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields passed in an fpx file, leading to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted fpx file and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Apache Server Multiple Space Header Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apache server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on header data in HTTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP protocol request. A successful attack could lead to denial of service.

NAME: Microsoft Office PowerPoint Integer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office PowerPoint is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PowerPoint files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks when using some integer from use provided PowerPoint files , leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PowerPoint file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox About:Blank Spoof Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Firefox is prone to a address bar spoofing vulnerability while parsing certain crafted html pages.The weakness is caused due to Firefox allowing scripts to open a tab with a blank address bar and add arbitrary content to it.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted html page. This can be used to evoke a false sense of security or authority in casual users.

NAME: NT IIS4 Remote Web-Based Administration Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows IIS is prone to a information disclosure vulnerability while parsing certain crafted http requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on ISAPI request data to ism.dll. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted http request. A successful attack could lead to information disclosure.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer CSS Property Method Handling Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exist a memory corruption vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer product. The vulnerability is due to the way that Internet Explorer handles CSS property method calls. Remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability by persuading target users to visit a specially crafted web page. Successful exploitation may allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable client system, in the context of the logged in user.

NAME: Activist Mobilization Platform base.php base_path Parameter PHP File Include Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Activist Mobilization Platform base.php base_path Parameter is prone to a PHP file include vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP requests, leading to an exploitable file include vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Shell Buffer Long Font Overflow Vulnerbility
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Shell is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted LNK files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on font properties in the lnk file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted lnk file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows WebDAV Mini-Redirector Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability has been reported in the WebDAV Mini-Redirector component of Microsoft Windows. The flaw can be triggered during the processing of WebDAV responses, causing a heap overflow. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by persuading the target user to connect to a malicious WebDAV server. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary code execution in the SYSTEM security context.

NAME: PHP Arbitrary File Location Upload Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: PHP before 5.0.2 is prone to an arbitrary file location upload vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of the Content-Disposition MIME header. An attacker could control the location of an uploaded file by supplying an arbitrary file name and path through this header. A successful exploit could cause possibly malicious files to be uploaded to an arbitrary location on the vulnerable system, leading to arbitrary code execution.

NAME: Squid NTLM fakeauth_auth Helper Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists within the NTLM authentication mechanism implemented in the Squid web proxy/cache. During the NTLM authentication process, a malformed type-3 authentication message can cause the NTLM module of a vulnerable Squid server to dereference a null pointer. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to create a denial of service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Word Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Word is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DOC files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the DOC file, leading to an memory corruption.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DOC file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Trend Micro OfficeScan objRemoveCtrl ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Trend Micro OfficeScan is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses. The vulnerability is present in the ObjRemoveCtrl Class ActiveX control and is due to the lack of proper checks on strings passed to certain properties. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing a victim to visit a crafted webpage containing the control. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Adobe Products PNG File Handling Stack Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a stack buffer overflow vulnerability in the Adobe products. The vulnerability is due to improper boundary validation when processing PNG images. The flaw can be leveraged remotely to execute arbitrary code under the context of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Microsoft Excel FRTWrapper  Record  Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a stack buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted EXCEL files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on FRTWrapper record in the EXCEL file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted EXCEL file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: TSEP colorswitch.php tsep_config[absPath] Parameter PHP File Include Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: TSEP colorswitch.php tsep_config[absPath] Parameter is prone to a PHP file include vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP requests, leading to an exploitable file include vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Application Server Forms Arbitrary System Command Execution
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Forms Services, a component of Oracle Application Server is prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to a flaw that allows unrestricted execution of forms from an absolute path. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by uploading an Oracle Forms executable, and then referencing it using an absolute pathname argument in the form or module parameters to f90servlet. A successful attack could allow arbitrary command

NAME: IBM Tivoli Provisioning Manager Authorization Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: IBM Tivoli Provisioning Manager for OS Deployment before 5.1 is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in rembo.exe service listening on TCP port 8080. The issue arises due to the lack of proper length checks on URI path and Authorization fields in a HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: CUPS CGI Interface Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Common Unix Printing System (CUPS)is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted http request.The vulnerability is due to a boundary error in handling of incoming CGI requests.A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Adobe Flash Player ActionScript intrf_count Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: An integer overflow vulnerability exists in Adobe Flash Player. The vulnerability is due to lack of validation for the size of an interface array, 'intrf_count', before using it in an arithmetic operation. This leads to memory corruption and can allow for arbitrary code execution.              In an attack scenario, where arbitrary code is injected and executed on the target system, the behaviour of the target is dependent on the intention of the malicious code. The injected code will be run with privileges of the currently logged on user.              In an attack case where code injection is not successful, the affected application will terminate abnormally causing a denial of service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Malformed IFRAME Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability when parsing a malformed iframe, frame, or embed HTML tag.The vulnerability is present in IE when handling overly long src and name attributes of the mentioned HTML elements, corrupting the heap in an exploitable way.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page using the vulnerable HTML elements, and convincing the user to download the page. A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, or might result in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: HTTP Apache Struts Error Response Cross-Site Scripting
DESCRIPTION: Apache Struts is prone to a cross site scripting attack vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in field request URL. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to script execution in the user's browser.

NAME: Internet Explorer Popup.Show Drag and Drop Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a drag and drop vulnerability, when the Popup.Show methodis used in conjunction with certain mouse events.The vulnerability is due to the lack of validity checks on the methods which are valid for mouse events.Such a vulnerability could be exploited to drop arbitrary files onto a victim machine's local folders,through a single mouse click.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page and enticing the user to downloadand click on the webpage.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution.

NAME: Mozilla Browser Non-ASCII Hostname Heap Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way several versions of the Mozilla browser parse URLs containing non-ASCII characters. If the hostname component of a URL contains non-ASCII characters, a memory allocation error occurs, resulting in a buffer overflow. A remote attacker could leverage this vulnerability to perform arbitrary code execution on the target system.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Image Color Management Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted EMF files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on color file name length in the EMF file, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted EMF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: McAfee Viruscan McSubMgr.DLL ActiveX Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: McAfee Viruscan McSubMgr.DLL is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX method calls. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in GetUserRegisteredForBackend method in the HTML file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow vulnerability.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: RealNetworks RealPlayer URL Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way RealNetworks' RealPlayer products handle the parsing of URLs. A heap buffer overflow can occur when parsing a URL with a large number of period characters ("."). Using a specially crafted URL, an attacker can exploit this vulnerability to remotely execute arbitrary code.

NAME: Apple QuickTime Crafted Media File FlipFileTypeAtom_BtoN Integer Underflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in Apple QuickTime. The flaw is due to an integer underflow error in the "FlipFileTypeAtom_BtoN" function when processing crafted QuickTime media files. Successful exploitation allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code under the context of the currently logged-in user.

NAME: RealNetworks Helix Server Long GET URI Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: RealNetworks Helix Universal Server 9.0 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks while handling long HTTP URIs, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Office Excel Cache Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Excel is prone to an memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted xls file.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the xls file, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted xls file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Ipswitch IMail Web Calendaring Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Ipswitch Imail 8.13, and other versions before IMail Server 8.2 Hotfix 2 is prone to an arbitrary file read vulnerability while parsingcertain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in the Web Calendaring server, and is due to the lack of proper checkson certain HTTP requests to non-existent jsp files. When such a request is combined with directory traversal in the query string, itcould lead to arbitrary file disclosure. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to a non-existent jsp file to read arbitrary files on the server.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer OBJECT Tag Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Buffer overflow in Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.01, 5.5, and 6.0 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code via / (slash) characters in the Typeproperty of an Object tag in a web page.

NAME: Yahoo Widgets Engine YDPCTL.DLL ActiveX DoS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Yahoo Widgets Engine YDPCTL.DLL is prone to a Deny of Service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX method calls. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in GetComponentVersion method in the HTML file, leading to an exploitable Deny of Service vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Uninitialized Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Internet Explorer accesses an object that has been deleted.   The issue is caused by the CSS handling in Internet Explorer which can cause memory corruption and may lead to a crash or remote code execution.

NAME: Microsoft ADFS Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on HTTP headers in the HTTP request, leading to an code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the IIS process.

NAME: Microsoft Winhlp32 Compressed Phrase Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability in the way Microsoft Winhlp32 validates a length value calculated from values taken from a help (.hlp) file. Insufficient length checks of specially crafted values can lead to a buffer overflow. This flaw results in a memory copy operation leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user.

NAME: Yahoo! Messenger Webcam Upload ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Yahoo! Messenger Webcam Upload ActiveX Control is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML pages.The vulnerability is caused due to the lack of proper checks in 'server' property, leading to a stack overflow. .An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by building a malicious HTML page. A successful attack could lead to denial of service of the target application.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Transition Handling Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted html pages. The vulnerability is due to an error in transition handling when navigating between Web pages in the html page, leading to an exploitable code execution vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted html page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Adobe Reader and Acrobat JBIG2Decode Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Adobe Reader and Acrobat are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PDF files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on JBIG2Decode data in the PDF file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PDF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Sun Microsystems JDK Image Parsing Library ICC Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: An integer overflow vulnerability exists in the way Sun JDK image parser handles JPG files. The vulnerability is due to improper checking of the ICC profile data when parsing JPG files. A remote attacker may leverage this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code on the target host, in the context of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Mozilla Browser/Firefox XBM Image Processing Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the Mozilla Firefox browser's image rendering code. The flaw is specific to improper processing of the XBM image file format. This vulnerability allows an attacker to craft a malicious image that results in a heap buffer overflow condition which may lead to process flow diversion.

NAME: Symantec AntiVirus Scan Engine Administrative Interface Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Symantec AntiVirus Scan Engine 4.0 and 4.3 are prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is present in the administrative web interface running on port 8004. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain user-supplied negative values in HTTP request headers, leading to an exploitable integer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted http request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer HTML Objects Unexpected Method Calls Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted html pages.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on unexpected method calls to HTML objects,, leading to an exploitable memory corruption vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Data directory Address Out of Range PE File
DESCRIPTION: This is a anomaly PE file, some PE engine will be overflowed while parsing this malformed PE file, for example, Microsoft .NET Framework will be exploited for this PE file.

NAME: Winamp Ultravox Streaming Metadata Multiple Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerabilities
DESCRIPTION: Winamp is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ultravox streaming data.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on name and artist tag in the ultravox streaming response, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ultravox streaming response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: KDE Konqueror JavaScript IFrame Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: KDE Konqueror is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted web pages.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on "IFRAME" tag in the web page, leading to a denial of service vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a html file that contain "ftp://" URL in an IFRAME tag . A successful attack could lead to denial of service.

NAME: Internet Explorer CreateControlRange DHTML Method Heap Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a heap corruption vulnerability when certainDHTML methods such as createControlRange() are used in a malicious manner. The vulnerability is a boundary condition error triggered when the method is passedcrafted data, thus causing a heap overflow.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page using the vulnerableDHTML method, and convincing the user to download the page.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, or mightresult in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Nagios Statuswml Cgi Command Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Nagios is prone to a command injection vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in statuswml.cgi and is due to the improper sanitization of ping parameter, which is used to invoke the ping command. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request containing shell commands in the ping parameter in a HTTP request. A successful exploit could lead to arbitrary command execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox  _cairo_pen_init Function Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SVG files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in SVG file, leading to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SVG file response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Novell GroupWise Messenger HTTP Response Handling Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Novell GroupWise Messenger (GWIM) Client before 2.0.3 HP1 for Windows is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on strings passed to the client after the NM_A_SZ_TRANSACTION_ID field name. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the victim to visit a crafted webpage. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the messenger client.

NAME: HCP URI Handler Arbitrary Command Execution
DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while handling certain crafted URLs sent in a HTML page. The vulnerability could be exploited to break the security sandbox of IE and execute arbitrary code or download malicious files to the victim machine. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted web page and enticing a victim to visit the malicious page.

NAME: Microsoft Excel Indexing Validation Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted excel files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted excel file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Apple QuickTime RTSP URI Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple QuickTime 7.1.3 and lower is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted webpages. The vulnerabilityis due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing crafted long rtsp:// URIs, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attackercould exploit the vulnerability by crafting a webpage containing a long rtsp URI, or crafting a QTL file, and enticing a victim todownload the file or page. A successful attack could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Crystal Reports Web Viewer Information Disclosure
DESCRIPTION: Crystal Reports is prone to a arbitrary file access vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on DynamicImage parameter passed to the CrystalImageHandler script. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful exploit could allow arbitrary files view and delete operations on the vulnerable server.

NAME: ELOG Web Logbook Attached Filename Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ELOG Web Logbook is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on the length of attached filename, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted http request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Multiple Vendor Anti-Virus Magic Byte Detection Evasion Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in multiple AV scanning products. The vulnerability is created by improperly implemented file type checking mechanisms. It has been found by experimentation with various types of files, that the affected virus scanners do not apply sufficient checks when determining the type of the file to be scanned. For example, if the first 2 bytes of a file are the ASCII characters "MZ", then the file is assumed to be a genuine Windows executable. If this determination is made during a file scan then only known malicious patterns which pertain to executable files will be applied in the scan. All other patterns will be ignored as the file is deemed to be an executable binary.

NAME: Squid Web Proxy NTLM Authentication Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Squid Web Proxy Cache versions 2.5.x and 3.x are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing NTLM authentication credentials.The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while copying user-supplied information present in the NTLM credentials, leadingto an exploitable buffer overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing crafted NTLM credentials, whichcould potentially cause remote code execution.

NAME: McAfee Anti-Virus ZIP Archive Virus Detection Bypass
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way McAfee Anti-Virus engine scans ZIP archives. The affected software may bypass file entries in a specially crafted ZIP file archive. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to bypass the anti-virus protection and deliver malicious content to the target. If crafted ZIP file archive is delivered to a system which performs on-access scanning, the malicious content will be detected before it is executed, mitigating the impact of this vulnerability.            Note that this vulnerability also exists in several other Anti-Virus product lines from multiple vendors. The list of vendors with affected product lines includes Computer Associates, Kaspersky, Sophos, Eset, GeCAD Software. Please refer to Section 2 for further details.

NAME: Citrix MetaFrame Web Manager login.asp Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Citrix MetaFrame Web Manager is prone to a cross-site scripting vulnerability while parsing certain crafted http parameters.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on NFuse_Message parameter in the login.asp request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted login request. A successful attack could lead to script code execution with the context of current logged-in user;

NAME: Motorola Wireless Router WR850G Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Motorola Wireless Router WR850G is prone to an authentication bypass vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability enables an attacker to log into the routers web interface without knowing the username/password combination and gain knowledge of the router's username and password after logging in.

NAME: Apple Safari Webkit Floating Point Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Apple Safari is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML pages. The vulnerability is present in the webkit component and is due to the improper handling of floating point numbers. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted webpage and enticing the victim to visit the page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer OnUnload Null Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. This vulnerability exists due to insufficient input validation in the HTML data. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server. A successful attack could lead to code execution in the context of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Install Engine ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Install Engine ActiveX Control (asctrls.ocx) is prone to a heap-based overflow vulnerability.The vulnerability is due to the lack of length checks when parsing arguments to the SetCifFilefunction.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page using the vulnerablecontrol, and convincing the user to download the page.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, or mightresult in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook ole32.dll ActiveX DoS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook ole32.dll is prone to a Deny of Service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX method calls. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in unknow method in the HTML file, leading to an exploitable Deny of Service vulnerability.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox UTF-8 URL Handling Stack Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on UTF-8 URL in the HTTP response, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Windows IE7 Unload Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 which allows remote attackers to prevent users from leaving a site, spoof the address bar, and conductphishing and other attacks via onUnload Javascript handlers.

NAME: Microsoft Office Malformed String Parsing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability when parsing certainUNICODE strings in an office file.The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the length fieldof certain UNICODE strings in an office file. Since, this length value could laterbe used for memory copy operation, it could potentially lead to an exploitablebuffer overflow.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting an office file with a malformedUNICODE string, and convincing the user to download and open the file.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, installation of malicious files,and thereby complete compromise of the victim machine.

NAME: Microsoft Office Excel 2000 OBJ Record Stack Buffer Overflow  Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Excel is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted EXCEL files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on OBJ Record in the EXCEL file, leading to an exploitable code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted EXCEL file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Alt-N SecurityGateway Username Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SecurityGateway is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to adequately bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it to an insufficiently sized buffer.Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Microsoft IE COM Object Instantiation Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability. The vulnerability is exposed when the 'javaprxy.dll' COM object is instantiated by a malicious Web page.This issue may potentially be exploited to execute arbitrary code in the context of the client.

NAME: Zinf Malformed Playlist File Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Zinf is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted playlist files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the playlist file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted playlist file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: HTTP Macrovision FLEXnet Connect DownloadManager File Download Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Macrovision is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX method calls. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in DownloadAndExecute method in the HTML file, leading to an exploitable code execution vulnerability.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Visio Memory Validation Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Visio is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted .DXF files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the DXF files, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted .DXF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: RealPlayer ierpplug.dll ActiveX Control Playlist Name Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

NAME: Boite de News index.php url_index Parameter PHP File Include

NAME: EMC Captiva PixTools ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Creation

NAME: Microsoft Publisher Arbitrary Memory Reference Vulnerability

NAME: Microsoft Excel Rich Text Validation Vulnerability

NAME: HTTP Opera JPG Image DHT Marker Heap Corruption Vulnerability

NAME: Open Educational System CONF_CONFIG_PATH Parameter PHP File Include Vulnerability

NAME: HTTP Cisco 675 Web Administration Denial of Service Vulnerability

NAME: Nagios Statuswml Cgi Command Injection Vulnerability

NAME: Microsoft Word TextBox Sub-document Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: There exist a memory corruption vulnerability in Microsoft Word. The vulnerability is due to improper processing of specially crafted Microsoft Word documents. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing a target user to open a malicious file. Successful exploitation may allow arbitrary code execution in the security context of the logged in user.

NAME: CA Multiple Products gui_cm_ctrls ActiveX Control Memory Corruption  Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A memory corruption vulnerability exists in CA Multiple Products. The issue is due to insufficientverification of function arguments. NAME: PAJAX Arbitrary PHP Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: PAJAX 0.5.1 and earlier is prone to a code execution vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in pajax_call_dispatcher.php script and is due to the lack of sanitization of certain variables passed to the script. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful exploit could lead to arbitrary PHP code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: GestArt aide.php3 aide Parameter PHP File Include Vulnerability

NAME: Sun Java Web Start ActiveX Control dnsResolve Function Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sun Java Web Start ActiveX Control in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) 1.6.0_X is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML pages. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing long argumentspassed to the dnsResolve method. Since the user-supplied data is copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a webpage, which when visited could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Multiple LHA Buffer Overflow/Directory Traversal Vulnerabilities
DESCRIPTION: There is a denial of service vulnerability with the F-Secure Antiphon's family of products. A malformed LHA archive can cause a buffer overflow within the module that accesses the contents of archives during the virus scanning process. This leads to a module restart and may be considered to be a denial of service. Given that the program stack of the vulnerable product is overwritten, it may also be possible to inject malicious code into the module.

NAME: Internet Explorer WebViewFolderIcon setSlice Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability when a craftedargument is passed to the setSlice method of WebViewFolderIcon ActiveX object.The vulnerability leads to an invalid memory copy, which could be exploited by an attackerto cause code execution. NAME: Apache HTTP Server mod_tcl Module Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apache HTTP server is prone to format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP request.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. NAME: AVS Media AVSMJPEGFILE.DLL ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow  Vulnerability

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Content-Type Denial Of Service Vulnerability

NAME: Moodle Tex Filter Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

NAME: Symantec AppStream Client LaunchObj ActiveX Control Arbitrary Program Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a remote code execution vulnerability in Symantec AppStream Client. NAME: Oracle Secure Backup Administration Server Command Injection

The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain parameters passed in a HTTP request. An authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. NAME: Microsoft Word File Handling Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

NAME: HP OpenView Network Node Manager Snmp.exe CGI Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: HP OpenView Network Node Manager (OV NNM) 7.01, 7.51, and 7.53 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on oid parameter value passed to the snmp.exe CGI script. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Adobe Acrobat Local File Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the Adobe Acrobat ActiveX web control. The vulnerable web control does not properly limit access to local file system information when a specially constructed web page makes use of the ActiveX component. This vulnerability can be exploited to remotely confirm the presence of files on a local file system.

NAME: Adobe Flash Player Multimedia File DefineSceneAndFrameLabelData Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Adobe Flash Player is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted FLASH files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on DefineScene And FrameLabel Data in the SWF file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SWF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Apache APR_PSPrintf Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apache Web Server is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted http request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the host field in HTTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to code execution on the target server.

NAME: MW6 PDF417 ActiveX Control Multiple Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerabilities
DESCRIPTION: MW6 PDF417 ActiveX Control is prone to a file overwrite vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in HTTP request.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary file overwrite with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Opera Browser data URI Scheme Address Bar Spoofing
DESCRIPTION: Opera browser is prone to a spoofing vulnerability while handling certain crafted web pages. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of certain long URIs using the data URI scheme, with trailing whitespace, which prevents the beginning of the URI from being displayed. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing a user to visit a crafted webpage. A successful attack could misguide a victim to a spoofed website instead of the real one, which could help steal user credentials.

NAME: Microsoft Management Console Zone Bypass
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Management Console (MMC) is prone to a cross-zone scripting vulnerability when using mmcndmgr.dll. The vulnerability is because Microsoft Windows fails to restrict access toembedded HTML resource files within the DLL from the Internet Zone. An attacker could exploitthe vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, leading to complete control of the machine.

NAME: MS IE PPStream PowerPlayer.DLL ActiveX Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: MS IE PPStream PowerPlayer.DLL is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX method calls. NAME: Microsoft IIS 5.0 WebDAV Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: WebDAV component of Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) Web server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. WebDAV extensions are used byadministrators to manage and edit Web content remotely and is enabled bydefault on IIS 5 installations. The vulnerability is due to the improper parsing of certainWebDav requests sent to the server, resulting in an exploitable overflow. An attackercould exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WebDav HTTP request. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Windows Internet Explorer XML SRC Parsing Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted XML  pages.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on SRC field in the XML file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability..An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML page contained XML elements. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook mailto URL Parsing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook is prone to a cross-domain security bypass vulnerabilitywhile parsing crafted "mailto:" URLs. The vulnerability is due to improperfiltering of certain characters such as quotation marks in the URL, beforepassing as an argument. It is thus possible to inject script code by crafting a URL with the unfiltered characters, which would allow script code executionin the local domain security zone.Internet Explorer is also an attack vector, since it in turn invokes Outlook witho

NAME: Microsoft Windows Explorer saved-search File Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Explorer is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted saved-search files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the saved-search file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted saved-search file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Windows Media Player PNG Parsing Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Media Player is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain malformed PNG files. The vulnerabilityis due to lack boundary checks on the chunk size of a PNG file, which is used to copy chunk data to finite stack buffers, leading toan overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a HTML file containing an OBJECT tag, that would load a crafted PNG file which would be opened with Media Player, leading to the exploitation. Alternatively, the attacker could embed the PNG file in a Media Player skin file, which when downloaded could exploit the vulnerability. A successful exploit could lead to remotecode execution, or lead to a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook MHTML URL Parsing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook Express is prone to a remote code execution vulnerabilitywhile parsing crafted MHTML URLs. MHTML is a standard format used to include HTMLcontent in an e-mail message. MS Outlook Express contains the MHTML parser and is thedefault handler for MHTML URLs. However, it contains a vulnerability when parsing a URL containing an inaccessible local file. In this case, the URL handler could be provided withan alternate URL location, which is also treated to be in the same security domain as the localfile. Thus, the cross domain security restrictions could be bypassed by crafting such as MHTML URL,to download arbitrary files to a victim machine. Internet Explorer is also an attack vector, since it in turn invokes Outlook without needing any user intervention. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability bycrafting a webpage or sending a crafted HTML e-mail, which when visited or viewedcould cause remote code execution, or denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the layout engine for Mozilla Firefox
DESCRIPTION: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the layout engine for Mozilla Firefox 2.x before 2.0.0.1, 1.5.x before 1.5.0.9, Thunderbird before 1.5.0.9, and SeaMonkey before 1.0.7 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown attack vectors.

NAME: HTML Help Workshop HHP File ContentsFile Overflow
DESCRIPTION: HTML Help Workshop 4.74 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HHP files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on contents file field in the HHP project file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HHP file to the victim. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Apple QuickTime AVC1 Atom Parsing Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple QuickTime is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted movie files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on avc1 atom in the movie file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted movie file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Mozilla Products Overflow Event Handling Memory Corruption Vunerability
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Products are prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. A successful attack could lead to denial of service of the target application.

NAME: Symantec WinFax ActiveX Control Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Symantec WinFax Pro 10.03 is vulnerable to heap overflow while parsing certain malformed HTML pages. The vulnerability is present in the Symantec.FaxViewerControl.1 ActiveX control and is due to the lack of proper checks on parameters passed to the AppendFax method. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted webpage and enticing the victim to visit the page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current user.

NAME: Microsoft Publisher PUB File Processing Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: There exists a stack overflow vulnerability in the Microsoft Publisher product. The flaw is triggered when a malicious PUB file is parsed by the affected component. A successful attack targeting this vulnerability may lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the currently logged in user.

NAME: SDP Downloader ASX File Parsing Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Streaming Download Project (SDP) Downloader 2.3.0 is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ASX files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on long URLs passed in a HREF attribute of a REF element in an asx file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted asx file and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the SDP downloader.

NAME: Blender blend File Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: 3D graphics application Blender 2.34, 2.35a, 2.40, and 2.49b is prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted .blend files. Blender embeds a python interpreter to extend its functionality. However, an attacker could embed arbitrary python commands in a blend file and entice the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote command execution with the privileges of the user running the Blender software.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox arbitrary code by modifying the window.__proto__.__proto__ object
DESCRIPTION: jslock.cpp in Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.2, Firefox 2.x before 2.0.0.18, Thunderbird 2.x before 2.0.0.18, and SeaMonkey 1.x before 1.1.13 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code by modifying the window.__proto__.__proto__ object in a way that causes a lock on a non-native object, which triggers an assertion failure related to the OBJ_IS_NATIVE function.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Embedded Web Font Handling Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Windows embedded web font handling component. The vulnerability is caused by a failure to correctly validate specified allocation size values when decompressing Embedded Open Type fonts. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability by delivering a malicious embedded web font to a target host, resulting in arbitrary code execution.

NAME: PHP Zip URL Wrapper Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: PHP is prone to a remote stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PHP files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on ZIP URL in the PHP file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Symantec ConsoleUtilities ActiveX Control buffer overflow
DESCRIPTION: Symantec ConsoleUtilities ActiveX is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP response.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP response, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Web Access Login URL Redirection
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook Web Access (OWA) is prone to a cross site scripting vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP URLs. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on the parameters for URL redirection on the oawlogon.asp application. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a redirection request to the attacker's site. A successful exploit could help the attacker to spoof trusted web sites and obtain user credentials.

NAME: Microsoft Windows itss.dll CHM File Handling Heap Corruption
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Windows Infotech Storage Library. The flaw is created due to a lack of verification of a user supplied value, before using it as the size argument in a memory allocation call. Exploitation of this flaw may result in process flow diversion of the vulnerable application.

NAME: Opera 9 Configuration Overwrite Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Opera web browser versions lower than 9.10 are prone to remote code execution vulnerability while handling certain script requests in HTTP. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: RealNetworks RealPlayer Multiple Products RA File Processing Heap Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A heap overflow vulnerability exists in RealNetworks multiple products. The vulnerability is due to boundary errors when processing RealAudio (RA) files. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a crafted RA file. Successful exploitation would cause a heap overflow that may lead to arbitrary code execution in the security context of the logged in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Script Engine Stack Exhaustion Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A stack exhaustion vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Internet Explorer Script Engine. The flaw is caused by certain types of recursive function calls in Javascript code. NAME: Google Apps mailto URI Command Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Google Apps is prone to a command injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted URI links sent in a HTML page. NAME: Remote Desktop Connection ActiveX Control Heap Overflow Vulnerability

NAME: Oracle Portal Container_Tabs JSP Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability

NAME: Microsoft Office Excel Could Allow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

NAME: Macromedia JRun 4.x Server File Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability in the way Macromedia JRun server processes URLs. A specially crafted request for a file can bypass access restrictions on JRun. This can result in the source of the requested script file to be served rather than the intended script output. This vulnerability may be leveraged to reveal sensitive information such as account names, passwords, paths to internal resources, and so on.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer chtskdic.dll COM Object Instantiation Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a code execution vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTML pages. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of certain COM objects implemented by chtskdic.dll, that are not designed to work with Internet Explorer. The object when instantiated in IE could lead to an exploitable memory corruption. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing a victim to visit a crafted webpage. A successful attack could lead to remote code executio

NAME: VMware Vielib.DLL ActiveX Control Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: VMware 6.0.0 is prone to a code execution vulnerability in the vielib.dll ActiveX control version 2.2.5.42958 while handlingcertain requests to the control. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of arguments passed to certain functionsof the control, which could lead to remote command execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a webpageusing the control, and enticing a victim to visit the webpage. A asuccessful attack could lead to code execution with theprivileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Internet Explorer AnchorClick Behavior Drag and Drop Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a drag and drop vulnerability, when the AnchorClick style behavior isused in a malformed manner. The vulnerability is due to the lack of validity checks on the FOLDER property used with the AnchorClickbehavior, which can also be used to access the local folders on the victim machine.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page using the anchorclick behavior,to drop malicious files on a victim machine's folder, such as the startup folder.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution.

NAME: Comet WebFileManager CheckUpload.php Language Parameter PHP File Include Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Comet WebFileManager CheckUpload.php. The flaw is due to lack of validation in Language parameter  when handling HTTP requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leverage this vulnerability to include file from any URL.

NAME: HTTP ArGoSoft Mail Server MLSRVX.DLL Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ArGoSoft Mail Server is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite arbitrary files. An attacker can exploit this issue to overwrite arbitrary files on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Successful exploits will allow the attacker to cause denial-of-service conditions; other consequences are possible.

NAME: Symantec Norton AntiSpam SymSpamHelper Class Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Norton Internet Security 2004 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML document. The vulnerability is caused due to a boundary error within the "SymSpamHelper Class" (symspam.dll) ActiveX component. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML document. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: HTTP Request ACE Encoded Domain Name Access
DESCRIPTION: Punycode (RFC 3492) ACE is a syntax to uniquely encode Unicode strings as an ASCII string, specifically the subset of ASCII characters allowed in host names (letters, digits, and hyphen). These punycode encoded domains can be crafted to resemble trusted domains using homograph characters from other character sets.

NAME: Internet Explorer Location Header Zone Bypass Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a cross-domain security bypass vulnerability, when parsing a URL redirection using a "Location" header.The vulnerability is due to the lack of validity checks on the domain of a redirected URL when prependedwith the "URL:", which would allow an attacker to redirect a page even to the local security zone.When combined with other zone bypassing techniques, an attacker could installmalicious files on a victim machine.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page and enticing the user to downloadand click on the webpage.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution.

NAME: Microsoft Word Pointer Manipulation Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Word 2000, 2002, and Word Viewer 2003 are prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing malformed word document files. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of a pointer obtained from the word document, whichis later used in a memmove operation, which could be controlled by the attacker. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing a user to open a crafted word document, hosted on a website, or sent through e-mail. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution in the context of the currently logged-in user, or lead to a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox iframe.contentWindow.focus Deleted Object Reference Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A remotely exploitable code execution vulnerability has been reported in the Mozilla Firefox product. The vulnerability is created as a result of a flaw in the implementation of the JavaScript focus method. Exploitation of this vulnerability may allow a malicious user to inject and execute arbitrary code on a target host within the security context of the current user.

NAME: Microsoft DirectX SAMI File Parsing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft DirectX is prone to a integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certaincrafted SAMI files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some string length in the SAMI files,leading to an stack buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by buildinging a crafted SAMI file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user

NAME: Apple Safari KHTMLParser popOneBlock Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: Apple Safari is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML pages. The vulnerability is due to a memory corruption in the KHTMLParser::popOneBlock() function. It is caused due to the improper parsing of a script element in a div object redefining the document body. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the user to visit a crafted webpage. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in use

NAME: Program Checker ActiveX Fill Method Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Program Checker is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on Fill method in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow condition. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer PNG Rendering Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way Microsoft Internet Explorer parses and renders PNG image files. The flaw is caused by an insufficient size validation of the transparency information within a PNG image file. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the currently logged in user.

NAME: HTTP Directory Traversal Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A directory traversal vulnerability has been discovered in parsing malformed HTTP requests. This vulnerability is due to a lack of proper checks in HTTP URI requests. A successful attack could result in access to sensitive information that could further aid in other attacks.

NAME: AWStats Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: AWstats versions lower than 6.3 are prone to a remote code execution vulnerability due tothe lack of input validation for certain request parameters. AWStats is an open sourcetool to generate advanced http, ftp, and mail server statistics graphically.The vulnerability is due to the lack validation checks when certain shell charactersare supplied as input to certain parameters. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby appending arbitrary commands to the shell character, which in turn is supplied as anargument. A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, with the privilegesof the web server.

NAME: Apple QuickTime PictureViewer Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists an stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in Apple QuickTime PictureViewer. The vulnerability is caused due to insufficient data validating when processing JPEG image files. An attacker may exploit the vulnerability by enticing the user to open a crafted JPEG file with the affected product, resulting in execution of arbitrary code on the target host within the security context of the current user.

NAME: Adobe Flash Player for Linux ActionScript ASnative Command Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a remote command execution vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player for Linux. The vulnerability is a result of failure to validate user input when parsing maliciously crafted SWF files. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability by enticing a target user to open a malicious SWF file. Successful exploitation can lead to execution of system commands in the security context of currently logged on user.

NAME: Microsoft IIS HTR Request Source Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft IIS web server is prone to a file source disclosure vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests.The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of URI requests with a "+.htr" appended. Such as request could leadto the disclosure of the source of the file requested in the URL.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to the server, which couldreveal sensitive information.

NAME: Microsoft FrontPage Server Extensions Remote Debug Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft FrontPage Server Extensions 2000 and 2002 are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability, while parsing certain malformed HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack boundary checks in the fp30reg.dll file used for the FPSE debug functionality. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP POST request to the vulnerable server, causing a buffer overflow, and thereby cause code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows GDI Remote Integer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows GDI32 is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WMF files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some special structurein the WMF file, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WMF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Javascript Cross Domain Information Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A race condition vulnerability exists in Microsoft Internet Explorer web browser. The vulnerability is due to the way Internet Explorer building DOM objects during page updating. A remote attacker may leverage this vulnerability by interrupting page loading in a way that would allow spoofing of URL address bar, and page properties including SSL certificates. This would enable remote attackers to conduct phishing attacks on the vulnerable clients.

NAME: Internet Explorer CSS Parsing Heap Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a heap corruption vulnerability whilehandling certain malformed Cascaded Style Sheet (CSS) tags in web pages.The vulnerability is due to a memory corruption when handling unterminatedcomments in CSS pages.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page with malformedCSS, and convincing the user to download the page.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, or mightresult in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: RealNetworks RealPlayer SMIL Wallclock Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: RealNetworks RealPlayer and HelixPlayer are prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing crafted SMIL files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing specific time format in SMIL data. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by convincing the target user to visit a malicious website or open a crafted file. A successful exploit could allow code execution in the context of the logged in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Navigation Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is vulnerable to arbitrary code execution while parsing certain malformed HTTP responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the Navigate function in the HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the current user.

NAME: Autodesk Multiple Products LiveUpdate ActiveX Control Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: There exists a code execution vulnerability in Autodesk LiveUpdate ActiveX Control shipped with multiple products. The vulnerability is due to lack of sanitation while handling parameters passed to the ApplyPatch method. A remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a malicious HTML document. Successful exploitation would cause arbitrary command execution in the security context of the currently logged on user.

NAME: mod_ssl - mod_proxy Hook Functions Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in , a module for Apache 1.3.x that is used for handling SSL connections. The module contains a format string vulnerability that is exercised when is used within an Apache instance operating as an HTTP/HTTPS proxy using the mod_proxy module.
