NAME: HTTP Long If-Modified-Since Header Anomaly

NAME: Java Web Start JNLP File Argument Injection
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability has been reported in the way Sun Java Plug-in isolates java applets from the host system. JavaScript or VBScript code can be used to bypass security restrictions in the access control mechanism, allowing a java applet to access restricted Java classes. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to perform privileged operations on a target system.

NAME: RealNetworks RealPlayer SMIL File Handling Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: RealNetworks RealPlayer 10.5 (6.0.12.1056 and earlier), 10 and 8, and RealOne Player V2 and V1 are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing crafted SMIL files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing a largesystem-screen-size value, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. NAME: Mozilla Firefox JavaScript Engine Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted html files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the html file.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted html response. A successful attack could lead firefox to crash.

NAME: Sony ImageStation AxRUploadControl SetLogging Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Sony ImageStation is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX control requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on SetLogging method in the AxRUploadControl ActiveX control request, leading to a buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted html page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Office Publisher Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Publisher is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP response, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Indexing Service UTF-7 Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Indexing Service is prone to a cross-site scripting vulnerability due to a lack of checks on certain UTF-7 encoded user-supplied input. A cross-site scripting attack is possible if the supplied content is viewed with Internet Explorer. The issue with Internet Explorer is the way it treats web content as UTF-7 encoded text based on certain characters found on the web page. The vulnerability enables attackers to spoof content, hijack sessions, or steal cookies and passwords. This vulnerability affects both IIS web servers with Microsoft Indexing Service and Internet Explorer.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Address Bar Spoofing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: An address bar spoofing vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Internet Explorer. The vulnerability is specific to improperly handling resources that require a plugin to be processed. This flaw can be used to spoof the address bar of the browser to mislead a user as to the origin of a resource.

NAME: Windows Media Player Plugin Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Media Player plugin for non-Microsoft borwsers is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain malformed HTML tags. The plugin component of Media Playeris available for most browsers to fetch certain media files. However, there is a buffer overflowwhen a HTML file containing an EMBED tag with a long src attribute is opened using the plugin.Such a crafted file would cause the data in the embed tag to be copied to finite buffers leadingto an overflow. A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, or mightresult in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: ClamAV libclamav MEW PE File Integer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: libclamav in ClamAV is prone to a integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PE files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on PE files packed with the MEW packer.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PE file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Visual Studio mscomct2.ocx ActiveX Control Code Execution Vulnerability

A successful attack could lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: dBpowerAMP Audio Player M3U Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: dBpowerAMP Audio Player Release 2 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted M3U files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on long URI's in an M3U file, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted M3U file and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the player.

NAME: Foxit Reader Malformed PDF File Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Foxit Reader is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PDF files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the PDF file, leading to a denial of service vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PDF file. A successful attack could lead to crash foxit reader.

NAME: MHTML URI Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows is prone to a remote buffer overflow vulnerability in 'INETCOMM.DLL', while parsing MHTML protocol URI. The library fails to properly validate MHTML URI, leading tocopying the input data to insufficient sized memory buffers. An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page with a malicious MHTML URI, and convincing the user to click on the URI.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, or mightresult in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Office Excel  Malicious OBJ Record Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted EXCEL files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on OBJ record in the EXCEL file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted EXCEL file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability within the Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler program pertaining to the parsing of job schedule files. By supplying a specially crafted .job file, an attacker could overwrite a fix-sized buffer and gain control of the process. The attacker must entice a victim to access a malicious .job file in order to exploit this vulnerability.

NAME: Mozilla NNTP URL Handling Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability has been reported in the way the Mozilla browser handles NNTP URLs. Due to insufficient input validation, a specially crafted URI using the scheme news:// can overflow a heap buffer. By enticing a user to follow a specially crafted NNTP URI, an attacker can remotely exploit this vulnerability in a way that allows for code injection and execution with the privileges of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox XUL Tree Element Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A memory corruption vulnerability exists in Mozilla Firefox. The flaw is due to a dangling pointer while processing a malicious XUL document. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a crafted web page. In a successful attack, where arbitrary code is injected and executed on the vulnerable target host, the behaviour of the target system is dependent on the malicious code.

NAME: Microsoft Windows MDSAuth.DLL ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Rewrite Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Media Server mdsauth.dll ActiveX Control is prone to an arbitrary file rewrite vulnerability. The vulnerability is due to the lack of cross-domain checks while accessing files in different domains. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting awebpage containing the control, which when visited could overwrite arbitrary files on a victim's machine. A successful attack could thus lead to arbitrary code execution.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox DOMNodeRemoved Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: A memory corruption vulnerability has been discovered in the Mozilla Firefox product. The flaw concerns document structure changes during a DOMNodeRemoved event. Exploitation of this vulnerability may possibly result in arbitrary code execution on the target user's host.

NAME: Apache Chunk Encoding Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apache 1.3 through 1.3.24, and Apache 2.0 through 2.0.36 are prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certainmalformed requests. The vulnerability is due to the improper calculation of the size of chunks for a chunk-encoded HTTP request,leading to an integer overflow. Since this value is later used for copying data to finite stack buffers, it could lead to anexploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a HTTP request with malformed chunk data, leadingto remote code execution.

NAME: Microsoft Office MSO.DLL Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted OFFICE files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the OFFICE file, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted office file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Basic Analysis and Security Engine File Include Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Basic Analysis and Security Engine (BASE) 1.2.4 and earlier is prone to a remote file include vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability can be manifested when the register_globals is enabled and is due to the lack of proper filtering on the value passed to the base_path parameter. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Express Windows Address Book File Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability has been discovered in the way Microsoft Outlook Express parses malformed Windows Address Book (.wab) files. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to open a crafted address book file. A successful attack can lead to the injection and execution of arbitrary code within the security context of the target user.

NAME: XMLHTTP ActiveX Control Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft XMLHTTP ActiveX Control is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability. The ActiveX control ships as part ofMicrosoft XML Core Services, and handles XML and XSL parsing on Windows.The control is most commonly used by Internet Explorer to handle XML and XSL parsing.The XMLHTTP control is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability when a craftedargument is passed to the setRequestHeader method. The vulnerability could be exploited by crafting a webpage, whichwhen visited could cause remote code execution.

NAME: Sun Java Web Start JNLP Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sun Java Web Start JNLP is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP response, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IDEAL Administration IPJ File Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Ideal Administration 2009 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted IPJ files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields in the IPJ file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted IPJ file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: TheWebForum login.php username Parameter SQL Injection
DESCRIPTION: The WebForum (twf) 1.2.1 is prone to a SQL injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in the login.php script and is due to the lack of proper checks on username parameter. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request with SQL injection characters. A successful attack could lead to remote command execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Adobe PDF File with Embedded Javascript Exploit Code

NAME: Sambar HTTP Server Results.stm Parameter Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted POST request with a long query parameter value, overflowing the buffer to which the value is copied. A successful attack could cause remote code execution on the server, or cause a denial of service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Graphics Engine EMF and WMF Rendering Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way the graphics engine of Microsoft Windows processes of EMF and WMF image files. The flaw is a buffer overflow resulting from an unchecked user supplied size field value contained in an image file. This vulnerability, when exploited may allow a malicious user to take control of the affected host.

NAME: VuPlayer 2.49 M3U File Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: VuPlayer 2.49 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted M3U files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields in an M3U file, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted M3U file and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Native Function Iterator Denial Of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted  native objects.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on "alert" property using jscript language, leading to an denial of service vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted html page. A successful attack could lead to denial of service.

NAME: CUPS HP-GL_2 Filter Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The Hewlett-Packard Graphics Language (HPGL) filter in CUPS before 1.3.9 is prone to a overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted IPP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on data in the IPP request, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted IPP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: RSA Authentication Agent for Web HTTP Chunk Encoding Overflow
DESCRIPTION: RSA Authentication Agent for Web for IIS "IISWebAgentIF.dll", is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability whileparsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing chunk encodedHTTP requests. Since the user-supplied input is copied to finite heap buffers, it could lead to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted HTTP request that would trigger the overflow, thereby causing remote code execution with the permissions of the server.

NAME: Zen Cart record_company Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Zen Cart is prone to a file inclusion vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP requests, leading to an exploitable file inclusion.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Amaya Browser Bdo Tag Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Amaya browser version 11 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP webpages. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks on values passed in the bdo tag. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted webpage and enticing a victim to visit the page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Novell iPrint Client ActiveX Control Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Novell iPrint Client. The vulnerability is caused due toinsufficient boundary checking when certain parameters are passed to the affected ActiveX control. Anattacker may exploit this vulnerability by enticing a target user to open a malicious web page. Successfulexploitation might lead to injection and execution of arbitrary code in the security context of the currentlylogged in user.

NAME: Internet Explorer MHTML Redirection Information Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 and 7.0 are prone to an information disclosure vulnerability while parsing certain redirections. Thevulnerability is due to the lack of proper domain checks while redirecting to URLs containing a mhtml: URI handler. This could resultin bypassing domain restrictions and obtaining sensitive information from another website. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby enticing the user to visit the attacker's website, which would redirect to another website, which is not under the attacker's control.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Address Bar Spoofing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: An address bar spoofing vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Internet Explorer. The vulnerability is specific to improperly handling resources that require a plugin to be processed. This flaw can be used to spoof the address bar of the browser to mislead a user as to the origin of a resource.

NAME: Autodesk SoftImage Scene TOC Arbitrary Command Execution
DESCRIPTION: Autodesk Softimage 7.x and Softimage XSI 6.x are prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Scene package files. The vulnerability is because Scene packages contain a scntoc (scene table of contents) file which is writable and can contain arbitrary javascript code. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a scene package containing commands in a scntoc file and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the Softimage software.

NAME: Microsoft Scripting.FileSystemObject Object Initialization
DESCRIPTION: The alert indicates that A script try to initialize Microsoft Scripting.FileSystemObject Object.

NAME: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Express CAD Service Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager product is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certaincrafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability exists in the dsmcad.exe service and is due to the lack of validation checks onthe length of HTTP Host header. Since this value is copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a request with a long Host header and send it to the victim server,listening on TCP port 1581. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Novell GroupWise Messenger HTTP Response Handling Exploit
DESCRIPTION: Novell GroupWise Messenger (GWIM) Client before 2.0.3 HP1 for Windows is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on strings passed to the client after the NM_A_SZ_TRANSACTION_ID field name. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the victim to visit a crafted webpage. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the messenger client.

NAME: Microsoft Excel Selection Record Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability when parsingmalformed SELECTION records in an Excel document. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on certain fields in the SELECTIONrecord such as number of cell range entries.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting an excel file with a malformedSELECTION record, and convincing the user to download and open the file.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, installation of malicious files,and thereby complete compromise of the victim machine.

NAME: Macromedia Flash ActionDefineFunction Memory Access Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Macromedia Flash plugin. The flaw is created by insufficient validation checks of user input values. This vulnerability may be exploited by a malicious user to inject and execute arbitrary code on the target host.

NAME: Novell ZENworks Desktop Management ActiveX Control CanUninstall Method Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Novell ZENworks Desktop Management ActiveX Control. The vulnerability is due to insufficient boundary checking when an overly long parameter is passed to the affected ActiveX control. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability by enticing a target user to open a malicious web page. Successful exploitation could lead to injection and execution of arbitrary code in the security context of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Microsoft Wordpad and Office Text Converters OLE Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Windows WordPad is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DOC files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some specify structurer in the DOC file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DOC. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Media Player Skin File Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way Microsoft Windows Media Player processes downloaded Media Player Skin files. The flaw is caused by a lack of sanitization of the skin file name, leading Windows Media Player to place a downloaded file to an arbitrary location with an arbitrary file name. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by placing a malicious executable file in the system-wide Startup folder or by overwriting critical system or application files.

NAME: Zenturi ProgramChecker ActiveX Fill Method Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Zenturi ProgramChecker is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX method calls. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in Fill method in the HTML file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow vulnerability.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Sumatra PDF Shading Pattern Processing Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: SumatraPDF is prone to an integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PDF files. The vulnerability is present in the MuPDF library used by Sumatra and is due to the lack of boundary checks on certain integer values passed in a PDF file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted PDF on a webpage and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the Sumatra software.

NAME: Windows Media Header Parsing Invalid Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Windows Media component is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ASF files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on use input data in the ASF files, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ASF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft ASP.NET Application Folder Information Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: An information disclosure vulnerability has been identified in Microsoft ASP.NET product. The flaw is caused by an improper checking of the user supplied URLs. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability to access any object in the ASP.NET Application folder.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox Layout Frame Constructor Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML responses. The flaw is due to the improper handling of certain HTML and CSS elements in the layout component, leading to an exploitable memory corruption.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a HTML page on a web server and persuading a victim to open the malicious webpage. A successful exploit could allow for arbitrary code injection and execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: PHP XMLRPC Library Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: PHP XMLRPC library provides an implementation of the PHP Web RPC protocol, and is usedby several web applications such as Drupal, PostNuke, TikiWiki etc. However, the library is prone to a code injection vulnerability, that could allow code execution with theprivileges of the web server. The vulnerability is due to the lack of sanity checks before passinguser input to an eval() function, which could enable remote PHP code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by posting crafted XML document to a web serverrunning one of the applications using the XMLRPC library.

NAME: Adobe PDF File Deflate Object Not ended With Endstream
DESCRIPTION: This signature try to indicate a PDF file has an object which has deflate data but length is not correct. It has been used by core impact to do evasion on their exploits.

NAME: Microsoft Windows 2000 Resource Kit W3Who.DLL Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows w3who.dll is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain malformed HTTP requests.The DLL file is a ISAPI extension useful for displaying information regarding the calling context of the client browser along with the configuration of the host server. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing user supplied inputthrough HTTP URI. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a crafted URI to the server in order to explo

NAME: Microsoft Outlook VEVENT Record Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a memory corruption vulnerability in Microsoft Outlook. The flaw is caused by insufficient checks while parsing VEVENT record in the Outlook iCal meeting request file or .ICS file. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a crafted iCal file or .ICS file, potentially causing arbitrary code to be injected and executed in the security context of the current user.

NAME: Microsoft Excel Named Range Record Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability when parsingmalformed Named Range records in an Excel document. The vulnerability is due to the lack of data validation on certain fields in the Named Rangerecord leading to an integer overflow. Since this value is later used for a memory copy operation, it could lead to an exploitable memory corruption.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting an excel file with a malformedNamed Range, and convincing the user to download and open the file.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, installation of malicious files,and thereby complete compromise of the victim machine.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer OnUnload Null Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Browsers is prone to a integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. This vulnerability exists due to insufficient input validation in the HTML data. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server. A successful attack could lead to code execution in the context of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Works File Converter Section Header Index Table Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Works File Converter is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certaincrafted WPS files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on section header index table in the WPS file,leading to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WPS file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer HTML Objects Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: A memory corruption vulnerability exists in Microsoft Internet Explorer. The flaw is due to the way Internet Explorer handles table operations in specific situations. An attacker can persuade the target user to open a malicious web page to exploit this vulnerability.              In an attack scenario, where arbitrary code is injected and executed on the target system, the behaviour of the target is dependent on the intention of the malicious code. The injected code will be run with privileges of the currently logged on user.              If such an attack is not executed successfully, the vulnerable application may terminate as a result of invalid memory access.

NAME: Microsoft Office Malformed Malformed PICT Filter Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PICT files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PICT file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft HTML Help HHCtrl ActiveX Heap Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows HTML Help is prone to a memory-corruption vulnerability. The vulnerability is in the HHCtrl ActiveX control, when certain properties are set to malformed string values.Attackers may exploit this issue via a malicious web page. A successful exploit could lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the currently logged-in user, or could lead to a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Apple QuickTime Color Table ID Heap Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a heap memory corruption vulnerability in Apple QuickTime product. The flaw is caused by insufficient checks when processing QTIF files. A remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability by enticing a target user to open a crafted QTIF file, thereby injecting and executing arbitrary code with the privileges of the currently logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Media File Format Stream Property error correction Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Media is prone to a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ASF files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on the error correction data length of a Stream Property entry in an ASF stream, leading to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted ASF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logg

NAME: Peercast.org PeerCast Remote Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: PeerCast is prone to a  format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in URI field in the HTTP request.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Office Malformed GIF File Processing Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in the GIF graphics filter installed with Microsoft Office products. The flaw is triggered when a malicious GIF image is parsed by the affected component. A successful attack may lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the currently logged in user.

NAME: IBM Proventia Sensor Appliance Remote File Include
DESCRIPTION: ISS's proventia appliance is prone to a remote file include vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests sent to the user interface. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request that could execute remote PHP code of the attacker's choice. A successful attack could thus cause remote execution on the victim server.

NAME: Windows Graphics Rendering Engine WMF SetAbortProc Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: Microsot Windows Graphics Rendering Engine is prone to a code execution vulnerability                when parsing Windows Meta File (WMF) files. WMF file format images are graphical images                whose records contain function names, which directly map to GDI function calls.                One such record is the Escape record, which can be used to call SetAbortProc API.                 For the SetAbortProc function, user supplied input in the WMF file can be used as the                 code execution path in case of processing errors. Thus, an attacker can create a malformed                Escape record with injected code in the WMF file, which when downloaded                could cause arbitrary code execution on the victim                machine. The attacker could craft a WMF file and host it on a website, which when downloaded                could facilitate remote code execution.

NAME: BlazeDVD Playlist File Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: BlazeVideo BlazeDVD Standard and Professional 5.0 are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PLF playlist files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields with user-supplied input in a PLF file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PLF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the DVD software.

NAME: Word Viewer OCX ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Word Viewer OCX is prone to a Buffer Overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP response.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks HttpDownloadFile/OpenWebFile method in the  HTTP response, leading to an exploitable Overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: phpBook index.php date Parameter PHP Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: phpBook index.php is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in date field in the HTTP request.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Windows Movie Maker Project File Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Windows Movie Maker is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Project files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on stream size in the project file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted project file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Visio Version Number Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A remote code-execution vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Visio processes files. The vulnerability is due to insufficient validating of user-supplied data while processing Version Number. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a crafted Microsoft Visio file, potentially causing arbitrary code to be injected and executed in the security context of the current user.

NAME: HP Web Jetadmin Printer Firmware Update Script Arbitrary File Upload Weakness
DESCRIPTION: There are multiple vulnerabilities within HP Web JetAdmin, a web based software program developed by Hewlett Packard. It is possible, through the use of multiple vulnerabilities, for the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the remote server running HP Web JetAdmin in a ROOT level context.

NAME: Microsoft IIS 5.0 Form_JScript.asp XSS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft IIS 5.0 is prone to an XSS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable XSS.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox iframe.contentWindow.focus Deleted Object Reference Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A remotely exploitable code execution vulnerability has been reported in the Mozilla Firefox product. The vulnerability is created as a result of a flaw in the implementation of the JavaScript focus method. Exploitation of this vulnerability may allow a malicious user to inject and execute arbitrary code on a target host within the security context of the current user.

NAME: Apple QuickTime for Java toQTPointer Function Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Apple QuickTime QTJava component is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted java files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on toQTPointer function parameters in the QTJava component, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted java file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Nessus ScanCtrl ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Access Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Nessus Vulnerability Scanner ScanCtrl activex control is prone to a directory traversal vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks of directory traversal on parameters passed to the saveNessusRC and deleteReport methods. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing a victim to visit a crafted webpage containing the control. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary file read/write access with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Cisco IOS HTTP Service HTML Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The vulnerability is caused due to the memory dump feature of the HTTP server not properly sanitising the data in received packets before displaying them to the user in a HTML formatted page when the user views the "/level/15/exec/-/buffers/assigned/dump" link. This can be exploited to execute arbitrary script code in a user's browser session when the user views a memory dump containing malicious Javascript/HTML code from a received packet.Successful exploitation may allow the attacker to perform certain actions that are accessible by the logon administrator. E.g. changing the "enable" password by injecting HTML code that requests for the "/level/15/configure/-/enable/secret/" link.The vulnerability has been reported in IOS versions 11.0 through 12.4 with the HTTP server enabled.

NAME: Apple Mac OS X Installer Package Filename Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Installer application is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to improper sanity checks on package filename strings in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution on the target host within the security context of the target user or potentially with System level privile

NAME: Microsoft Word Malformed String Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Word handles specially crafted Word files. The vulnerability couldallow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted Word file with a malformed string. Users whose accounts areconfigured to have fewer user rights on the system could be less impacted than users who operate with administrative user rights.

NAME: Microsoft Windows IIS Script Filename Wrong Parsing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows IIS is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted script filename. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on filename parsed by IIS script engine, leading to code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted URL request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the IIS server.

NAME: Firefox arbitrary script execution
DESCRIPTION: The nsXMLHttpRequest::NotifyEventListeners method in Firefox 3.x before 3.0.4, Firefox 2.x before 2.0.0.18, Thunderbird 2.x before 2.0.0.18, and SeaMonkey 1.x before 1.1.13 allows remote attackers to bypass the same-origin policy and execute arbitrary script via multiple listeners, which bypass the inner window check.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox CSSValue Array Data Structure Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted CSS objects.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on CSS object in the http response, leading to an exploitable code execution vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted html response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Cryptomathic Cenroll ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Cryptomathic Cenroll ActiveX Control is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability.The vulnerability is due to the lack length checks when parsing arguments to the createPKCS10 function.An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page using the vulnerablecontrol, and convincing the user to download the page.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, or mightresult in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: GOM Player ASX File Parsing Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: GOM Player is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ASX files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on HREF tag data in the ASX file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ASX file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Media Player Media File Handling Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Media Player is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted media files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the media file, leading to a media player or explorer crash.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted media file. A successful attack could lead to crash media player or explorer.

NAME: Apple QuickTime Plug-In Arbitrary Script Execution Weakness
DESCRIPTION: Apple QuickTime Plug-In is prone to a Script Execution Weakness while parsing certain crafted http responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on http response.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted http response. A successful attack could lead to script execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Sophos Anti-Virus Zip File Handling Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the component of Sophos Anti-Virus that handles compressed files. The vulnerability is caused due to a flaw that can result in an infinite loop. A remote attacker can exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted compressed file to a target running the vulnerable product, causing a denial of service.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Information Services Could Allow Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The WebDAV plugin for IIS contains a vulnerability which allows remote anonymous users to bypass authentication requirements. This allows the attacker to view content they would not otherwise have access to, retrieve directory listings, and in some configurations upload content to protected directories.

NAME: Microsoft Windows DirectShow MEPG2 ActiveX Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows is prone to a stack buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted MEPG2 file.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user data in the MEPG2 file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted MEPG2 file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Windows Vista RSS Feeds Gadget Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Vista RSS Feeds Gadget is prone to a cross site scripting vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML pages. RSSFeeds Gadget is a mini application that allows an RSS feed subscriber to receive information (such as headlines) without visiting thewebpage. The vulnerability exists in the Gadget while parsing certain HTML elements as they are rendered. Thus when the HTML elements areinjected with javascript, the code could be executed with the privileges of the current u

NAME: McAfee Multiple Products LHA File Handling Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way McAfee Antivirus Library parses LHA compressed files. The vulnerable archive parser does not perform sufficient bounds checking on the file name field in the header of LHA archive files before copying the field into a buffer, resulting in a buffer overflow. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in SYSTEM context on the target system by sending a specially crafted LHA file to the target.\n'

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer javascript: URI in Refresh Header Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft IE 6 is prone to a XSS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP response header.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on REFRESH header in the HTTP response.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to get some information from the context of other users.

NAME: Microsoft Windows GDI+ ART Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows GDI+ system is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ART files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on ART data in the office file, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted office file contain malicious ART. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Apple Quicktime MOV File Type Tag heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Quicktime is prone to a heap vulnerability while parsing certain crafted MOV file.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on TYPE field in the MOV file, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted MOV file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Apple Mac OS X QuickDraw GetSrcBits32ARGB Remote Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Mac OS X is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PICT files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on QuickDraw data in the PICT file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PICT file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Openfire Remote Command Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Openfire Remote is prone to an XSS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable XSS.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Orbit Downloader URL Processing Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Orbit Downloader. The vulnerability is caused due to insufficient boundary checking when the application processes the URL string. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability by enticing a target user to open a malicious long URL. Successful exploitation might lead to injection and execution of arbitrary code in the security context of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Macromedia Flash Flash8b.OCX ActiveX Control DoS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Macromedia Flash Flash8b.OCX is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX method calls. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in AllowScriptAccess property in the HTML file, leading to an exploitable denial of service vulnerability.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft IIS Sample Scripts Arbitrary File Disclosure Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft IIS web server is prone to an arbitrary file disclosure vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests.The vulnerability is present in several sample ASP scripts such as showcode.asp, codebrws.asp, which allow viewing sourceof other sample files within same directory. However, since these scripts do not properly handle the source file requested,they allow retrieval of source of ASP files outside the directory using directory traversal paths.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to the server, which couldreveal sensitive information.

NAME: Microsoft Excel NULL Pointer Dereference DoS
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted excel (XLS) files. The vulnerability is a memory corruption due to the improper parsing of corrupted XML/XLS format files. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted XLS file and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: EasyHDR Fits File Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: EasyHDR PRO 1.60.2 is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Flexible Image Transport System (FITS) files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields in a FITS file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted FITS file on a webpage and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Qvod Player QvodCtrl Class ActiveX Control URL Property Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Qvod Player ActiveX control in QvodInsert.dll is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability when handling strings assigned to the URL property.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on URL property, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft DHTML Editing Component ActiveX Control Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Microsoft DHTML edit ActiveX control. The vulnerability is present in the LoadURL function when handling malformed HTML. The attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current user.

NAME: Microsoft Office Word Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Word is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DOC files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the DOC file, leading to an memory corruption.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DOC file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Apple QuickTime FLIC Animation File Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A heap buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the Apple Quicktime product. The flaw is caused by insufficient checks when processing FLIC animation files. A remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability by enticing a target user to open a crafted FLIC animation file, thereby injecting and executing arbitrary code with the privileges of the currently logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Browser Popup Window Object Type Validation Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a Arbitrary Command Execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP response.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP response, leading to inject and execute arbitrary programs. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could allows remote attackers to bypass zone restrictions to inject and execute arbitrary programs.

NAME: Autodesk 3ds Max Application Callbacks Arbitrary Command Execution
DESCRIPTION: Autodesk 3D Studio Max (3DSMax) is prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted MAX files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on callbacks used in a crafted MAX file. An attacker could craft a MAX file with a MAXScript statement and host it on a webpage and entice the victim to visit the webpage. A successful exploit could lead to arbitrary command execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Adobe ShockWave Player 11.5.1.601 PlayerVersion Property Heap-based buffer overflow
DESCRIPTION: Adobe ShockWave Player 11.5.1.601 is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on PlayerVersion in the HTML file, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: HP Info Center HPInfoDLL.DLL ActiveX Control Multiple Arbitrary Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: HP Info Center HPInfoDLL.dll is prone to a remote code execution vulnerabilitywhile parsing certain crafted activex methods.The vulnerability is due to the lack of check insecure LaunchApp() methodcalling, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by persuading a victim to visit oropen a website or a HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote codeexecution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Office Excel DbOrParamQry Record Parsing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Excel is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted EXCEL files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on DbOrParamQry record in the EXCEL file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted EXCEL file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Adobe PageMaker Key Strings Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Adobe Pagemaker is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PMD files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on key string in the PMD file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PMD file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer IsComponentInstalled Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a memory corruption vulnerability in the Mozilla Firefox web browser. The vulnerable application incorrectly parses a series of crafted HTML tags, resulting in memory corruption. A malicious attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to open a specially crafted web page, which may result in the injection and execution of arbitrary code on the target host.

NAME: AOL IWinAmpActiveX ConvertFile Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: AOL IWinAmpActiveX Control (AmpX.dll 2.4.0.6) is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted webpages. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks on parameters passed to the ConvertFile method of the control. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the victim to visit a crafted webpage. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: EMC Captiva QuickScan Pro KeyHelp ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: EMC KeyWorks KeyHelp Module is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks on parameters passed to certain methods of the control. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted webpage and enticing the victim to visit the page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Office Embedded Shockwave Flash Player Object Security Bypass
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office is prone to a script execution vulnerability when certain objects such as Shockwave Flash Player Objects containing script code are embedded into Office files. Microsoft Office fails to prompt the user when COM objects containing script code areopened automatically when the Office files are opened. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted Office filewith the embedded object on a web server, or sending via e-mail. When the file is opened on a victim machine, it could causearbitrary commands to be executed, or could be used to steal sensitive information.

NAME: Audio Workstation Pls File Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Audio Workstation version 6.4.2.4.3 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted PLS files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while handling certain fields in a PLS file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PLS file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Adobe Coldfusion 8 XSS Vulnerabily
DESCRIPTION: Adobe Coldfusion is prone to a XSS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted QUERY_STRING requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on QUERY_STRING field in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable XSS.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote JS code execution with the current context of the browser.

NAME: Novell eDirectory HTTP Request Content-Length Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a heap buffer overflow vulnerability in Novell eDirectory. The flaw is in the SOAP-HTTP protocol stack due to improper processing of the Content-Length header value. Remote attackers could exploit this vulnerability by sending SOAP-HTTP requests with specially crafted Content-Length value. Successful exploitation would allow for arbitrary code injection and execution with the privileges of the server process.

NAME: Microsoft GDI+ EMF Image Processing Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft GDI+ is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted EMF files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on EmfPlus record in the EMF file\, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted EMF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Roxio CinePlayer ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SonicDVDDashVRNav.dll in Roxio CinePlayer 3.2 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain webpages containing the control. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on parameters passed to certain methods, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the victim to visit a crafted webpage. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IntelliTamper HTML Parser IMG Tag Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IntelliTamper 2.07 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML pages. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on long URLs passed in the SRC attribute of an IMG element. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted page and enticing the victim to visit the page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: PHP Strip_Tags Function Bypass Vulnerability Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the HTML tag filtering method of PHP. PHP does not properly filter tags containing a null byte, allowing potentially unsafe tags to be passed on to further processing. This vulnerability allows an attacker to inject malicious script and use the vulnerable PHP in a cross-site scripting attack.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Web View Script Injection
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Windows Explorer Web View component. The flaw is created by insufficient validation of user-supplied Author field value of the file summary information. This vulnerability may be leveraged by a malicious user to execute arbitrary code on an affected target host.

NAME: IBM WebSphere Application Server Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in IBM WebSphere Application Server (WAS). The flaw is due to lack of validation of the user supplied input data. The flaw may be exploited by malicious users to execute arbitrary HTML and script code on target user's web browser, within the context of a trusted web site.

NAME: Microsoft Jet DataBase Engine MDB File Parsing Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Jet Database Engine is prone to a stack buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted MDB database file. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain fields of the records in an MDB file. Since the user-supplied data is copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted MDB file on a webpage and enticing a user to download the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user

NAME: Apple iPhone Mobile Safari Browser Remote Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Safari web browser is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted regex pattern in http webpage.The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary protection while processing Javascript Regular Expressions included in a webpage.A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a malicious web page, potentially causing arbitrary code to be injected and executed within the logged-in user privileges.

NAME: RealPlayer AU File Parsing Divide-by-Zero DoS
DESCRIPTION: RealPlayer/HelixPlayer are prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted AU files. The vulnerability is due to the failure of checking a divide by zero condition while parsing a malformed AU file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted AU file and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Mozilla Suite DOM Property Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in Mozilla web browser and its derivatives. The flaw is caused by insufficient validation when handling the JavaScript eval method and Script objects. A remote attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary JavaScript code with escalated privileges.

NAME: Oracle TimesTen Database evtdump CGI Module Format String
DESCRIPTION: Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database evtdump CGI module is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on evtdump in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable format string vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: HTTP TRACK Method
DESCRIPTION: The HTTP TRACK method returns the contents of client HTTP requests in the entity-body of the TRACK response. This behavior could be leveraged by attackers to access sensitive information, such as cookies or authentication data, contained in the HTTP headers of the request

NAME: Microsoft Office Excel BRAI Record Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Excel is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted EXCEL files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on BRAI Record in the EXCEL file, leading to an exploitable code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted EXCEL file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Chasys Media Player Playlist File Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Chasys Media Player is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted playlist files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on field values passed in an M3U playlist file, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by hosting a crafted M3U file on a webpage and enticing the victim to open the file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the chasys player.

NAME: Red Hat Directory Server Accept-Language HTTP Header Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Red Hat Directory Server 7.1 before SP7 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on Accept-Language header in a HTTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Visual Studio MSFLXGRD.OCX ActiveX Control Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Visual Studio MSFLXGRD.OCX Control is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP response.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the FormatString property in HTTP response.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Oracle Web Cache Client Request Handling DoS
DESCRIPTION: The Oracle Web Cache contains several vulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities enable attackers to falsify log data, to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks against administrators reviewing the Web Cache log files, to perform a denial of service, and to execute web requests which are not visible in the log.

NAME: Wordpress Command Execution Backdoor Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a code execution vulnerability in Wordpress. The flaw is due to lack of validation in ix parameter when handling HTTP requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execution command on target application.

NAME: Iomega StorCenter Session Identifier Security Bypass
DESCRIPTION: Iomega StorCenter Pro is prone to a web authentication bypass vulnerability while handling certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in the makecgi-pro script which generates predictable session IDs. A remote attacker could hijack active sessions by brute force guessing on the session_id parameter. A successful exploit could help the attacker gain privileges over an active session.

NAME: HTTP Apple Safari KHTML WebKit Remote Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple Safari KHTML WebKit is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP response.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTML response. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to denial of service against Apple Safari web browser .

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer cloneNode and nodeValue Remote Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a a remote memory-corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML filesThe vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some javascript methods in the HTML file,leading to an exploitable memory-corruption. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by building a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user

NAME: Microsoft WordPerfect 5.x Converter Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the WordPerfect 5.x converter module used by several Microsoft products. The vulnerability is triggered by a WordPerfect document with an overly long length field. This vulnerability could permit an attacker to inject and execute code on a remote system with the security context of the current user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer DXTransform.Microsoft.DXLUTBuilder.1 Memory Corruption Vulnerabilty
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a memory-corruption vulnerability while parsing certaincrafted HTML elements. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain DOM element ref call in the HTML page, leading to an exploitable memory-corruption vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by building a crafted HTML page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox JIT Escape Function Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted JS html pages. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of escape function calls in Javascript.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML response page. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Firefly Media Server Multiple Null Pointer Dereference Vulnerabilities
DESCRIPTION: Firefly Media Server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on request header in the HTTP request, leading to a denial of service vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request/response. A successful attack could lead to denial of service.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox MathML Component Integer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox  is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on rowspan in the HTTP response, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Visual Studio MSCHRT20.OCX ActiveX Control Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Visual Studio MSCHRT20.OCX Control is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP response.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the DoSetCursor property in HTTP response.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Mozilla Firefox arbitrary Javascript execution
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.8 and SeaMonkey before 1.1.5 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary Javascript with user privileges by using the Script object to modify XPCNativeWrappers in a way that causes the script to be executed when a chrome action is performed.

NAME: MediaWiki User Language Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists an arbitrary code execution vulnerability in MediaWiki. The flaw is caused by improper checking of the user supplied language option. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable host.

NAME: Apache Tomcat Directory Listing Information Disclosure
DESCRIPTION: Apache Tomcat is prone to a information disclosure vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on HTTP URI field in the HTTP request, leading to an file information disclosure.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted http request. A successful attack could lead to directory file information disclosure.

NAME: Internet Explorer Javascript Similar Method Cross Domain Check Bypass
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a cross-domain security check bypass vulnerability while handling certain javascript methods with similar names.The vulnerability is due to the insufficient trust checks that IE performs on certain methods(specifically caching related methods such as assign) in different domain windows. An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by crafting a web page with the malformedmethods, and convincing the user to download the page.A successful attack might result in arbitrary code execution, run a malicious script codein the context of another domain, spoof the contents of a website such as a bank website,or steal cookies of a website user.

NAME: HTML Help Workshop HHP File CompiledFile Overflow
DESCRIPTION: HTML Help Workshop 4.74 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HHP files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on compiled file field in the HHP project file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HHP file to the victim. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Office Web Components Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Web Components are a collection of Component Object Model (COM) controls for publishing spreadsheets, charts, and databases to the Web, and for viewing the published components on the Web. The Spreadsheet object in the Office Web Components Library 9 contains a vulnerability which allows remote attackers to execute malicious code. A user's machine can be infected when browsing a malicious site that invokes the OWC functionality.

NAME: Microsoft Word Malformed Data Structures Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Word is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted word files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the word files, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted word. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Windows Media Player Code Execution Vulnerability Decompressing Skins
DESCRIPTION: This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary code onvulnerable installations of Microsoft Windows Media Player. Userinteraction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that thetarget must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.The specific flaw exists while decompressing skin files (.WMZ and .WMD)with malformed headers. During this process the malformed values areused to improperly calculate data which can later allow an attacker toexecute code under the rights of the current user.

NAME: Mozilla Suite InstallVersion CompareTo Script Function Heap Corruption
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla products including Firefox versions before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, areprone to a heap corruption vulnerability when parsing a malformed webpage.The vulnerability is due a heap memory corruption caused by passing an object instead of a string as parameter toInstallVersion.compareTo function. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a webpage, and enticingthe victim to click on the webpage to execute arbitrary code on the victim machine.

NAME: Apple QuickTime CRGN Atom Parsing Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apple QuickTime is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted MP4 movies.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on CRGN atom data in the MP4 files, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted MP4 movie. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: WebEx GPCContainer Memory Access Violation DoS
DESCRIPTION: WebEx GPCContainer is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ActiveX control requests.
