NAME: DOS KILLMEv1
DESCRIPTION: By sending out-of-band data to port 139, an attacker can cause a Windows system to lose network capability and possibly crash.

NAME: Samba Mangling Method Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability in the way Samba handles Name Mangling in its file system sharing process. A specially crafted file name could trigger a stack buffer overflow if the mangling method was set to hash. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the Samba process, generally root.

NAME: Netbios Small Piece Data Evasion Attack Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: This indicates Microsoft Netbios small piece evasion attack has been detected.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Server Message Block Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Windows SMB (Server Message Block) implementation. The affected products do not perform sufficient validation on the length of SMB network messages. This flaw may allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service, or inject and execute arbitrary code on the target system with system level privileges.

NAME: Microsoft Windows DFS Referral Response Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Distributed File System is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMB DFS responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on DFS response data in the SMB response, leading to an exploitable integer overflow vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMB DFS response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: DOS WinNukebyBruce
DESCRIPTION: By sending out-of-band data to port 139, an attacker can cause a Windows system to lose network capability and possibly crash.

NAME: DOS Jaypee
DESCRIPTION: By sending out-of-band crafted data to port 139, an attacker can cause a Windows system to lose network capability and possibly crash.

NAME: Microsoft Windows SMB Buffer Underflow Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMB protocol requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on an SMB protocol request, which can lead to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMB request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: DOS MeliksahNuker
DESCRIPTION: Meliksah Nuker is a simple program, which sends a Out-Of-Bandwidth Message (MSG_OBB) to a selected IP Address using port 139 (NetBIOS), thereby crashing old Win95 and NT computers.

NAME: IBM DB2 Remote Command Execution Privilege Escalation
DESCRIPTION: IBM DB2 Universal Database is prone to a privilege escalation vulnerability while handling certain crafted SMB requests. The vulnerability is present in the remote command server (DB2RCMD.EXE), which allows arbitrary commands to be executed with db2admin privileges. Thus an authenticated attacker could execute arbitrary command with the privileges of db2admin user. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted SMB requests to DB2REMOTECMD named pipe.

NAME: Microsoft SRV.SYS Mailslot Ring0 Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Server driver contains an exploitable memory corruption vulnerability.The vulnerability exists in the SRV.SYS driver, which is responsible for handling SMB traffic.Crafted SMB trans requests sent to the server could corrupt kernel memory, which could becontrolled by the attacker.An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMB packet, and execute remote code on the vulnerable machine.A successful attack may result in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges leadingto a full compromise. Attack attempts may result in denial-of-service conditions as well.

NAME: Microsoft Windows SMB Client Response Parsing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows SMB is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMB response. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some fields in the SMB response, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMB response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with current logged-in user privileges.

NAME: Microsoft OLE Automation Library Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) Automation is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WMF file. NAME: Microsoft SMBv2 Infinite Loop Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a remote unauthenticated vulnerability in SMBv2 that can lead to a CPU exhaustion on the host and force a reboot. The vulnerability occurs when SMBv2 gets a DFS referral packet with a very long pathname and incorrectly parses it; basically, there is an integer overflow on the length which causes the loop to never reach its exit condition. While this will not "crash" the machine, it will eat up all CPU time and the user must reboot the machine to use it.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Netbios ADMIN Connect
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates someone is trying to connect to remote windows server's ADMIN share via Netbios. There is a vulnerability in Windows 2000 which is prone to a admin access vulnerability using no password. The installation for Windows 2000 does not activate the Administrator password until the system has rebooted, which allows remote attackers to connect to the ADMIN$ share without a password until the reboot occurs.

NAME: Motorola Timbuktu PlughNTCommand Data Parsing Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Motorola Timbuktu Pro is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted SMB requests through the PlughNTCommand named pipe. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks on strings passed in the data over the named pipe. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMB request. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

DESCRIPTION: Microsoft SMB is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMB response.
