Successful exploitation requires the attacker to successfully authenticate to the affected service.The specific flaw exists in NetMail's implementation of the Network Messaging Application Protocol (NMAP). The NMAP server lacks bounds checking on parameters supplied to the STOR command, which can lead to an exploitable buffer overflow. The vulnerable daemon, nmapd.exe, binds to TCP port 689.

NAME: WireShark LWRES Dissector Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: WireShark is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted UDP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the UDP request, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted UDP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: ASUS Remote Console Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: ASUS Remote Console is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TCP requests over port 623. The vulnerability is present in DPC Proxy server and is due to the lack of proper checks on user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TCP request over port 623. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Greylisting Daemon for Postfix Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Greylisting daemon (GLD) 1.3 and 1.4 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is present in server.c and is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing certain requests. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: HP Data Protector OmniInet Crafted Packet Parsing Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector 6.00 through 6.20 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on opcode 11 and opcode 20 packet sent to the server listening on port 5555. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request. A successful attack could crash the service and thus lead to a denial of service condition.

NAME: Computer Associates Message Queuing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Computer Associates (CA) Message Queuing (CAM / CAFT) 1.05, 1.07 before Build 220_13, and 1.11 before Build 29_13 is prone to a bufferoverflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while passingdata from the request to log_security function, leading to a buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passinga long crafted request to the CAM service, causing remote code execution.

NAME: Ingres Database Communications Server Component Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A heap buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Ingres Database Communications Server. The vulnerability is due to insufficient boundary check when handling user supplied data. A remote unauthenticated attacker may leverage this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request. Successful exploitation may cause the execution of arbitrary code on the target system with SYSTEM privileges.

NAME: UNIX rlogind Service guest Access
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates an attempt to login using the rlogin guest account without any password. The rlogin protocol allows setting up of trusted users and hosts who will be allowed to log on without the entry of a password.

NAME: Symantec Veritas NetBackup CONNECT_OPTIONS Request Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Symantec VERITAS NetBackup Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability in the Backup Client Service (BPCD). The vulnerability is due to incorrect processing of specially crafted BPCD messages. A remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system within the security context of the affected service, normally System.

NAME: GAMSoft Telsrv Username Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: GAMSoft TelSrv telnet server 1.5 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow while handling long username values. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the username values passed to the server. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server, or cause a denial of service condition.

NAME: CA Brightstor HSM Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Computer Associates BrightStor Hierarchical Storage Manager (HSM) is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks while parsing certain values passed in a request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server listening on port 2000. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the storage manager.

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCServe Backup Agent For MSSQL Server Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: BrightStor ARCserve Backup Agent for SQL Server 11.0 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling longpackets to TCP port 6070. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of requests over 3168 bytes, leading to a stack overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a long request to the backup system, causing remote code execution.

NAME: IBM Tivoli Monitoring Express Universal Agent Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in IBM Tivoli Monitoring Express. The flaw is due to a boundary error in the Universal Agent and various other components of Tivoli product while processing specially crafted user-supplied input. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a malicious input to one of the vulnerable services. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability may allow for arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the target

NAME: SAP Business One 2005 License Manager Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SAP Business One 2005 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks on user-supplied input before copying it to an insufficient sized buffer. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Connection Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows MSTSC Client is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RDP response.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some special record in the RDP response, leading to an exploitable heap overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RDP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Symantec Discovery XFERWAN.EXE Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Symantec Discovery XFERWAN Service is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on long string in the request packets,leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server

NAME: Ntpd Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Ntp daemon 4.0.99k and earlier are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted NTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while parsing certain arguments passed in a request. Since these user-supplied values are copied to finite stack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted NTP request that could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: DATAC RealWin Remote Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: DATAC RealWin is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SCADA requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the SCADA request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SCADA request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Symantec VERITAS NetBackup vnetd Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Symantec VERITAS NetBackup product line is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks during the processing of certain messages to the vnetd service. An attacker may leverage this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code on the target host with system level privileges.

NAME: Citrix Presentation Server IMA Service Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Independent Management Architecture (IMA) service in Citrix is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Citrix requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on invalid size value in the Citrix request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted Citrix request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: DATAC RealWin SCADA Server SCPC_TXTEVENT Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: DATAC RealWin SCADA server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on values passed in a SCP_TXTEVENT packet. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server on port 912. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Firebird SQL op_connect_request Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Firebird SQL is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of op_connect_request requests by the server listening on port 3050. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted op_connect_request request to a vulnerable server. A successful attack would create a denial of service condition on the Firebird SQL service.

NAME: X.Org XFS swap_char2b Function Remote Buffer Overflow  Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: XFS server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted xfs requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on font data in the xfs request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted XFS request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: KingView SCADA Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: KingView SCADA is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TCP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the TCP request, leading to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TCP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Express Backup Heap Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in IBM Tivoli Storage Manager. This vulnerability is due to the lack of validation of a user supplied value in a message. This value is later used as a counter to populate a fixed-length heap buffer. A remote unauthenticated attacker may leverage this vulnerability to create a denial of service condition of the affected service, or inject and execute arbitrary code on the target host.

NAME: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector is prone to a stack buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted unknown protocol requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on MSG_PROTOCOL in the unknown protocol request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted MSG_PROTOCOL request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way that the Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol processes certain messages. The vulnerability occurs in the process used to validate data contained in RDP messages. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to cause the target system to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service.            Note: FSC has been unable to reproduce the vulnerability within the 24-hour research period.

NAME: VERITAS NetBackup Java Authentication Service Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: VERITAS NetBackup products are prone to a format string vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to improper handling of the format string data of specific commands. An attacker may leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the security context of the affected product, normally System or root.

NAME: Sunway Forcecontrol SNMP NetDBServer Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sunway Forcecontrol is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is present in the NetDBServer and is due to the lack of proper checks on long strings passed in a request, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server listening on port 2001. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted RDP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the RDP request, leading to an exploitable code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RDP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: CA BrightStor ARCserve UDP Discovery Service Overflow
DESCRIPTION: BrightStor ARCserve Backup 11.1 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted UDP requests. The vulnerability is present in the Discovery Service and is due to the lack of proper length checks which could result in a stack-based overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the service listening on UDP port 41524. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the running server.

NAME: LCDProc parse_all_client_messages Arguments Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: LCDproc 0.4 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing a crafted request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of checks on the number of arguments passed in the parse_all_client_messages function. An attacker could send a crafted request with large number of arguments to the server listening on port 13666. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: CA ARCserve LGServer SetMessageLog Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exist a buffer overflow vulnerability in the way CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops service handles incoming messages. Specifically the vulnerability is due to lack of boundary check when processing setmessagelogsettings user request. By sending specially crafted request, an unauthenticated remote attacker can leverage these flaws to execute arbitrary code on the target host with System privileges.

NAME: RIM BlackBerry Enterprise Server Router Component Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the RIM BlackBerry Server product. The communication between BlackBerry routers may be disrupted by sending crafted Server Routing Protocol (SRP) messages. A remote unauthenticated attacker can cause a denial of service condition of the affected BlackBerry service.

NAME: Borland Interbase jrd8_create_database Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Borland Interbase srever is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain user-supplied strings passed to the jrd8_create_database function. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server on TCP port 3050. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: BomberClone Error Message Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: BomberClone before 0.11.6.2 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain error messages. The vulnerability isdue to the lack of bundary checks on the length of error messages, leading to a stack overflow. An attacker could exploit thevulnerability by sending a long error message, and causing remote code execution.

NAME: HP Data Protector OmniInet Opcode 20 Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector 6.00 through 6.20 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on opcode 20 packet sent to the server listening on port 5555. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: HP Data Protector DtbClsLogin Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HP Data Protector is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted special requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on DtbClsLogin command in the special request, leading to an exploitable remote code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted unknown request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: EMC Retrospect Client Crafted Packet Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in EMC Restrospect Client product. The flaw is caused by a boundary error in the handling of crafted packets sent to the Client service port of the target. An unauthenticated remote attacker may leverage this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code through triggering a buffer overflow. Any code execution will be in the security context of Client service process, System on windows platforms.

NAME: HP Data Protector Backup Client Service GET_FILE Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HP Data Protector Backup Client is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TCP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in the TCP request, leading to a directory traversal. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TCP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: TinyIdentD Remote Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: TinyIdentD 2.2 and earlier is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests on port 113. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on length values in user-supplied data. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending an overlong crafted request, and thus execute arbitrary code on the victim server.

NAME: CA License Software Invalid Command Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability has been reported in the CA License software of CA products. The CA License software is a license management tool that allows CA customers to register and manage their product licenses on a computer network. It is prone to a buffer overflow when parsing a crafted request message with an invalid command. The flaw may allow a malicious user to execute code on the vulnerable system with system or root level privileges.

NAME: DB2 JDBC Applet Server Request Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: DB2 JDBC Applet Server (DB2JDS) service in IBM DB2 9.x and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to lack of proper checks on certain values passed in a request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted packet to the service listening on port 6789. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: McAfee E-Business Server Authentication Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The administration interface in McAfee E-Business Server 8.5.2 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on initial authentication packet. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long authentication request. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Apache HTTP Server Linefeed Memory Allocation Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Apache HTTP Server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in the HTTP request, leading to an DOS condition. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to DOS against the target application.

NAME: HP Data Protector Manager RDS Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HP Data Protector Manager is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TCP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in the TCP request, leading to an exploitable DOS. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TCP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the target server.

NAME: Citrix MetaFrame IMA Authentication Processing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Citrix Presentation Server's IMA service is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities. These issues include a buffer-overflow vulnerability and a denial-of-service vulnerability.These issue may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected computer or to cause denial-of-service conditions.

NAME: Borland Interbase ibserver.exe Create-Request Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code onvulnerable installations of Borland Interbase. Authentication is notrequired to exploit this vulnerability.

NAME: Kerio Firewall Authentication Packet Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Kerio Personal Firewall is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is present in the administrator authentication process when parsing a large packet buffer sent by the user, which could overflow critical regions on the server. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the victim server. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: DATAC RealWin SCADA Server SCPC_INITIALIZE Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: DATAC RealWin SCADA server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on values passed in a SCP_INITIALIZE packet. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to the server on port 912. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Excel Conditional Formatting Values Handling Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted excel file.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on Size in the Conditional Formatting (CF) BIFF record, leading to an exploitable code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted Excel file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: SpamAssassin Malformed Email Header Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a remote denial of service vulnerability in Apache SpamAssassin. The vulnerability is caused due to improper handling of the Email headers. An attacker can exploit the vulnerability to cause extremely long delays in Email delivery.

NAME: Lotus Notes Autonomy KeyView LZH Archive File Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Notes before 8.5.2 FP3 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted archive files. The vulnerability is present in lzhsr.dll in Autonomy KeyView, and is due to the lack of proper checks on certain integer values passed in an lzh attachment. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted lzh file. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the software.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes wp6sr.dll WPD Attachment Viewer Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WPC files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the WPC file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WPC file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Windows SMTP Service BDAT DoS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SMTP service in Microsoft Windows 2000, Windows XP Professional, and Exchange 2000 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability. The vulnerability is triggered while parsing a crafted data transfer (BDAT) request.

NAME: SMTP Server Command Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Several SMTP servers such as Ipswitch Collaboration Suite and McAfee Webshield are prone to a format string vulnerabilitywhile parsing certain crafted SMTP commands in a request. The vulnerability is due to the improper validation of user supplied data in SMTP commands. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code with privileges of the SMTP service.

NAME: dSMTP Mail Server 3.1b Remote Root Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: NetWin DMail DSMTP Mail Server is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on XTELLMAIL command in the smtp request, leading to an exploitable format string vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted smtp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes mwsr.dll DOC Attachment Viewer Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted  Microsoft Word for DOS files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data  in the DOC file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DOC file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino nrouter.exe iCalendar MAILTO Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Domino is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the MAIL command arguments, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long crafted SMTP request. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the agent service.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino Web Access Message Handling Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way Lotus Domino Server handles email messages. When an email containing a large message body is opened through Domino Web Access, the Lotus Domino Server will experience an out of memory error. This error can lead to a denial of service condition.

NAME: GNU Mailman SMTP Message Large Date Value Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: GNU Mailman is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP request.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on DATE in the SMTP request, leading to an exploitable denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP request. A successful attack could lead to denial of service of the server.

NAME: SMTP long AUTH anomaly
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects an anomaly in SMTP protocol. It would trigger when anoverlong argument is passed to AUTH command. Stack-based buffer overflow can happen in MailEnable SMTPwhen overlong argument is passed to AUTH command.

NAME: Windows Mail UNC Navigation Request Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Windows Mail in Microsoft Windows Vista is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain links in an e-mailmessage. The vulnerability could be manifested through a link to a local file or UNC share pathname in which a directory is presentwith the same name as an executable program. In this case, the program is executed with the privileges of the current logged-in user.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending an e-mail containing a crafted link that could execute arbitrary scripts or executables when clicked on.

NAME: Apple Mac OS X Mail Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Mail in Apple Mac OS X Leopard is prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted image mail attachments. The vulnerability can be manifested through a AppleDouble attachment containing an apparently-safe file type and script in a resource fork. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted image mail attachment. A successful exploit could lead to remote command execution on the victim machine with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes Cross Site Scripting
DESCRIPTION: There exists a security flaw in IBM Lotus Domino Web Access (DWA) and Lotus Notes. Embedded JavaScript in HTML formatted Emails will automatically be executed when opened. A attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute scripts in Lotus Notes or in the DWA browser session.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino iCalendar MAILTO Parsing Stack Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Domino is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the MAIL command arguments, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long crafted SMTP request. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the agent service.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Web Access Script Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook Web Access is a component of Exchange server used to retrieve e-mail through                a web interface. Web Access is prone to a script injection vulnerability, when parsing crafted                HTML e-mails. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML e-mail with                injected script code, causing script code execution in the browser context. A successful attack                could be used to steal sensitive information from the victim machine.

NAME: Failed Authentication Through Mail Protocol
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a failed authentication response from mail server, it can be triggered by smtp, pop, imap.

NAME: Norton AntiVirus Decompression Bomb Denial Of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Norton AntiVirus is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted zip file.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the zip file, leading to an exploitable denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted zip file. A successful attack could lead to denial of service.

NAME: Ipswitch IMail Server List Mailer Reply-To Address Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: IPSwitch IMail List Mailer is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on Reply-TO headers passed in a request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a messagge contaning multiple long "Reply-To" headers. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Outlook Web Access for Exchange Server HTML Parsing Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Outlook Web Access for Exchange Server is prone to a Cross-site vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML email message.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the html email message.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted email message. A successful attack could lead to execute arbitrary javascript code.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes Speed Reader Attachment Link Long Url Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Notes is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities while parsing certain crafted attachments .The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on UUE file and HREF link in the mail attachment, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted mail attachment. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange XEXCH50 Extended SMTP Verb Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Exchange server 5.5 and Exchange 2000 are prone to a heap overflow vulnerability, when parsing malformed                extended SMTP command XEXCH50. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on the value passed                as a length argument to the XEXCH50 command. Since, this value is later used in heap memory allocation                 routines, it could lead to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability to execute                arbitrary code on the victim server, or could also cause a denial of service on the Exchange server.

NAME: SoftiaCom WMailserver SMTP Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SoftiaCom wMailServer versions 1.0 and 2.0 are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP commands. Thevulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the length of an SMTP command preceded by a space character, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker couldexploit the vulnerability by sending a long SMTP command to the server. A successful attack could cause remote code execution or leadto a denial of service condition.

NAME: SpamAssassin Long Message Header Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a remote denial of service vulnerability in Apache SpamAssassin. The vulnerability is caused by an inefficient method used in email header parsing. An attacker can exploit the vulnerability by sending a malicious email that contains crafted headers. This can cause the affected application to terminate.

NAME: ClamAV Mail Filter Extension Crafted Recipient Command Execution
DESCRIPTION: A shell command injection vulnerability exists in ClamAV AntiVirus product. The vulnerability can be triggered when the application processes malicious SMTP commands. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by delivering a crafted request to the target host, resulting in command injection and execution with privileges of the affected ClamAV application.

NAME: SMTP EHLO/HELO overlong argument anomaly
DESCRIPTION: This anomaly would be triggered when an overlong parameter is sent to the HELOcommand of SMTP protocol. Some servers such as Tabs Laboratories MailCarrier2.51 might be prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing the craftedrequest.A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino Web Access Message Handling Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way Lotus Domino Server handles email messages. When an email containing a large message body is opened through Domino Web Access, the Lotus Domino Server will experience an out of memory error. This error can lead to a denial of service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Office PowerPoint Long Filename Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office PowerPoint is prone to an remote code execution while parsing certain crafted Power Point files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks while opening long power point file paths. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted Power Point file with a long name. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange X-LINK2STATE command Heap Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Exchange server is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability, when parsing malformed                extended SMTP command X-LINK2STATE. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks                in the "SvrAppendReceivedChunk()" function in "xlsasink.dll" when parsing long X-LINK2STATE commands,                which could lead to a heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability to execute                 arbitrary code on the victim server, or could also cause a denial of service on the Exchange server.

NAME: Ipswitch Imail SMTP Server RCPT Command Stack Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Ipswitch  Collaboration 2006 Suite Premium and Standard Editions, IMail, IMail Plus, and IMail Secure products are prone to a stackoverflow vulnerability in the SMTP daemons that ship with the products. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on thelength a RCPT command which contains that '@' and ':" characters, leading to a stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby passing an overly long crafted RCPT command to the server, and cause remote code execution.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Advanced Find Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook is prone to a remote buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted saved search files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input date in malformed files, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted saved search file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Exim string_format Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Exim is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some field in the SMTP request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Exim Header Syntax Checking Remote Stack Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Exim MTA is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted smtp requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on from field in the smtp request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted smtp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Web Access for Exchange Server Email Field Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook Web Access for Exchange Server is prone to a cross-site scripting vulnerability while parsing certain crafted email messages.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input date in the email message, leading to a cross-site scripting.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted email. A successful attack could lead to run arbitrary javascript code.

NAME: Mozilla Thunderbird WYSIWIG Engine Filtering IFRAME JavaScript Execution
DESCRIPTION: Mozilla Thudnerbird is prone to a javascript code execution vulnerability while handling certain crafted e-mails. The vulnerability is due to a security restriction bypass that allows javascript to be executed in a e-mail composer window. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted e-mail with javascript code in an iframe tag. A successful exploit could execute arbitrary Javascript when a target user replies to a malicious HTML formatted email message.

NAME: Microsoft Word RTF Malformed String Handling Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office word is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted rtf files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the RTF file, leading to a code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RTF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange and Outlook TNEF Decoding Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Exchange and Microsoft Outlook process TNEF encoded messages. When the TNEF decoder used by these products processes a TNEF object record with a large size value, an integer overflow can occur. An attacker potentially can exploit this vulnerability for code execution by sending a specially crafted email to a target server or email account.

NAME: Mercury Mail Transport System AUTH CRAM-MD5 Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a remotely exploitable stack based buffer overrun in the latest version of Mercury Mail Transport System. Specifically the SMTP Server does not properly handle long AUTH CRAM-MD5 strings resulting in a complete compromise of the underlying system.

NAME: Firefox Command Line URL Shell Command Injection
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the Firefox browser start-up script. The script does not properly sanitize URLs supplied to it by external programs. This vulnerability can be exploited to run arbitrary shell commands with the privileges of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Novell GroupWise 'img' Tag Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Novell GroupWise is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data.Successfully exploiting this issue will allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Publisher Memory Object Handler Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Publisher is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted publisher files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on calculating object handler data in the publisher file, leading to a remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted publisher file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes mwsr.dll DOC Attachment Viewer Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted  Microsoft Word for DOS files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data  in the DOC file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DOC file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Attachment Name Verify Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while verifying certain crafted attachments.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on attachment extension name in the outlook, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending an attachment with a crafted link. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange Server MIME Base64 Decoding Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Exchange Server handles email messages. The vulnerability is a result of insufficient boundary checking when processing MIME content inside email messages. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability for code execution by sending a specially crafted email to an account on the target server. Any code injected using this vulnerability would be executed in the System security context.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Express MHTML URL Parsing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A URL parsing vulnerability exists in the Outlook Express MIME Encapsulation of Aggregate HTML Documents (MHTML) protocolhandler. The vulnerability is caused by improper sanitization of e-mail messages when parsing a MHTML URL. A malicious user may exploit this flaw to access and execute script in in the security context of the targetuser's browser session.

NAME: Microsoft Smtp  ASN.1 Library Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows ASN.1 library is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing the ASN.1 BER encoding string. The vulnerability is due to lack the proper checks on the length field in the ASN.1 encoding, leading to an exploitable integer heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending crafted SMB request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the administrator.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange Server TNEF Remote Code Execution Vulnereability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Exchange server is prone to a  remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TNEF messages.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the TNEF messages, leading to an exploitable remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TNEF message. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes Speed Reader UUE File Handing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Notes is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities while parsing certain crafted attachments .The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on UUE file and HREF link in the mail attachment, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted mail attachment. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes WPD Attachment Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Notes is prone to an overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WPD attachment.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the WPD attachment, leading to an exploitable overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted zip file. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary code execution of current log-on user.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes wp6sr.dll WPD Attachment Viewer Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: This advisory discloses a buffer overflow vulnerability in IBM Lotus Notes. The stack-based buffer overflow occurs when the user views a WordPerfect (.wpd) file (that was received as an email attachment) from within Lotus Notes. It is possible to exploit the buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code.In order to exploit this vulnerability successfully, the user must be convinced to view a malicious WordPerfect file attachment using the built-in viewer in Lotus Notes.The buffer overflow occurs within the wp6sr.dll DLL in the function that reads the document properties (e.g. Title, Subject, Author) from the WordPerfect file. The function uses a byte from the WordPerfect file as a counter to copy the contents of the WordPerfect file from a heap-buffer to a 2400-byte stack-buffer.This byte is multiplied by 256, before it is used as a counter. So the maximum value of the counter is 0xFF * 256 = 65280. By manipulating this byte in a specially-crafted WordPerfect file, it is possible to cause more than 2400 bytes to be copied from the WordPerfect file into the stack buffer. This overwrites the saved EIP and SEH, and can be exploited for arbitrary code execution.

NAME: Microsoft Excel Style Record Parsing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Excel is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted excel files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on a memory handling in Excel when validating Style record information upon opening a specially crafted Excel file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted excel file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes Applix Graphics Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Notes is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted file.The vulnerability is due to boundary error in the Applix Graphics reader (kpagrdr.dll) when parsing overly long tokens from the input file can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflowAn attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution within the context of the current logged-in user.

NAME: MailEnable SMTP HELO Command Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: MailEnable SMTP Server is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on HELO in the SMTP request, leading to an remote denial of service vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP request. A successful attack could lead a remote denial of service.

NAME: Exim SPA Authentication Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Exim SPA is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on AUTH NTLM field in the SMTP request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: GNU Mailman Attachment Scrubber UTF8 Filename Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: GNU Mailman is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on Content-Disposition in the SMTP requests, leading to an exploitable denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP requests. A successful attack could lead to denial of service of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange Server MIME Base64 Decoding Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Exchange Server handles email messages. The vulnerability is a result of insufficient boundary checking when processing MIME content inside email messages. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability for code execution by sending a specially crafted email to an account on the target server. Any code injected using this vulnerability would be executed in the <italic>System</italic> security context.

NAME: GnuPG Message Packet Length Handling Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists an integer overflow vulnerability in the GnuPG (GNU Privacy Guard) product. The problem is caused by an incorrect handling of the user supplied data. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to crash a vulnerable application or execute arbitrary code in the security context of the currently running process.

NAME: Windows Command Bind Shell Access
DESCRIPTION: This signature indicated a remote shell access happened if Metasploit exploited successfully.

NAME: Microsoft Windows LoadImage API Integer Overflow Exploit Through SMTP
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows is prone to a remote integer overflow vulnerability. The vulnerability exists in the LoadImageAPI function that is used by several graphic applications to load images. However, the API fails to check for a integer overflow supplied in user data. When the result of this integer overflow is used for a memory copy operation, it could result in an exploitablebuffer overflow. The overflow could then be exploited by an attacker to inject arbitrary code and execute it on the victim machine. The vulnerability could be exploited when a victim opens an e-mail containing the malicious image.

NAME: YahooPops SMTP Server Command Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: YahooPOPS versions 0.4 to 0.6 are prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP commands. The vulnerabilityis due to the lack of boundary checks on the length of an SMTP command, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker couldexploit the vulnerability by sending a long SMTP command to the server. A successful attack could cause remote code execution or leadto a denial of service condition.

NAME: Norton AntiVirus Decompression Bomb Denial Of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Norton AntiVirus is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ZIP files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the ZIP file. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ZIP file. A successful attack could lead to target system 100% cpu usage.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange Calendar Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Unspecified vulnerability in Microsoft Exchange allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via e-mail messages with crafted (1) vCal or (2) iCal Calendar properties.

NAME: SMTP long RCPT to anomaly
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects an anomaly in SMTP protocol. It would trigger when anoverlong argument is passed to RCPT TO command. Stack-based buffer overflow can happen in QK SMTP when long argument is passed to RCPT TOcommand.

NAME: Autonomy KeyView Lotus 1-2-3 File Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Autonomy KeyView SDK is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Lotus 1-2-3 files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on WKS format in the Lotus 1-2-3 file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted Lotus 1-2-3 file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange and Outlook TNEF Decoding Integer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Exchange and Microsoft Outlook process TNEF encoded messages. When the TNEF decoder used by these products processes a TNEF object record with a large size value, an integer overflow can occur. An attacker potentially can exploit this vulnerability for code execution by sending a specially crafted email to a target server or email account.

NAME: MDaemon Content Filter Directory Traversal Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: MDaemon server is prone to a directory traversal vulnerability due to improper sanitization of user input.Failure to sanitize the filename and path may result in compromise of the file system outside of the application's quarantine directory.

NAME: Alt-N MDaemon SMTP Server SAMI Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Alt-N MDaemon is reportedly prone to multiple remote buffer overflow vulnerabilities. The vulnerabilities are likely due to a failure of the application to properly validate buffer sizes when processing command argument input.By sending a large argument to certain SMTP commands, it is possible to cause this issue to present itself. Apparently, the application will not validate the size of the input before copying it into a finite buffer in process memory.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange Calendar Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Exchange is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Calendar properties in an email message.The vulnerability is present in the CDO (Collaboration Data Objects) component which is used to handle calendar data in email messages.The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of iCal and vCal properties in calendar data, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted email message to the Exchange server. A successful exploit could leadto remote code execution with the privileges of the server, or a denial of service condition on the server.

NAME: SMTP long MAIL anomaly Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects an anomaly in SMTP protocol. It would trigger when anoverlong mail command argument is passed to MAIL command.

NAME: Microsoft Outlook Web Access Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Outlook Web Access is a component of Exchange server used to retrieve e-mail through                a web interface. Web Access is prone to a cross-site scripting vulnerability, when parsing crafted                HTML e-mails with encoded javascript URLs. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a                 crafted HTML e-mail with                injected script code, causing script code execution in the browser context. A successful attack                could be used to steal sensitive information from the victim machine.

NAME: Microsoft ASN.1 Library Heap Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft ASN.1 library is prone to a integer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted ASN.1 requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on BER encoding in the ASN.1 protocol request, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted ASN.1 request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino iCalendar Meeting Request Parsing Remote Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Domino iCalendar is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted meeting requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the meeting request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted meeting request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Postfix SMTP Server SASL AUTH Handle Reuse Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The Postfix SMTP server is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain malformed SMTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the SMTP request. A successful attack could lead to memory corruption with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Ipswitch IMail Server Mailing List Message Subject Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Ipswitch IMail Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on the Subject field in the SMTP request, which could lead to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: RealNetworks RealPlayer WAV File Processing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A flaw exists in the way RealPlayer processes files encoded using the WAVE format. The vulnerability occurs when RealPlayer attempts to parse a crafted WAV file with an incorrect LIST chunk. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the currently logged in user.

NAME: Microsoft Collaboration Data Objects Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Collaboration Data Objects is vulnerable to a buffer overflow condition while parsing malformed SMTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on header lengths within the SMTP request. A successful attack could lead to arbitrary remote code execution with the privileges of the account running the server service.

NAME: Novell GroupWise Internet Agent Email Address Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Novell Groupwise Internet Agent is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted email addresses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the MAIL command arguments, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long crafted email address in the MAIL command. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the agent service.

NAME: IBM Lotus Domino nrouter.exe iCalendar MAILTO Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Domino is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the MAIL command arguments, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long crafted SMTP request. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the agent service.

NAME: Novell eDirectory iMonitor HTTPSTK Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: The Novell eDirectory server iMonitor is prone to a stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform sufficient bounds checking on client-supplied data before copying it to a buffer.An attacker could leverage this issue to have arbitrary code execute with administrative privileges. A successful exploit could result in the complete compromise of the affected system.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes HTML Message Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM lotus is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted html attachments.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in a html attachment, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted html attachment file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Squirrelmail PGP Plugin Command Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Squirrelmail webmail is prone to a command injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted email messages. The vulnerability is present in the PGP plugin and is due to the lack of proper filtering of user-supplied data. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted email. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the squirrelmail webmail service.

NAME: Autonomy KeyView Lotus 1-2-3 File Multiple Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Autonomy KeyView SDK is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Lotus 1-2-3 files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on WKS format in the Lotus 1-2-3 file, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted Lotus 1-2-3 file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: IBM Lotus Notes File Attachment Handling Long URL Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: IBM Lotus Notes is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities while parsing certain crafted attachments .The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on UUE file and HREF link in the mail attachment, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted mail attachment. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: SpamAssassin Malformed Message Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a vulnerability in the way SpamAssassin parses a specially crafted messages. An attacker exploiting this vulnerability can increase the likelihood of an e-mail address being blacklisted. If successful, legitimate messages from the e-mail address will be considered to be spam by the vulnerable product.

NAME: ClamAV UPX File Handling Heap Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A heap buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the ClamAV AntiVirus product. The vulnerability can be triggered when the application processes crafted UPX files. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by delivering a crafted file to the scanning service resulting in injection and execution of arbitrary code.

NAME: McAfee WebShield SMTP Bounce Message Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Webshield Smtp Server is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted smtp requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on  in the RCPT TO command in SMTP request,leading to an exploitable format string vulnerability.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted smtp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: MailEnable SMTP NTLM Authentication Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: MailEnable is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities. These issues arise in the SMTP server during NTLM authentication and may facilitate arbitrary code execution or denial-of-service conditions.MailEnable Professional 2.0 and MailEnable Enterprise 2.0 are reported vulnerable to these issues.

NAME: Novell GroupWise Internet Agent SMTP AUTH LOGIN Command Parsing Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a stack buffer overflow vulnerability in Novell GroupWise Internet Agent. The vulnerability is due to an error while processing specially crafted SMTP AUTH LOGIN requests. Remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the target server. In an attack case where code injection is successful, the behaviour of the target is entirely dependent on theintended function of the injected code. The code in such a case would execute with the security privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Word Memory Corruption Vulnerability#2
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Office Word is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DOC files.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input field in the DOC file, leading to an memory corruption.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DOC file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: MailEnable SMTP Server Authentication Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: MailEnable Enterprise and Professional Editions 1.54 and earlier are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability in the SMTP service.The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks when parsing a malformed SMTP AUTH command, with overly long credentialparameters, which could overflow finite buffers. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP AUTH command,overflowing the buffer and causing remote code to be executed with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Sendmail Asynchronous Signal Handling Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists a race condition vulnerability which may potentially result in memory corruption in the Sendmail Mail Transfer Agent. The vulnerability is caused due to improper handling of concurrent events when timeout conditions occur during the transfer of email messages. An unauthenticated remote attacker may leverage this vulnerability in order to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable host.            Assurent has not been able to reproduce this vulnerability.

NAME: Outlook Heap Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Outlook parses content in a specially crafted e-mail message. This vulnerability exists only in configurations where Outlook connects to an Exchange Server in Online Mode. Configurations where Outlook connects to an Exchange Server in the Cached Exchange Mode are not affected. In addition, configurations where Outlook uses POP or IMAP mail servers only are not affected by this vulnerability.An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange Server iCal Properties Handling Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: The Exchange Collaboration Data Objects (EXCDO) functionality in Microsoft Exchange Server 2000 SP3, 2003 SP1 and SP2, and 2007 is pronea denial of service vulnerability. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of calendar (iCal) content requestscontaining multiple X-MICROSOFT-CDO-MODPROPS (MODPROPS) properties in which the second MODPROPS is longer than thefirst. This triggers a NULL pointer dereference and an unhandled exception, leading to a server crash. An attacker could exploit thevulnerability by sending a crafted email message to the Exchange server. A successful exploit could leadto a denial of service condition on the server.

NAME: Sendmail Header Processing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sendmail is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SMTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on from field in the mail message , leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Postfix SMTP Service STARTTLS Implementation Plaintext Arbitrary Command Injection Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Postfix SMTP service is prone to a command injection vulnerability while parsing certain crafted smtp request. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on argument after starttls command in the smtp request, leading to a command injection. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted smtp request. A successful attack could lead to man-in-the-middle attack.

NAME: Microsoft Windows DHCP Client Service Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Windows DHCP Client Service is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain craftedDHCP options. The vulnerability is due to the lack boundary checks while parsing user-suplied input in certainDHCP response options, before copying the input to finite stack buffers, leading to a stack-based overflow. An attackercould exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCP response, which could lead to the overflow and subsequentremote code execution.

NAME: Microsoft Windows DHCP Server Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft DHCP Server  is prone to a heap overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DHCP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on hostname and clieng identify field in the DHCP request, leading to an exploitable heap overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: ISC DHCP Server Client Identifier Field Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: ISC DHCP server product is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to an incorrect verification on the client identifier option in a DHCPOFFER request. An attacker may exploit this vulnerability to crash the DHCP service on the target host.

NAME: Bootpd Boot File Name Parsing Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Bootpd 2.4.3 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted bootp request messages. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on boot file location, leading to an exploitable overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted bootp request. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server daemon.

NAME: ISC DHCP Server HostName Option Logging Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: ISC DHCP 3.0.1rc12 and 3 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain craftedDHCP options. The vulnerability is present in the DHCP daemon (DHCPD) and is due to the lack boundary checks while parsing user-suplied input in the HostName DHCP request options, before copying the input to finite memory buffers, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attackercould exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCP request, which could lead to the overflow and subsequentremote code execution.

NAME: Microsoft Windows DHCP Server Client Identifier Option Parsing Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: The DHCP Server service for Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 Server and Terminal Server Edition is prone to a buffer overflowvulnerability while parsing certain crafted DHCP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack proper length checks on theclient identifier option, before allocating heap buffer to copy user-supplied data. When the user-supplied option is copied to the finite heap buffers, it could lead to an exploitable overflow. An attackercould exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCP request, which could lead to the overflow and subsequentremote code execution.

NAME: Sun Solaris DHCP Client Arbitrary Code Execution
DESCRIPTION: DHCP client application shipped with Solaris is prone to a command execution vulnerability while handling certain crafted DHCP messages. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper sanitization of data supplied in DHCP reply messages. A remote attacker with access to the target's local network can exploit the vulnerability by sending malicious DHCP replies to the target. A successful exploit could allow arbitrary command execution with the privileges of the root user.

NAME: DHCP Long Hostname Anormaly
DESCRIPTION: Some Vendor is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DHCP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on hostname length in the DHCP request, leading to an exploitable buffer overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: OpenBSD DHCP Remote DoS
DESCRIPTION: DHCP server in OpenBSD 4.0 through 4.2 is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted DHCP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper validation of maximum message size specified in a DHCP option being smaller than the minimum IP MTU size. Since memory allocation is based on this size, an attacker could specify a size smaller than the IP MTU size, thus resulting in overflowing certain memory buffers. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCP request. A successful attack could crash the service thus leading to a denial of service condition.

NAME: Microsoft Windows SNMP Service Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: There exists a remote code execution vulnerability in the Microsoft Windows SNMP service. The flaw is caused by incorrect processing of specially crafted SNMP messages. A remote attacker may exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service condition or inject and execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system within the security context of the affected service, normally System.

NAME: Multiple Vendor SNMPv3 HMAC Handling Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There exists an authentication bypass vulnerability in multiple implementations of SNMPv3 protocol. The vulnerability is caused by improperly handling of HMAC in an authentication message. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SNMPv3 authentication request to gain unauthorized access to the target system.

NAME: Symantec Multiple Products ISAKMPd Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: A vulnerability exists in the way a component of multiple Symantec products processes ISAKMP messages. The vulnerability allows a malicious user to create a denial of service condition on the targeted service.

NAME: Cisco Malformed SNMP Message Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Cisco Device is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SNMP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on unit field in the SNMP protocol request, leading to a possible remote code execution.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SNMP protocol request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Cisco Malformed SNMP Message Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Cisco Device is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted SNMP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on unit field in the SNMP protocol request, leading to a possible denial of service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SNMP protocol request. A successful attack could lead to server crash or no response.

NAME: Linux Kernel SNMP NAT Netfilter Memory Corruption
DESCRIPTION: There exists a remote denial of service vulnerability in the Linux Kernel. The vulnerability occurs due to insufficient checks during the processing of SNMP packets by the netfilter module. By sending a crafted SNMP packet to a target host, an attacker may exploit this vulnerability to cause a double free error in the Linux Kernel; thus, creating a system wide denial of service condition.

NAME: Squid ASN.1 Header Parsing Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability in the way Squid web proxy parses SNMP messages. An SNMP message with specially crafted ASN.1 length fields can generate memory access violation errors. The exception generated by these errors can cause the product to restart, creating a denial of service condition for active transactions.

NAME: Castle Rock Computing SNMPc Network Manager Community String Stack Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Castle Rock Computing SNMPc Network Manager. The vulnerability can be exploited when an overly long community stringis supplied in the SNMP TRAP message. Successful exploitation can lead to the injection and execution of arbitrary code with SYSTEM level privileges.
