NAME: MIT Kerberos KDC Authentication Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: MIT Kerberos KDC is prone to a DoS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted kerberos requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the kerberos request, leading to an exploitable DoS. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted kerberos request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: MIT Kerberos V5 krb5_recvauth Double Free
DESCRIPTION: There exists a double free vulnerability in the authentication function of the MIT Kerberos V5 implementation. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service or to execute arbitrary code in the context of the program calling the krb5_recvauth function. Exploitation of this vulnerability on a Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC) host can result in the compromise of an entire Kerberos realm.

NAME: MIT Kerberos ASN.1 asn1_decode_generaltime Uninitialized Pointer Reference Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A memory corruption vulnerability exists in MIT Kerberos server. The vulnerability is due to the release of an  ninitialized pointer in the ASN.1 decoder while decoding maliciously crafted data. A remote, unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted RPC request to the kadmind daemon.

NAME: MIT Kerberos KDC NULL Pointer Denial Of Service Vulenrability
DESCRIPTION: MIT Kerberos KDC is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Kerberos requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the Kerberos request, leading to a denial of service vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted Kerberos request. A successful attack could lead to server crash or lost response.

NAME: Kerberos V5 Principal Name Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: Two vulnerabilities exist in MIT's library implementation of Kerberos V5. Both vulnerabilities relate to the mapping of Kerberos principal names to local names. First, in certain non-default configurations, when a long principal name is passed to the vulnerable Kerberos V5 library, it is possible to overflow a heap memory buffer. This can lead to remote code execution on the vulnerable application server, or result in a denial of service. Second, under certain conditions, Kerberos will consistently overwrite a heap buffer by 1 byte.

NAME: MIT Kerberos V5 KDC krb5_unparse_name Heap Overflow
DESCRIPTION: There exists a single byte heap overflow vulnerability in the MIT Kerberos V5 Key Distribution Center (KDC) implementation. The vulnerability is caused due to improper boundary checking in krb5_unparse_name function, and can result in a single byte overflow of a heap buffer. An unauthenticated remote attacker can leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service or to execute arbitrary code, potentially compromising an entire Kerberos realm.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Kerberos Spoofing Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Kerberos on Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 is prone to a spoofing vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Kerberos requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on encryption method in Kerberos request, leading to a man-in-the-middle attack.

NAME: MIT Kerberos KDC Cross Realm Referral Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: MIT Kerberos KDC is prone to a DoS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted kerberos requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the kerberos request, leading to an exploitable DoS. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted kerberos request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows 2000 Domain Authentication Bypass
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability within the authentication mechanism within Microsoft Windows 2000 that may allow a user with an expired Windows account to log in to a domain. Therefore, a remote user would be able to gain access to resources located on a domain without having to authenticate.

NAME: Microsoft Kerberos Null Pointer Dereference Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Kerberos is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted kerberos requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on TGT renewal data in the Kerberos request, leading to a denial of service.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted kerberos request. A successful attack could lead to DC reboot.

NAME: Sun Java JRE Trusted Methods Chaining Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Oracle Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted jar files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on Bitmap fields in the PDF file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution vulnerability. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PDF file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTML files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on HTML files, leading to an exploitable memory corruption. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTML file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Internet Explorer HtmlLayout Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Internet Explorer is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the HTTP response, leading to an exploitable remote code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP response. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of current logged-in user.

NAME: Altarsoft Audio Converter WAV File Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Altarsoft Audio Converter is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted WAV files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper boundary checks on certain values in a WAV file, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted WAV file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the user running the software.

NAME: Oracle Java FileDialog.Show Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is prone to a heap buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted web pages. The vulnerability is due to lack of proper checks while validating the size of the file name passed to FileDialog dialog box. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by crafting a webpage and enticing the victim to visit the page. A successful exploit could allow remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Microsoft SharePoint inplview.aspx XSS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft SharePoint is prone to a cross site scripting vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some fields in the HTTP request, leading to an exploitable code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server application.

NAME: Microsoft Internet Explorer Print Table XSS Vulneraiblity
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a XSS vulnerability while parsing certain crafted http responses. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on print page content in the http response, leading to an exploitable XSS. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted http response. A successful attack could lead to remote script code execution with the context of the current login user.

NAME: Microsoft Packager Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Packager is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted Microsoft Office files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks when Windows Object Packager loads objects embedded, leading to an exploitable code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted Microsoft Office file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

A successful attack could crash the server or make the server unresponsive by increasing the CPU consumption.
