Lsardelte is trying to delete an security object.This alert may be triggered by network administrator's remote access to the client machine or scanning activity, or triggered by a remote attacker which is trying to gather information for future attacks.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Print Spooler  Load Library Vulnerability

NAME: Windows Messenger Service Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a vulnerability in the part of RPC that deals with message exchange over MSRPC. The failure results because of incorrect handling of malformed messages. This particular vulnerability affects the MS Windows Messenger interface with RPC, which listens on RPC enabled ports. The vulnerability results because the Messenger Service does not properly validate the length of a message before passing it to the allocated buffer. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability would be able to run code with Local System privileges on an affected system. The attacker would be able to take any action on the system, including installing programs, viewing changing or deleting data, or creating new accounts with full privileges. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to send a specially formed request to the remote computer on specific RPC ports.

NAME: Microsoft Windows Workstation Service Memory Corruption Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A memory corruption vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows Workstation Service. The flaw is due to incorrect memory release when handling crafted RPC requests. A remote authenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious RPC requests. Successful attacks could allow for arbitrary code being injected and executed with System level privileges.. If code execution is successful, the behaviour of the target will depend on the intention of the attacker. In the case of an unsuccessful code execution attack, it could cause a denial of service condition in the target host.

NAME: Microsoft Exchange Server MSRPC Endpoint Memory Exhaustion DoS

An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted MSRPC request. A successful attack could crash the service and create a denial of service condition.

NAME: Samba NetDFS RPC Handling Heap Overflow

NAME: Microsoft RPC ISystemActivator bind
DESCRIPTION: System Activator (also known as IRemoteSCMActivator) is an ORPC base interface for supporting object activation. In the specific case of the COM SCM, running inside the rpcss service, this interface is used during the activation process. The COM SCM is looking for an object, asking the local or remote SCM to activate a given object. There are some vulnerabilities within the implementation of this interface in Microsoft Windows Systems. This alert is triggered when someone is trying to bind to this interface. This alert may be triggered by a network administrator's remote access to the client machine, or scanning activity, or triggered by a remote attacker which is trying to gather information for future attacks.

NAME: Microsoft RPC Locator Service Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checkson parameters passed to certain functions of the Locator Service. Since these user-supplied parameters are copied to finitestack buffers, it could lead to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request, which could lead to the overflow and subsequent remote code execution with SYSTEM privileges.

NAME: CA Alert Notification Server Threat Manager Overflow

NAME: Microsoft Windows MSDTC Denial of Service Vulnerability

NAME: Microsoft Windows PNP Service Access

This flaw allows an attacker to create a denial of service condition by causing the server process to terminate.

NAME: Microsoft Active Directory Service Principal Names Validation Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Active Directory is prone to a service principal names validation vulnerability while parsing certain crafted service principal names. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the SPN names, leading to a service downgrade or denial of service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SPN names. A successful attack could lead to service downgrade or denial of service against target service.

NAME: Computer Associates Products Backup Engine RPC Server Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup r11.5 SP1 and earlier is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted requests sent to the RPC service. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request to the service. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution, or cause a denial of service condition on the server.

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a craftedRPC packet, and execute remote code on the vulnerable machine.A successful attack may result in arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges leading to a full compromise. NAME: Microsoft Windows Client Service For Netware Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Samba MSRPC Remote Shell Command Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Samba 3.0.0 through 3.0.25rc3 is prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certaincrafted RPC requests to the service. The vulnerability is present in the smbd serviceand is due to the lack of proper filtering of shell metacharacters passed to the SamrChangePassword function.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted RPC request with arbitrary commands to the service. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution, or cause a denial of service condition on the server.

NAME: DOS Project1
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates that Porject 1 exploit is being used against port 135. Project 1 is a remote attack suite developed by Darkling69@hotmail.com that contains denial of service attack. It can cause unpatched Windows NT operating systems to consume 100% of CPU resources for a short period.

NAME: Windows Local Security Architect Security Identifier Lookup
DESCRIPTION: Windows NT Local Security Authority is the center of the Windows NT security subsystem. The LSA is a user-mode process used to maintain security information of a system known as the Local Security Policy. This alert may be triggered by network administrator's remote access to the client machine or scanning activity, or triggered by a remote attacker which is trying to gather information for future attacks.

NAME: FTP: login brute force attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is using a brute force attack to gain access to an ftp server. An FTP brute force attack is a method of defeating the cryptographic scheme by trying a large number of possible username and passwords.

NAME: Postgres Database User Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is doing a brute force attack and try to authenticated to the Postgres database server.

NAME: Microsoft ASP.Net Information Leak brute force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is executing a brute force attack to gain access to a remote ASP.NET server.

NAME: MAIL: User Login Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is using a brute force attack to gain access to mail server through smtp/pop3/imap authentication request.

NAME: HTTP: IIS Denial Of Service Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates a DOS attack against IIS server.

NAME: Sybase Database User Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is doing a brute force attack and try to authenticated to the Sybase database server.

NAME: MySQL Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is doing a brute force attack and try to authenticated to the MySQL server.

NAME: DNS: Spoofing Cache Record Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is using a spoofing method attack to poison the cache record in a dns server.

NAME: SIP Register Message Brute Force Attack
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates a brute-force attack through multiple SIP REGISTER request messages. It may try to brute-force a valid user name or password on that server.

NAME: SIP Bye Message Brute Force Attack
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates a brute-force attack through multiple SIP Bye request messages. It may cause denial of service against the target service.

NAME: Microsoft SQL Server User Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is doing a brute force attack and try to authenticated to the MSSQL database server.

NAME: HTTP: Apache Denial Of Service Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone want to exhaust the apache resources, as described by slowloris.

NAME: DNS Anomaly Response
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates the dns reponse packet is not common, someone is trying to spoof the dns server. If this event happened many times within		a short period of time, it maybe indicate someone is trying to spoof the dns serverr.

NAME: Oracle Database User Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is doing a brute force attack and try to authenticated to the Oracle database server.

NAME: SIP INVITE Method Request Flood Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates a flood dos attack through multiple SIP invite request messages.

NAME: Telnet Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is doing a brute force attack and try to authenticated to the Telnet server.

NAME: HTTP NTLM Authentication Brute Force Attack
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates a NTLM password brute-force attack found in your network.

NAME: VPN: Palo Alto Networks SSL VPN Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that a brute force attempt to login to the Palo Alto Networks SSL VPN via repeated HTTP authentication requests was detected.

NAME: MS-RDP Brute Force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is using a brute force attack to gain access to remote desktop. An ms-rdp brute force attack is a method of defeating the cryptographic scheme by trying a large number of possible username and passwords.

NAME: HTTP Forbidden Brute Force Attack
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates many HTTP 403 Forbidden responses were detected within a short time interval with the same source and destination. Multiple HTTP 403 Forbidden responses can indicate that an attacker is trying to brute-force the target server.

NAME: DB2 Database User Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is doing a brute force attack and try to authenticated to the DB2 database server.

NAME: SMB: User Password Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is using a brute force attack to gain access to windows.

NAME: Digium Asterisk IAX2 Call Number Exhaustion Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates an attempt to exhaust call number space in Digium Asterisk IAX2 server.

NAME: LDAP: User Login Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is using a brute force attack to gain access to windows through ldap bind request.

NAME: HTTP: User Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates that someone is using a brute force attack to get username and password trough http authentication request.

NAME: SSL Renegotiation Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SSL is vulnerable to a denial of service condition while parsing specially crafted SSL requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on renegotiate data in the SSL request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending multiple similar SSL requests thereby exhausting server memory.

NAME: SSH User Authentication Brute-force Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This event indicates a brute force attack through multiple login attempts to an SSH server.

NAME: FTP Login Failed
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates that someone is trying to login into a ftp server but failed. If this event happened many times within		a short period of time, it maybe indicate someone is trying to brute force guessing the password of the FTP server.

NAME: SSH2 Login Attempt
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a login attempt against the target SSH server. If there are too many login attempts, then it may mean an attacker is trying to brute-force the user name and password

NAME: OpenSSH sshd Identical Blocks Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the SSH1 protocol implementation in OpenSSH. The flaw is caused by incorrect processing of duplicated incoming blocks. An unauthenticated attacker may exploit this vulnerability to force the openssh server to consume large amounts of CPU time.

NAME: Putty SSH Client transport layer protocol incorrect length field buffer overflow vulnearbility
DESCRIPTION: Putty is a client-server program for authentication and encryption of network communications. There is a buffer overflow vulnerability caused by improper bounds checking of packet sizes and fields. By sending an overly large packet or a packet with an overly long field size during SSH key exchange and initialization, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer in the vulnerable SSH client and cause the SSH client to crash or execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the current use

NAME: SecureCRT SSH1 Identifier String Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is a bug in SecureCRT (http://www.vandyke.com/products/securecrt/) in aseemlingly trivial portion of its SSH connection code.  When an SSH Clientconnects to a server, the server sends a version string containing minor andmajor numbers for the protocol, as well as a server-specific identifier stringwhich is specified to be no more than 40 bytes long.  Unfortunetly the SecureCRTcode which handles errors relating to an unsupported protocol version containsan unchecked buffer overflow.

NAME: SSH CRC-32 Compensation Attack Detector Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: There is an integer overflow in CORE SDI SSH1 CRC-32 compensation attack detector. This vulnerability allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary commands on an SSH server or client.

NAME: FreeFTPD/FreeSSHD SSH Server Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: FreeFTPD/FreeSSHD SSH Serve are prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability. The applications fail to properly bounds-check user-supplied input before copying it to an insufficiently sized memory buffer.A successful attack may facilitate arbitrary code execution. Exploiting this vulnerability may allow an attacker to gain administrative access on targeted computers.

NAME: PacketTrap TFTP Filename Handling Denial of Service
DESCRIPTION: The TFTP server in PacketTrap pt360 Tool Suite PRO 2.0.3901.0 and earlier is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper filtering on special filenames such as '|' (pipe). An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TFTP request, that would crash the server.

NAME: TFTP Directory Traversal Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a directory traversal vulnerability is being exploited in the TFTP server. Several servers including Kiwi CatTools TFTP server lack checks to identify such traversal attempts. A successful attack could allow the attacker to place executables in arbitrary locations and run code of attacker's choice.

NAME: TFTP Server Error Packet Handling Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: TFTP Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TFTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on long error message packets, leading to an exploitable overflow. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: TFTPD32 Server FileName Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: TFTPD32 Server Version 2.21 and lower is prone to a stack overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TFTP requests. Thevulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the filename supplied in a TFTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerabilityby passing a long filename value in a TFTP request and overflow the buffer. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution ora denial of service condition.

NAME: HP Intelligent Management Center TFTP Server MODE Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: HP Intelligent Management Center TFTP Server is vulnerable to remote code execution while parsing certain malformed TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on TFTP requests. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: TFTP Server Transfer Mode Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Several TFTP Servers such as FutureSoft Server and 3Com TFTP Server are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the transfer mode supplied in a TFTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a long transfer mode string in a TFTP request and overflow the buffer. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or a denial of service condition.

NAME: Solarwinds TFTP Server Filename Parsing Denial of Service Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SolarWinds TFTP Server 10.4.0.10 is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on certain values passed in a read request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TFTP request. A successful attack could crash the server, thus leading to a denial of service condition.

NAME: TFTP Server FileName Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Several TFTP Servers such as FutureSoft Server and TFTPD32 Server are prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks on the filename supplied in a TFTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by passing a long filename value in a TFTP request and overflow the buffer. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or a denial of service condition.

NAME: 3Com 3CDaemon Reserved Device Name DoS
DESCRIPTION: 3Com 3CDaemon's TFTP server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted requests. The vulnerability is due to the improper handling of GET requests containing MS-DOS device name, leading to a denial of service condition. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request that could crash the server.

NAME: TFTPDWIN Server Long Message DoS
DESCRIPTION: TFTPDWIN server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability while handling certain crafted TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on malformed TFTP requests in a recv_from call. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long request that could crash the server.

NAME: Microsoft Windows RIS TFTP Service Writable Path Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: A path overwrite vulnerability exists within the Microsoft Windows Remote Installation Service. The Remote Installation Service (RIS) includes a TFTP server that is configured by default to allow anonymous users to update and overwrite files. This vulnerability allows an attacker to compromise operating installs offered by the RIS server.

NAME: HP Intelligent Management Center TFTP Server DATA and ERROR Packets Buffer Overflow
DESCRIPTION: HP Intelligent Management Center TFTP Server is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while parsing certain malformed TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on some fields in the TFTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: dnsmasq TFTP Remote DoS Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: dnsmasq TFTP is prone to a remote dos vulnerability while parsing certain crafted TFTP requests.The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks in the TFTP request, leading to an exploitable remote dos. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted TFTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote dos with the privileges of the server.

NAME: AT TFTP Server Filename Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Allied Telesyn TFTP Server (AT-TFTP) 1.9, and earlier, is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability while handling certain crafted TFTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of boundary checks while handling long filenames in a GET/PUT request, leading to an exploitable stack overflow. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a long filename in a GET or PUT request. A successful exploit could lead to remote code execution or a denial of service condition.

NAME: TFTP32d Format String Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: TFTP32d is prone to a format string vulnerability while parsing certain crafted tftp requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on source file field in the tfp request, leading to an exploitable condition. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted tftp request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Nimda Worm TFTP Request Admin.dll
DESCRIPTION: This alert indicates a machine infected with Nimda worm, which is attempting to download a copy of the worm through a TFTP request. The worm exploits a vulnerability in IIS. After a successful exploit, the worm scan for vulnerable IIS servers and tries to download a copy through TFTP and execute it on the victim machine.

There have been reports that this malware is able to bypass the protection provided by the most system rollback software products which restore the system to a previous clean state upon reboot. If a user can be tricked into running this program, then the Insane Network installs itself and uses port 2000 or 63535 to communicate with a remote attacker, which would allow the attacker to gain access to the victim\'s system.

NAME: Classroom Spy Professional
DESCRIPTION: Classroom Spy Professional is a remote administrator tool that allows a user to monitor and take control of an infected system. It monitors, records activities on the remote computer, takes over remote control of its mouse and keyboard, schedules remote computers desktop recording, power off, restart, hibernate, and log off desktop users. The spy agent can be run as an NT service or a process and the application can use encrypted communication as an option.

NAME: Mebroot calls home
DESCRIPTION: Trojan.Mebroot is a Trojan horse that overwrites the Master Boot Record of the hard disk and uses rootkit techniques to hide itself.

NAME: Trojan.Win32.Agent.chgp

NAME: Antivirus-2009 redirect to order page
DESCRIPTION: Antivirus 2009 is a rogue anti-spyware program that floods users with pop-ups, fake system notifications. It also hijacks the browser by inserting its own advertisements on the infected system. It may block its homepage access and claim Antivirus to be a legitimate security tool and redirect users to the purchasing page to order a licensed version. If ignored, it will display more severe warnings like blue screen of death and Windows log off page to scare users in buying the product.

NAME: Backdoor Helios 3.1
DESCRIPTION: Backdoor Helios 3.1 is a backdoor Trojan horse that is a variant of Backdoor Helios. It is written in Microsoft Visual Basic, version 6. Backdoor Helios gives its creator unauthorized access to an infected computer using Internet Relay Chat (IRC). The existence of the Ssvchost.exe file is an indication of a possible infection. The Trojan attempts to disable some antivirus and firewall programs by terminating the active processes. It communicates using TCP on port 3737.

This malware also makes changes to the registry keys to control the Internet Explorer. As a result pop-up ads are displayed on the victims host in a timely manner.

NAME: Backdoor Microspy 1.0

Microspy contains a sniffing tool that listens to network traffic. Microspy could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system, and possibly retrieve access to other systems on the network.

NAME: Backdoor WinCrash 2.0

The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port to allow the client system to connect. The WinCrash port can be configured to be either a UDP port or a TCP port and the port number can range between 1 and 65535. WinCrash could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system. This version communicates by default using port 2583.

DESCRIPTION: Personal Antivirus is a rogue security software that performs fake scans on the system and reports false vulnerability and spyware infections. By doing this the software attempts to trick the users into purchasing the license of the software.

NAME: Backdoor Le guardien 1.0
DESCRIPTION: Le Gardien, also known as Le Guardien, is a French backdoor Trojan written in Visual Basic 6 affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP port 1001, to allow the client system to connect. Le Gardien could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system.

NAME: Easy_Keylogger_5
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Easy Keylogger. Easy Keylogger is a keylogger that can run in stealth mode, records/monitors keystrokes, applications, and passwords. The recorded logs can be viewed from the application or be send to any user\'s specified email.

NAME: Trojan-Downloader.Win32.Delf.phh detect 57329.exe
DESCRIPTION: Trojan-Downloader.Win32.Delf.phh is a Trojan downloader application that requests and downloads files and malware binaries from the Internet to the local computer that may represent security risks. Also, it creates start-up registry entires on the victim\'s host.

NAME: Backdoor R3C
DESCRIPTION: A Remote Administration Tool (RAT) is a Trojan type of software that when run, provides an attacker with the capability of remotely controlling a user\'s computer (victim) over the Internet. The attacker usually has full access to functions on the victim\'s computer. The victim\'s computer usually listens on the Internet for the attacker\'s commands. It communicates using TCP on port 9870.

NAME: Antivirus-2009 redirect to presale page
DESCRIPTION: Antivirus 2009 is a rogue anti-spyware program that floods users with pop-ups, fake system notifications. It also hijacks the browser by inserting its own advertisements on the infected system. It may block its homepage access and claim Antivirus to be a legitimate security tool and redirect users to the purchasing page to order a licensed version. If ignored, it will display more severe warnings like blue screen of death and Windows log off page to scare users in buying the product.

NAME: Downloader Trojan.Gen3
DESCRIPTION: Downloader Trojan Gen3 downloads malicious code to a user\'s computer without the user\'s consent. It keeps contacting remote servers and sending out lots of underground network traffic. It occasionally pops up windows asking users to download unwanted software such as rogue anti-virus or anti-spyware applications.

NAME: Backdoor BackOrifice 2000 1.0
DESCRIPTION: Back Orifice 2000 is one of many backdoor programs that attackers can use to access your computer system without your knowledge or consent. Back Orifice 2000 allows remote operation of infected Windows 95/98 and Windows NT computers. With the Back Orifice 2000 backdoor, an attacker can gather information about your network, perform system commands, reconfigure computers on your network, redirect network traffic. By default it communicates using TCP or UDP on port 31337.

NAME: Packed.Win32.Klone.bj
DESCRIPTION: Packed.Win32.Klone.bj is a Trojan that creates and downloads malicious files on the victim\'s machine and steals user information. It spreads by emails or other Trojans.

NAME: Backdoor Ghost 2.2
DESCRIPTION: Ghost, also known as Backdoor.Ghost.20, Backdoor.Ghost.21, Backdoor.Ghost.22, Backdoor.Ghost.23, Backdoor.Ghost.24, Backdoor.Ghost.binder, and Generic BackDoor.d, is a backdoor Trojan written in Visual Basic that affects Microsoft Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP port 9696, to allow the client system to connect. Ghost could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access and gain complete control of the system.

NAME: Bot: Torpig Phone Home DNS request
DESCRIPTION: This attack detects the command and control activity of Torpig

NAME: Backdoor Backage 3.1.1
DESCRIPTION: Backage is a French backdoor Trojan written in Visual Basic 6 affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP port 5333 or TCP port 12478, to allow the client system to connect. Backage could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system. Backage has multiple variants, including Backage 3.0, Backage 3.0.1, Backage 3.1 New Backdoor Age, Backage 3.2 SE, and Backage Server 3.1a.

NAME: W32.Autorun.worm.dq df-123
DESCRIPTION: W32.Autorun.worm.dq is a network Worm that infects other machines by replicating itself across the accessible network. It also communicates with remote hosts to download malicious content on the victim\'s machine.

DESCRIPTION: A Remote Administration Tool (RAT) is a Trojan type of software that when run, provides an attacker with the capability of remotely controlling a user\'s computer (victim) over the Internet. The attacker usually has full access to functions on the victim\'s computer. The victim\'s computer usually listens on the Internet for the attacker\'s commands. NAME: Backdoor Bigorna 1.0
DESCRIPTION: Bigorna, also known as BackDoor-VF and Backdoor.Bigorna.10, is a backdoor Trojan affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port to allow the client system to connect. Bigorna could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system. It communicates using TCP on port 6969.

NAME: Trojan.Downloader.Delf.RGL
DESCRIPTION: Trojan.Downloader.Delf.RGL is a Trickler that downloads and installs malicious files and unwanted content from remote servers onto the victim\'s machine without their consent.

NAME: Trojan.Win32.Banload.HH www.arealconsult.no
DESCRIPTION: Trojan.Win32.Banload.HH is a Trickler that downloads and installs malicious files and unwanted content from remote servers onto the victim\'s machine without their consent.

NAME: Backdoor TransScout
DESCRIPTION: The TransScout backdoor is one of many backdoor programs that attackers can use to access your computer system without your knowledge or consent. The TransScout backdoor uses an interface similar to that used by the DeepThroat backdoor. Once executed on a victim\'s computer, the TransScout backdoor listens on TCP ports 1999 and 2000 for incoming client connections. The TransScout backdoor also listens on TCP port 9878, which is used to ease scanning of large IP address blocks for other systems infected with the TransScout backdoor. Once a client has connected and entered the correct server password, the client can perform a variety of operations on the victim computer.

NAME: Elite_Protector Retrieve information and status
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Elite Protector. Elite Protector is a rogue security software that is often installed by a trojan. It uses scare tactics with pop-ups and pop-unders in alerting users that their system is infected . It tries to connect to its own server to retrieve information and update status.

NAME: Ditto_Toolbar Redirects search engine
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Ditto Toolbar. Ditto Toolbar adds a third party utility bar to the web browser, changes the search function and redirects to its own search engine. It may also tracks browsing habits and search queries in order to display contextually relevant search results and ads.

NAME: Backdoor Latinus 1.3
DESCRIPTION: Qwertos, also known as Latinus, is a backdoor Trojan affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. Qwertos uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP port 11831 or 29559 to allow the client system to connect. Qwertos could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system.

NAME: PWS.Win32.Ldpinch.gen
DESCRIPTION: PWS.Win32.Ldpinch.gen is a Snoopware that attempts to gather private user data, such as passwords, from the host computer and send the data back to a remote webserver.

NAME: Wowpa KI
DESCRIPTION: Wowpa KI is a snoopware that attempts to capture passwords as they are entered or transmitted.

NAME: W32.Autorun.worm.dq jiu66
DESCRIPTION: W32.Autorun.worm.dq is a network Worm that infects other machines by replicating itself across the accessible network. It also communicates with remote hosts to download malicious content on the victim\'s machine.

NAME: Backdoor Celine

The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP port 4523, to allow the client system to connect. Celine could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system.

NAME: Backdoor Tron
DESCRIPTION: Tron, also known as Backdoor.Tron and BackDoor-AFM, is a backdoor Trojan affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP port 58008, to allow the client system to connect. Tron backdoor could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system.

NAME: Trojan.Win32.Ertfor.A updatesabout.com
DESCRIPTION: Trojan.Win32.Ertfor.A is a Trickler that connects to a predefined server, downloads and installs malicious executable software silently. This malware typically spreads by spoofed emails or other Trojans.

NAME: Backdoor Moon pie 1.0
DESCRIPTION: Moonpie is a backdoor Trojan affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server uses TCP ports 25982, 25685, 25686, and 27160 while the client uses TCP ports 25386 and 25486 to allow the client system to connect. Moonpie could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system.

NAME: Backdoor Amitis 1.4.3
DESCRIPTION: Amanda 2.0 is a backdoor client/server combination that lets you open a remote session to another system and take control. It communicates using the TCP protocol on ports 12345, 3547, 47387, 44390, 7823, 13173, 64429 and 44280 by default.

NAME: 007 Anti-Spyware
DESCRIPTION: 007 Anti-Spyware is a rogue security software that performs fake scans on the system and reports false vulnerability and spyware infections. By doing this the software attempts to trick the users into purchasing the license of the software.

NAME: Trojan.Lineage.Gen.Pac.3
DESCRIPTION: Trojan.Lineage.Gen.Pac.3 is a Trojan application that installs malicious files and libraries on the system and requests malicious content from the Internet.

NAME: Antivirus 2008 display ads or ask for purchase
DESCRIPTION: Antivirus 2008, also known as Antivirus2008, Antivirus 2008 Pro, is a rogue anti-spyware program that uses false spyware results to lure you to purchase its full version. Antivirus 2008 is usually promoted via a ZLOB/MediaAccess Codec installer found on adult websites. You can also install it manually on the rogue website antivirus-scanner.com. Antivirus 2008 may use its system scanner to display false positives which work as an incentive to make unsuspecting users purchase Antivirus 2008\'s commercial version. AntiVirus 2008 may also display other third-party ads and, according to its EULA, AntiVirus 2008 has adware terms added. Do not click on any link provided by Antivirus 2008. Once you click on the link provided, you\'ll be redirected to Antivirus 2008\'s website (antivirus2008.com) to download and purchase Antivirus 2008\'s rogue anti-spyware program. Antivirus 2008 has the ability to recreate itself after reboot and its \"System scan\" messages may continue pop up on your task manager.

NAME: Bot: Gozi Phone phone activity
DESCRIPTION: This attack detects the command and control activity of Gozi

NAME: Backdoor Back Orifice
DESCRIPTION: Back Orifice is backdoor, for WIN 95 and WIN 98 that was written by Cult of the Dead Cow. This back door has been publicised by Cult of the Dead Cow as an administrative tool, which it may be. Given the covert nature by which it can be installed and the steps it takes to hide itself few would agree that it is an administrative tool. With the Back Orifice backdoor, an attacker can obtain total control of the system. It communicates by default using TCP or UDP on port 31337.

NAME: Direct_Toolbar
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Direct Toolbar. Direct Toolbar is a Korean toolbar that adds itself to the browser above or below the address bar. It hijacks the address bar, search engine and redirects queries to its own search engine without user\'s consent. It may also track browser habits and queries to display relevant results and ads on the infected system.

NAME: Backdoor Black angel 1.3
DESCRIPTION: Black Angel, also known as Black Angel.13 and Black Angel b5, is a backdoor Trojan affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. Black Angel uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. Black Angel is normally stored in the Windows registry under HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionRun. When Black Angel is executed, the server component copies itself as C:WINDOWSIex32dll.exe, and restarts when the Windows operating system is booted up. The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP 1850, to allow the client system to connect. Black Angel could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system.

NAME: Backdoor Psychward 3.0
DESCRIPTION: PsychWard is a backdoor Trojan affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. PsychWard uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port to allow the client system to connect. PsychWard often displays an image while downloading to distract the user. PsychWard could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system. It communicates using TCP on port 13013.

NAME: Backdoor DeltaSource 0.7
DESCRIPTION: The DeltaSource backdoor is one of many backdoor programs that attackers can use to access your computer system without your knowledge or consent. With the DeltaSource backdoor, an attacker can access files, access your system registry, execute programs. It communicates using UDP on port 47262.

NAME: MPACK Infomration Upload
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavious of the spyware MPACK. MPack is	 a spyware that steal information from the customers's browsing activity.

NAME: Worm.Win32.Bagle.gen.C
DESCRIPTION: Worm.Win32.Bagle.gen.C, also known as Win32.Bagle.SUQ@mm [BitDefender], Email-Worm.Win32.Bagle.of [Kaspersky], W32/Bagle.gen [McAfee], Trojan.Tooso.R [Symantec], is a network Worm that infects other machines by replicating itself across the accessible network. It also communicates with remote hosts to download malicious content on the victim\'s machine.

NAME: Trojan-Spy.Win32.Pophot list
DESCRIPTION: Trojan-Spy.Win32.Pophot is a trojan downloader that installs other malicious code and files into the infected system. It attempts to steal passwords, login details and other confidential information and sends such information to its remote host. The downloader may also generate many Chinese pop-up porn related advertisements randomly that cause the system to slow down significantly.

NAME: Antivirus 360
DESCRIPTION: Antivirus 360 is a rogue security program that attempts to scare and trick the users to purchase the software via reporting fake virus and spyware detections and displaying false warnings and alerts.

NAME: Backdoor Blade runner 0.80a
DESCRIPTION: BladeRunner is a backdoor Trojan that affects Microsoft Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port, typically TCP port 21, 5400, 5401 or 5402 to allow the client system to connect. BladeRunner could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access and gain complete control of the system.

NAME: TROJAN PRG/wnspoem/Zeus InfoStealer post
DESCRIPTION: This spyware is a harmless trojan, which is able to perform annoying actions only. Zeus Trojan writes itself into the boot sectors of the C: and A: disks. This trojan also changes several nonessential settings, such as font size.

NAME: Kamyab Keylogger v.3
DESCRIPTION: Kamyab Keylogger v.3 is a keylogger that records pressed keys of the infected system in stealth mode. It also claims to be able to steal cached password, yahoo password, etc. All the logs is delivered to website www.kamyab-hack.com through HTTP at a specific time interval.

NAME: Monitor.Win32.Perflogger
DESCRIPTION: Monitor.Win32.Perflogger is a keylogger application that is believed to be a variation of the more comprehensive Perfect Keylogger tool from Blazing Tools Software. This malware can be installed via other malware or software exploits. After installation, Monitor.Win32.Perflogger runs on the installed computer fully hidden from its users, and captures all keystrokes, applications used, emails, chat sessions, instant messages, and websites visited. The malware then tries to send out the captured information to a remote server via FTP.

NAME: Backdoor MoSucker 3.00
DESCRIPTION: Mosucker is a backdoor Trojan that is written in Visual Basic, affecting Microsoft Windows 98, 95, and possibly other versions of Windows operating systems. The backdoor uses a client/server relationship, where the server component is installed in the victim\'s system and the remote attacker has control of the client. The server attempts to open a port to allow the client system to connect. Mosucker contains a key logger option that captures passwords. The backdoor can disable personal firewalls and antivirus software. Mosucker could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system.

NAME: Cinmus Variant
DESCRIPTION: The Cinmus Variant is a browser hijacker application which installs itself as a Browser Helper Object (BHO) on a user\'s system. It alters the Internet Explorer settings unexpectedly, monitors the user\'s web activity and hijackes user searches to remote servers.

NAME: Spyware Searchsquire download
DESCRIPTION: SearchSquire is adware (advertising oriented spyware) for Microsoft Windows running Internet Explorer. It is a plugin that is activated when a user connects to the Internet. SearchSquire delivers a text file when a user opens a browser window. If the user clicks on one of the actions in the file, SearchSquire contacts it\'s servers and delivers information and advertisements to the user. SearchSquire connects with a user\'s computer to install automatic updates and software applications without any user interaction. The plug-in may cause Internet Explorer to crash.

NAME: Backdoor Ultors
DESCRIPTION: The Ultors backdoor is one of many backdoor programs that attackers can use to access your computer system without your knowledge or consent. With the Ultors backdoor, an attacker can view and delete files and directories, execute programs, shut down your computer and display error messages. It communicates using TCP on port 1234.

NAME: Backdoor Subseven 2.1 Gold
DESCRIPTION: SubSeven is a powerful backdoor that is widely used against Windows systems. With recent versions, a remote attacker can do anything to a victim\'s computer that could be done locally. With the SubSeven backdoor, an attacker can shut down or restart your computer, retrieve saved and cached passwords, modify your system registry, upload, download, and delete files from your system, intercept keyboard activity or take over the keyboard, view your current screen or webcam output and communicate to you or as you over various messaging systems. The server component allows the user to configure it to listen on any port.

DESCRIPTION: Trojan-Downloader.Win32.Zlob.wwv is a backdoor Trojan that installs malicious executables and libraries on the system which download unwanted scripts and advertisements content to the victims machine.

DESCRIPTION: Massaker is a backdoor Trojan that is written in Visual Basic, affecting Microsoft Windows operating systems. NAME: Trojan-Downloader.Win32.Perkesh

There have been reports that this malware is able to bypass the protection provided by the most system rollback software products which restore the system to a previous clean state upon reboot. During the research it has been confirmed that this is true for the case of Furonics Deep Freeze product. It is likely that it may be able to bypass other similar products.

NAME: PestBot Purchase
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware PestBot. PestBot keeps displaying fake warning messages/scan reports to users to trick the users into registering/purchasing the PestBot, in order to remove the potentially dangerous reported problems. It may also download update codes to the user\'s computer without the user\'s consent.

NAME: Download_Accelerator_Plus DAP update
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Download Accelerator Plus. Download Accelerator Plus is an adware application that collects user information and displays advertisements.

NAME: LiveProtection_2_1 Redirects to purchase page
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Live Protection 2.1. Live Protection is a rogue security software that display random fake pop-ups with trojan and malware alert messages to scare users in purchasing the product. This software is associated with rogue anti-spyware KillSpy.

NAME: DownloadWare Download files - .dl requests
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware DownloadWare. DownloadWare connects to its controlling server if a network connection is available and downloads and installs spyware programs from the controlling server.

NAME: NetWindow init connection (reverse mode)
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the Spyware NetWindow.NetWindow enables an attacker to take control of an infected computer. The main functions include: get system info, file manager, screen capture, process manager, register manager, etc.

NAME: Instant_Buzz Random text ads
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware Instant Buzz. Instant Buzz is an adware application which installed as an Internet Explorer advertising toolbar. It changes a user\'s Internet Explorer settings unexpectedly and delivers targeted advertisements to the user.

NAME: Lycos_SideSearch Lycos SideSearch query
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Lycos SideSearch.Lycos SideSearch is an Internet Explorer Browser hijacker. It changes browser settings and downloads components from its controlling server to update itself without authorization or user intervention.

NAME: Roogoo surfing monitor
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Roogoo.Roogoo is an adware application that monitors user's surfing activities and displays pop up advertisements when some searching pattern is matched.

NAME: FKWP connect attempt with correct pwd
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware FKWP 2.0.FKWP 2.0 is a backdoor application. It allows a remote attacker to download, upload, delete and run arbitrary files on an infected computer. It enables users to specify where to download 2 cab files when the server starts. It also supports icq notification.

NAME: SurfSideKick Hijack IE auto search
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware SurfSideKick.SurfSideKick is an adware application that displays pop-up advertisements while user is browsing the web, or doing searches by using search engines. It also a browser hijacker that redirects the browser to its site whenever a Web site that a user attempts to access does not exist. SurfSideKick can contact its controlling server and download arbitrary code to the user's computer.

NAME: Mithril_1_45 get system info
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the Spyware Mithril.Mithril enables an attacker to take remote control of an infected computer.

NAME: Active_Shopper Collect information
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware Active Shopper. Active Shopper is an adware application. It adds a sidebar with Internet Explorer. The side bar keeps launching every time something is searched on popular search engines, such as Google, Yahoo, MSN, Search.com, Ask, and shopping sites like amazon.com, etc. It is able to catch and pass the user's search keyword to its controlling server and get keyword-targeted advertising contents to the user. Active Shopper also collects user information.

NAME: Absolute_Yukon_Solitaire vcp.cgi request
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware Absolute Yukon Solitaire. Absolute Yukon Solitaire is an adware application that delivers advertisements users. It also collects users' personal information during the installation.

NAME: Bluefire_0_5 initial connection
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the Spyware Bluefire 0.5.Bluefire 0.5 is a remote administration tool. It enables an attacker to take control an infected computer. It has a built-in ftp server to enable the attacker to upload and download files.

NAME: AntiPC_1_1 copy or move file/folder
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the Spyware AntiPC Trojan 1.1.AntiPC Trojan 1.1 enables an attacker to take control over an infected computer.

NAME: Key_Spyware send log via ftp
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware Key Spyware. Key Spyware could record user's keystroke, capture screenshot at predefined interval, and send out log through FTP/SMTP.

NAME: BoBo get system info
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware BoBo.BoBo is a remote administration tool, which enables the attacker to control an infected machine.

NAME: Sohoanywhere init connection
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the Spyware Sohoanywhere.Sohoanywhere enables an attacker to take control of an infected computer. The main functions include: remote desktop control, file system manager, screen capture, etc.

NAME: Acid_Shivers init telnet connection
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the Spyware Acid Shivers.Acid Shivers enables an attacker to take control of an infected computer. It runs on a random tcp port each time it's started and it sends an email to the infector telling them the info. Telnet is used to connect to victim and there are quite a few commands such show/kill processes, file system browse, execute command, get various information, etc.

NAME: Rabio_4_2 tries to update without user's consent
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware Rabio 4.2. Rabio 4.2 is a search enhancer that hijacks the address bar and redirects traffic to another server and alters search results. It may display advertisements that are based off of user preferences and settings as well as automatically download updates without user\'s consent.

NAME: Eraser
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of eraser. eraser is a trojan, which allows an attacker to remotely erase everything on the server computer and then freezes keyboard and mouse.

NAME: YXNetScreen_2_0
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the Spyware YXNetScreen 2.0.YXNetScreen 2.0 enables an attacker to view screen capture of an infected computer remotely through http service without user consent.

NAME: RemoteKeyLog_b
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of RemoteKeyLog.b. RemoteKeyLog.b is a keylogging program which runs in the background and records all keystrokes a user types in. It also has functions such as get system information, open urls on the victim's computer and some fun stuff.

NAME: ZXShell

NAME: EarthLink_Toolbar Search toolbar request 1
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware EarthLink Toolbar.EarthLink Toolbar hijacks IE autosearch function. It contacts its controlling server every time IE starts up and downloads update-to-date news information from the server. It also tracks user web activity, collects information, and delivers advertisements to the user.

NAME: Drive_Cleaner_1_0_111 Get log information
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of spyware Drive Cleaner 1.0.111. Drive Cleaner 1.0.111 is a misleading system cleaning program that can distribute itself from shady affiliates through an Active X control. The site displays exaggerated reports of security and privacy risks on a computer,and sets tracking cookies to adware sites.

NAME: EmailSpyPro
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware EmailSpyPro.EmailSpyPro is a keylogger software. It monitors user's email activities and sends exact copies of all outgoing emails to a predefined email address periodically.

NAME: FreeScratch get card
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of the spyware FreeScratchAndWin. FreeScratchAndWin hijacks IE settings, it changes the default home page of IE to www.xzoomy.com. FreeScratchAndWin also displays popup advertisements.

NAME: iMesh_Mediabar collect user information
DESCRIPTION: This signature detects the runtime behavior of iMesh Mediabar. iMesh Mediabar hijacks the Internet Explorer searches and dns error pages. NAME: Family Connections CMS Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Family Connections CMS is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in dev/less.php script and is due to the lack of proper filtering on HTTP parameters. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to execute arbitrary PHP commands. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: PmWiki pagelist.php Remote PHP Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: PmWiki 2.x before 2.2.35 is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in PageListSort function in scripts/pagelist.php due to the lack of proper sanitization of supplied HTTP parameters. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted PHP sequences in a crafted order parameter in a pagelist directive. A successful attack could lead to remote PHP code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Traq admincp common.php Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Traq 2.3 is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in admincp/common.php and is due to the lack of proper authorization checks while executing PHP code from other scripts. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to gain admin functionality and execute arbitrary PHP code. A successful attack could lead to remote PHP code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Splunk Search Request Remote Code Execution Vulnerabiliity
DESCRIPTION: Splunk 4.2.x before 4.2.5 is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is present in mappy.py in Splunk Web and is due to the lack of proper filtering of input parameters. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted mappy search command in HTTP request in order to execute Python code. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Plone and Zope Cmd Parameter Parsing Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Zope 2.12.x and 2.13.x, as used in Plone is prone to a command execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on cmd parameter passed through certain URIs. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted cmd parameter with shell commands in a HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Op5 Appliance Password Parameter Handling Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Op5 Appliance is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper sanitization of password parameter in a request to op5config/welcome. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to execute arbitrary shell commands. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Op5 Appliance Timestamp Parameter Handling Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Op5 Appliance is prone to a code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper sanitization of timestamp parameter in a request to license.php. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to execute arbitrary shell commands. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: vBSEO proc_deutf Function Parameter Parsing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: vBSEO versions 3.6.0 and below are prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper sanitization on char_repl parameter, used in preg_replace function. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability to inject PHP code by passing it to this parameter. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Horde 3.3.12 Backdoor Arbitrary PHP Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Horde 3.3.12 and Horder Groupware 1.2.11 contain a backdoor using which attackers could gain unauthenticated access. The vulnerability could be leveraged by passing PHP functions to the href parameter in a cookie in a HTTP request. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request by assigning specific values to app and file values. A successful attack could lead to remote PHP code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: LotusCMS Page Parameter Parsing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: LotusCMS is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted HTTP requests. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper sanitisation of parameters passed to the router function in core/lib/router.php. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted page parameter to index.php in a HTTP request. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the server.

NAME: Oracle Java SE Remote Java Runtime Environment Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Oracle JRE is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted .jar files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the JAR file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted JAR file or JNLP file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Oracle Java SE Remote Java Runtime Environment Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Oracle JRE is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted .jar files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the JAR file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted JAR file or JNLP file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.

NAME: Oracle Java IIOP Deserialization Type Confusion Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: Oracle JRE is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while parsing certain crafted .jar files. The vulnerability is due to the lack of proper checks on user input data in the JAR file, leading to an exploitable remote code execution. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted JAR file or JNLP file. A successful attack could lead to remote code execution with the privileges of the current logged-in user.
